loans.name: Rai Said

texts.es:
Rai es un joven de 19 años de edad, soltero, vive en la ciudad de Ica junto a su madre.
Es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora. Su mayor motivación es su madre por lo que día a día trabaja incansablemente para poder brindarle lo mejor y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja como Asesor de Ventas de Moto en una empresa prestigiosa de la zona donde reside y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y luchadora.
Rai está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado él podrá comprar una cocina para  su hogar, de esta manera sentirá mayor comodidad. Asimismo utilizará también esa ayuda para pagar sus estudios y   algunos materiales que le piden en la Universidad.
texts.en: Rai is a young 19 year old man who is single and lives in the city of Ica together with his mother. He is an enterprising and hardworking person. His greatest motivation is his mother who works tirelessly day by day to be able to afford him the best and improve his quality of life. For a year he has worked as a motorcycle sales consultant in a prestigious business in the zone where he lives, and he has done very well because he is a responsible and determined person. Rai is very thankful for the lenders of Kiva because of the support afforded he will be able to buy a stove for his home and in this way feel more comfortable. Additionally, he will use the help in order to pay for his studies and some of the materials that they request in the university.

loans.use: to buy a stove for greater comfort and to pay for school.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 24 years old and married. She has two children. She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She Helen has been fattening pigs for two years, and she earns additional income from a motorcycle transport business.

Helen is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Josefina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en: Agusta is 50 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Agusta works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, snack foods, etc. to sell.  Agusta has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, snack foods, etc.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, cooking oil, shampoo, snack foods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: Nonita is 39 years old and married with three children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Nonita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from a general store.  She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
“Everybody should be as beautiful and healthy as you can,” said Cheryl as she talked about her My Schweitzer Formula.

Cheryl was first introduced to My Schweitzer Formula by an older woman who had smooth, radiant skin. Invented by chemist Dr. L.E. Schweitzer in the early 1900s, the formula proved to be a simple and effective multi-purpose health solution for skin. This unique combination of all-natural zinc, boron and salicylate was used for treating burns, scarring and rashes, as well as promoting clear, healthy skin. Though popular throughout the first half of the century, this holistic formula was eventually overshadowed by the chemical-based, over-the-counter products promoted by large pharmaceutical companies.

An avid user of My Schweitzer Formula for the past ten years, Cheryl is proud of her youthful, clear skin and hopes to share this miracle product with the world. After re-branding the formula and packaging it for the 21st century, she sold it locally in San Diego for the past few years and has built a loyal customer base. She is finally ready to spread awareness of this product on a national scale, creating a website and hiring a digital marketing firm to help get the word out.  

She will use her $8,500 Kiva loan to invest in Internet marketing as well as produce more inventory to meet her growing sales.

Cheryl ultimately hopes to once again build public awareness for this holistic, natural solution to everyday skin care.  

Learn more about My Schweitzer Formula at: http://myschweitzerformula.com

loans.use: to invest in Internet marketing, as well as produce more inventory to meet her growing sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale to the local residents.

loans.name: Dixon

texts.es: Dixon, tiene la edad  de 37 años, está casado, vive con su esposa  que es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de obra en trabajos de asistencia para el café, además de comprar algunas plantas de almácigo para hacer resiembras a inicio de lluvias esto con el objetivo de aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Dixon is 37 years old, and he is married. He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority. With his loan, he intends to purchase fertilizers and fungicides, and pay wages for workers tending the coffee.  Additionally, he will buy some seedlings in order to replant when the rains begin, so that the plant density in the area will increase, taking advantage of the good soil, climate conditions, and other factors that favor coffee cultivation.

With these improvements to the coffee crops, he hopes to earn a little more, and thus improve the living conditions of his family, and accomplish some goals. This is the first loan that he has received from FUDESUCOR. He has not had other loans with state banks before, but FUDESCOR has made it easier for him to receive the loan; and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: tend his coffee crop.

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en: Eliseo, a father of three, operates their own farm for a living. For twelve years of farming, the couple has earned well enough to provide for the family. Eliseo works in his farm while taking responsibility for feeding their large cattle to sell in the future. He borrowed a loan to buy organic fertilizer in order to improve the farm as they have planned. In the future, he wants to ensure a better source of income to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is married with two children and helps her husband manage their own farm for a living.  She has been harvesting and selling bananas and vegetables and she earns well enough to support their needs. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy farm supplies.  She has to be determined in her work to give adequate allowances to her students.  She hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda, a mother of five, operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also vends snacks to earn extra income. For more than three years in running the business, she has earned well to support the needs of her children and has been able to sustain it.  Her husband earns an income from fishing.  She has borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus, a father of six, operates his family's own farm for a living. For many years of farming, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. He is working in his farm while taking responsibility for feeding their large cattle and chickens to sell in the future. His wife takes care of their pigs, too, in addition to her household chores.

He borrowed a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer in order to improve the farm as they have planned. It is their main source of income, so he has to ensure a gain in harvest in the near future. He wants to ensure a better home and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish constructing his house.

loans.name: Amihan

texts.en:
Amihan works hard to support her family. Amihan is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

Amihan requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Amihan would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 38 years old, married, and has three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been running the business for two years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Melinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melinda has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 42 years old and single.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from fruit and vegetable vending.

Anita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Anita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Anita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en: Honorata is 49 years old and married with ten children.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Honorata has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing and food vending. Honorata aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is 36 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Elvie works very hard to provide for them.

Elvie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, toothpaste, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Elvie has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, toothpaste, candies, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Engiel

texts.en:
Engiel is 32 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Engiel has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Engiel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan lives in Dilijan city. He is 38 years old. Vardan has no higher education. At a very young age, his father taught him farming skills, and until now he has been engaged in it. 

Near his house, he has plot of land on which he built a barn and here keeps two cows, a bull and two calves. Vardan is married, and he has a son of a year old, so his wife is very busy with their child care. Vardan organizes the sale of his farm products alone. He sells milk and meat from his farm to his already regular customers. Vardan dreams that he would have a richer farm with greater income from it.

He asks for this loan in order to buy two heifers, so it will allow him to sell more meat from his farm, with better income for his young and nice family.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to allow him to sell more meat from his farm for better income for his young and nice family

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Erlita is 46 years old and has five children who are currently in school.

Erlita has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Erlita requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Erlita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Erlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela works hard to support her family. Estela is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Estela requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Estela has been in this business for 13 years now.

Estela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 13 years.

Benjie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase more fish to sell.

Benjie would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 55 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Basilisa has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina, 32, is a married woman. She has five children, three of them currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a dried-fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Carina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

In the future, Carina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new air conditioner and other home appliances

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Hamest

texts.en:
Hamest is an agronomist living in Beniamin village of Shirak region. She lives there with her husband and two children, a 15-year-old son and a 17-year-old daughter. Hamest's elder son serves in the army. 

This family has been involved in agriculture for already 20 years. They keep a livestock of cow, calves, and chickens and they cultivate wheat, barley, potatoes and cucumbers. Hamest's husband and her son sell the gathered harvest in the local markets and that's the only source of family's income. 

The requested loan of USD 1,000 is highly important for Hamest to be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds and to rent agro machinery for land cultivation. This loan has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history. Please help this family to develop their agribusiness further.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds and to rent agro machinery for land cultivation.

loans.name: Shahanik

texts.en:
Shahanik is a hardworking woman from Garnarij village of Shirak region. She lives there with her husband and 20-year-old daughter. 

Shahanik is involved in animal husbandry. She keeps five cows, 22 calves, 19 sheep, piglets and 15 chickens. Shahanik sells the gathered milk and meat in local markets and that's the only source of family's income. 

The loan of USD 3,000 will be a very big support for Shahanik to purchase 10 calves and fuel for land cultivation needed for her farm. As this is Shahanik's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for 10 calves and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plant fertilizers that work through the leaves, and other items to help cultivate her coffee plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 33 years old, and he lives in Dilijan city. He has a nice wife and pretty daughter who is just a year old. Artur now studies in magistracy of Yerevan State University, and in the future, he will be a historian. Now, simultaneously with his education, he also works at the Dilijan police station in order to sustain his young family's needs. His wife is unemployed, and she takes care of their sweet child. 

Artur, before getting married, managed to repair his cute flat in order to provide his family with comfort, but still it is not completely furnished. Artur asks for this loan in order to buy nice furniture for their living room. He will be greatly thankful if he is being supported by Kiva's generous lenders.

loans.use: to buy nice furniture for his living room

loans.name: Dolores Francisco

texts.es: Es un hombre muy amable y luchador. Tiene 35 años de edad, casado, tiene un hijo, en edad escolar. Con el objetivo de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 8 años estableció su pulpería, en el corredor de su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos: granos básicos, materiales de limpieza, jugos, gaseosas, leche en polvo, verduras, papel higiénico, toalla sanitaria entre otros. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en: Dolores is a very friendly and a fighter. He is 35 years old, married and has one school aged son. With the objective of having his own source of income he opened a small store in the corridor of his house 8 years ago. He is requesting a loan to diversify his products buying basic grains, cleaning materials, juices, soft drinks, powered milk, vegetables, toilet paper, sanitary napkins amongst others. His dream is to expand his business and offer better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning materials, soft drinks, juices, powered milk, vegetables, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for a medical consult.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Sra. Fatima del Rosario habita en uno de los municipio de la ciudad por lo que tiene que viajar muy temprano a su centro de trabajo en una imprenta en la  cual se presenta desde las 7:30 am terminando sus labores a las 5:30 pm de lunes a sabado.
La sra Fatima solicita este credito a ceprodel y kiva para mejorar el techo de su casa de habitacion la cual se encuentra en mal estado y empezando la temporada del invierno quiere poder estar preparada y asi darle un mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia
texts.en:
Fatima de Rosario lives in one of the municipalities of the city so she needs to travel to her workplace at a printing press very early. She arrives at 7:30 and finishes work at 5:30 pm on Monday to Saturday. 
Fatima requested this loan from CEPRODEL and Kiva to improve the roof of her house which is in poor condition. She wants to be ready for the start of the winter season and to give a better quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to repair her roof

loans.name: Nyatwari Grp Group

texts.en:
Jesca, who is in her late 30s, is single with four children, three of them are st school and the other one is small. She has been running several businesses for four years now.  She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Jesca's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy more clothes, fish, and electronic money transfers. She dreams of building her own house.

Jesca will share this loan with her loan group "NYATWARI" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, fish, and electronic money transfers

loans.name: Apple Joy

texts.en: Apple Joy is 29 years of age, married and blessed with two siblings. She operates a motorcycle transport business to help her husband in generating income. Despite hardships, she and her husband aspire to become successful and financially stable in the future. To make their dream into reality, they work hand and hand to generate income. Apple Joy wants to continue using her motorcycle transport but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP30,000.00 to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She is hoping that her loan will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Tiessiri est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 3 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, Fruits et légumes, Produits Cosmétiques, Bois de chauffe  et divers.  . Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Sali est un membre du groupe Tièssiri arrêtée au bout  et à gauche, vendeuse de bois de chauffage. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  chargement des chargements de bois de chauffe en qualité et en quantité dans les brousses environnantes de Koutiala. Elle les vend en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Tièssiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Sali compte réaliser  95 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri Group is made up of women from Hamdallaye, who live in large, traditional families, with their husbands, children and other family members.  They are, on average, 28 years old, married and have three children.

The women sell various products, such as fruit and vegetables, cosmetic products, firewood, etc.  All the women want to increase the size of their businesses so they have decided to work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their first loan.

Sali (standing on the far left in the photo) is a group member, and she sells firewood.  She plans to use her loan to buy loads of high quality firewood from the countryside around Koutiala.  She will sell the wood to various customers for cash.  The other members of the group expect to earn an average profit of 70,000 francs CFA over the loan period, but Sali expects to earn 95,000 francs CFA.  In addition to repaying her loan, she will use part of her revenue to pay for personal expenses and increase her working capital.  

In the future, the women would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to guarantee their stock levels.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric and make outfits for resale.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy has been selling their farm products in their village to supplement her husband's income from employment. She sells fruits and vegetables in the market that she acquired from her neighbor.

To improve and expand her farm is her plan and she borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy farm inputs like organic fertilizer and seeds. She wants to ensure a better source of income for the family. Mary Joy hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like organic fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita has been selling their farm products like copra in town to supplement her husband's income from working as a construction worker. Her children were going to study in their elementary grades and she had to earn for their needs. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase organic fertilizer. She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family. Angelita hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her business retailing meat in the market. For many years in the meat business, she was able to put up money in savings for her farm. Yet, it is not enough for the production, though it helps a lot in preparing their farm for the season. She took a new loan, to purchase fertilizer in order to improve the farm. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a 42-year-old divorced lady with one boy, aged 21 years old. She has been operating a dressmaking shop for five years, earning herself an income of 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) every month.

Jecinta was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000; she intends to use this amount to expand her business by adding more stock of materials to improve her business.
 
She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business and provide full support to her family by building a permanent house. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy more fabric materials

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.en: Nazaria operates a farm, growing and harvesting flowers for sale. Aside from this, she also has a rice farm that contributes much for her needs. For nine years in helping, she earns a better income for the family. To improve the farm, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy fertilizer to be used for the rice farm. She hopes to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to be used for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to get to work.

loans.name: April Rose

texts.en:
April Rose is 31 years old, married, and has two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. 

April Rose requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, cream, etc.

April Rose has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

April Rose aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, cream, etc.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea works hard to support her family. Aurea is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Aurea has been in this business for 40 years now.

Aurea requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goods like soft drinks, beers, candies, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. to sell.

Aurea would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods like soft drinks, beers, candies, sanitary pads, diapers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase ingredients like flour, meat, spices, etc., for her food-production business.

Marilou has been in this business for 37 years. Marilou earns more income from a general store.

Marilou has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like flour, meat, spices, etc., for her food-production business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bundles of used clothes to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Grace would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Rene

texts.en:
Rene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, and noodles for her food production business.

Rene has been in this business for 5 years. Rene earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rene has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell dried goods in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Gevorg

texts.en:
Gevorg, as he used to, still runs his shoe-repairing craft in a rented stall near a Vanadzor wholesale market. Gevorg, first of all, greatly thanks lenders for his first Kiva loan. He says that by the help of that loan, he bought a shoe-making machine and some raw materials for his work.

Unfortunately, lately Gevorg fell down and broke his arm. For a long time it was in gypsum (a cast), so for a long period until now he has not been able to work. Fortunately, his wife is employed (she is a saleswoman), and during these months she has been earning their living. Now Gervorg, after breaking his arm, must undergo a course of healing massage. This is rather expansive, considering their family’s small income.

Gevorg hopes that this time, Kiva lenders will help him to pay for his massages, and he will finally be back to his work. Gevorg hopes that this loan amount will be enough, both for his healing massages and, if some money is left, he will buy some raw materials for his craft and restart working in his stall.

loans.use: to pay for his physical therapy and some raw materials to restart his business

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en: Mousa is 23 years old. He lives with his family of 10 members, in a sector in Jordan called Mafraq. He works in the evenings at a health care center. Now Mousa is facing a financial crisis, which is not helping him pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to cover his study fees

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is a 51-year-old married woman. Her husband is a retired man. Aisha started selling blankets at her house one year ago in order to help her husband improve their living conditions. Her business was their second source of income and was profitable to them. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase a new collection of clothes for the upcoming season to raise her sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Pushkin

texts.en:
This is Pushkin, being photographed in the animals' stable with his four cows. He wants this loan to add two more cows. The raw milk from the cows he sells to a nearby organic dairy farm that works only with milk from cows untreated with medicine. The yogurt made in this farm is 100% bio and made in a very primitive way. In addition to caring for the livestock, Pushkin plants fodder for his cows in the agricultural land that he owns.

Pushkin is a 41-year-old, married father of three. His oldest child is 11 years old, and the youngest one is 1 year old.

Pushkin’s livestock is the only source of income for the entire family. Knowing how responsible he is, he promises that he will pay back the loan like the previous one he had with the VFA.

loans.use: to add two more milk cows

loans.name: Council Group

texts.en:
Nengneikim is a determined and hard-working woman. She hails from Churachandpur, 62 km away from the city Imphal in Northeast state of India. She is the featured member of Council group, pictured with her hand raised. 

After her mother’s death, Nengneikim, being the eldest daughter, assumed  the entire responsibility for the family upon her shoulders. She is 32 years old and still single. Nengneikim has four brothers and three sisters. Two of her younger siblings are married. Her younger brother and his family live in the capital state to earn their living.  The group members appointed Nengneikim as the group leader as she is reliable and active and would do anything to bring economic changes for the team.

Nengneikim and her father are the only breadwinners of the family. Her father works as a laborer in a neighboring village and earns wages on a daily basis. In order to supplement the family income, Nengneikim started a business using her own weaving expertise. She uses the hand loom method of weaving. She produces traditional wrap–around skirts with colorful patterns and designs. Her weaving is well known in the locality. It usually takes a week to complete one wrap-around skirt and she then sells the finished products to distributors for 3000 INR to 4000 INR per wrap-around skirt. With the profits she gets, she pays the school fees of her younger siblings and she uses the little amount left in maintaining the household affairs. 

Nengneikim  is very happy with the progress she has made in her business. She wanted to continue her weaving at night for longer hours to speed up her work in order to increase her production, however, having no access to regular electricity supply in the village has hampered her work pace. After 6 pm she could not continue weaving due to insufficient illumination. 

Therefore, Nengneikim wants to access a Kiva loan for a solar home lighting system which is generally an excellent option regarding saving extra expenditures on alternative home lighting such as kerosene, candle, petromax etc. Solar lamps are eco-friendly; they are the most unconventional method to illuminate the house and the best way to safeguard her siblings from damaging their eyesight as they usually study after dark using candles or lamplight. 

Likewise, the rest of the group members also need a solar home lighting system for their family use and for income-generating activities.

loans.use: To buy a solar home lighting system to be installed in handloom house so she can weave longer hours at night.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
Дилрабо жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая девушка  в возрасте 19 лет. Она пока еще не замужем. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама Дилрабо живёт со своими родителями в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Дилрабо занимается своим делом. Она швея. Шьет платья на заказ. Также Дилрабо шьет на заказ свадебные наряды для невест.  От данного дела она получает хороший доход. Сейчас Дилрабо хочет приобрести новую швейную машинку. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку швейной машинки. Дилрабо очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Dilrabo is a happy and hardworking girl at the age of 19. She is not yet married. She turned to Arvand for the first time because she learned that it was possible to get financial support. Dilrabo lives with her parents in a village. She does not have higher education as it was not possible for her to study at the university due to her family's financial issues. 

In order to have an income for food, Dilrabo has her own business. She is a seamstress. She sews dresses on order. Dilbaro also sews wedding dresses. She receives a good income from this. 

Currently Dilrabo would like to purchase a new sewing machine. Therefore, she turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase a sewing machine. Dilrabo hopes very much for a positive result, and thanks Arvand in advance,

loans.use: to buy  a sewing machine

loans.name: Pearson C Group

texts.en:
This is Pearson (C) Group, comprised of eight tribal women. They all live in a small town on the outskirts of Churachandpur in Manipur state, which is in the northeastern part of India. They came together as a group to access a loan in order to create income activities for themselves. Tinkholhing is the group leader pictured with raised hand. She is 47 years old and is the mother of an only daughter. Her husband is a retired army pensioner. The family source of income is very limited. Therefore, in order to supplement the family income, Tinkholhing started a business using her weaving expertise. She usually weaves traditional garments like wrap-around skirts and shawls. 

She can weave at least three to four wrap-around skirts in a month and supplies the finished garments to retailers from the main city Imphal, for bigger profit and faster sale. She sells the finished product to the retailers for 2500-3000 INR. 

With the profits, she buys yarn of different colors and textures to continue weaving and manages to support her daughter's education better. 
However, the irregular electric supply in the town is a hurdle to income-generating people. After sunset, Tinkholhing cannot continue weaving due to insufficient lighting; this hampers her productivity and slows down her work. Therefore, she wants to access a solar loan for a lighting system to be installed in the house. Since it’s cheaper than conventional electricity, one can enjoy some amount of power savings on electricity bills. It can provide a better study environment for her daughter, too.    
 
The rest of the group members also need a solar loan for their respective activities and household use. The group members' activities can be classified as weaving, grocery store, and tea stall, etc.

loans.use: To buy a 45-watt mini solar home lighting system so she can weave for longer hours at night.

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Timinadia  est un regroupement de femmes du Hamdallaye de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent et qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 4 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les colliers, les Condiments, Produits Cosmétiques, Bois de chauffage, Tissus  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt de groupe. 
Awa est un membre du groupe Timinadia assise, deuxième personne de gauche à droite, vendeuse de produits cosmétiques et des colliers. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des colliers et  des produits cosmétiques (Pommade, Savon, Crème et savons.) en qualité et en quantité aux marchés   de Koutiala. Elle les vend en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Timinadia comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 100 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  105 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Timinadia Group is made up of women from Hamdallaye in the town of Koutiala.  The women all know one another and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members.  They are, on average, 44 years old, married and have at least four children.

The women sell products such as necklaces, food ingredients, cosmetic products, firewood and fabric.  As they would all like to increase the size of their businesses, the women work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their third group loan.

Awa (sitting second from the left in the photo) is a member of the Timinadia Group.  She sells cosmetic products and necklaces.  She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of high quality necklaces and cosmetic products (ointment, soap, cream, etc) at the markets in Koutiala.  She will resell them for cash to various customers.

The other members of the group expect to earn an average profit of 100,000 francs CFA over the loan period, whereas Awa expects to earn 105,000 francs CFA.  In addition to repaying her loan, Awa will use her earnings to pay for personal expenses and increase the working capital of her business.  All the women would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso to guarantee their stock levels in the future.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and necklaces for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of products to innovate soup selling strategies.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
Jose es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Subtanjalla junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 2 años trabaja como Operario de Construcción prestando servicios a diferentes Maestros e Ingenieros de Obra.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante, trabajador, emprendedor, que busca apoyar a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Jose está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar algunos muebles para su hogar como cama y colchón para que pueda sentir mayor comodidad y así continúe trabajando como lo está haciendo hasta ahora, con el mismo empeño, para poder cumplir sus metas; de esta manera más adelante podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: “Tener su propia Constructora”
texts.en:
Jose is a young entrepreneurial man of 20 years of age. He lives in the district of Subtanjalla together with his family. For every two years, he has worked as a construction operator, lending his services to different masters of labor and engineers. He is a person who has a strong desire to get ahead. He is a hard worker who is looking to help his family and improve their quality of life. 

Jose is very grateful to Kiva lenders because this support offered to him will allow him to buy some pieces of furniture for his home such as a bed and mattress so he will feel more comfortable. This way, he will continue working as he has been with the same effort so that he will achieve his goals. In the future, he will achieve his biggest dream: to have his own construction company.

loans.use: to buy a bed and mattress for more comfort.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food ingredients and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Ma. Gudula

texts.en: She is from Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old, married and has one child. In order to have her own source of income, seven years ago, she helped her husband operate their own farm for a living. She also sells cosmetics via catalog. She is asking for her loan to increase her production and buy organic fertilizer. In the future, Ma. Gudula wants to improve the general living of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 73 years old and widowed; she works very hard to save for the future.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc.

Cecilia has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future Cecilia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc

loans.name: Ma. Isabelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Isabelita works hard to support her family. She has a vehicle transport business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from frozen foods vending.

Ma. Isabelita is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle.

Ma. Isabelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream -- to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her vehicle

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Suzette requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Suzette has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Suzette would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more gorceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en: Sahar is a conservative lady, so she asked her daughter to take her place in the picture. Sahar was born in 1964. She is married and a mother of five sons and daughters. She has been selling accessories and embroidered products at her own shop with the help of the daughter appearing in the photo. Now she is seeking a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of accessories and the needed raw materials for embroidery.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and buy the needed materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is 51 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. She lives with her retired father and with her daughter. Nataliya graduated from Tbilisi Pedagogical State Institute, faculty of Russian Language and Literature. Now she has over 29 years of pedagogical experience and till now she works at a school as a teacher of Russian Language and Literature. She also helps pupils to get prepared for the entrance examination. 

Nataliya is very kind, patient and an interesting person. She does her work with care and great responsibility, since she realizes that her duty is to educate the children on whose education quality the future of the nation depends.
 
Nataliya wants to be aware of any innovation in the field she works in, and for this reason, she is asking for a loan to buy a computer and some professional literature, the use of which may make her lessons more interesting and attractive for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some professional literature to use with her pupils

loans.name: Potenciana

texts.en:
Potenciana is 45 years old and married with three children.

Potenciana works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy more household goods to sell such as soap, shampoo, spices, canned goods, sugar, etc.

Potenciana has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 24 years and also earns an income from selling fruits.

Potenciana aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell such as soap, shampoo, spices, canned goods, sugar, etc

loans.name: Marjolyn

texts.en: Marjolyn is 32 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy household goods to sell like laundry soap, milk, coffee, chips, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. Marjolyn has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane. She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy household goods to sell like laundry soap, milk, coffee, chips, soft drinks, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Ben Salma Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ben Salma. It consists of four women from Mokala, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB.

Fatima is a 50-year-old, married woman with three children.  Her oldest child is 27 years old and the youngest one is 18 years old. She is the leader of the group. She lives with her children in their own house in Mokala. In order to help her husband with the expenses of the family, Fatima has started selling food and ice cream in the streets under the sunshine. The income from this business is very small and it is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. As a result, Fatima is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of food and sweets for resale to the local residents in her area. Fatima looks forward to renovating her house from the inside. She hopes to expand her business more through opening a grocery in her area in order to make a secure future for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more of food and sweets for resale to the local residents in her area.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila was born in 1971. She is a married woman and a mother of six sons and daughters. Laila has been working to provide her children with a better life by being a second source of income for the family. 

Laila has been selling home products and house decorations at her house for one year. Now she is seeking a loan to purchase more home products after she has sold the ones she had.

loans.use: To purchase more home products to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Badeya est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko(Sossorobougou) de la ville de Koutiala qui   vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 2 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de Fruits et légumes, Savons, Habillements, Bananes, Condiments   et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Aichata est un membre du groupe Badeya assise au bout  et à gauche, vendeuse des Condiments (piment, sel, gombo, aubergines, cube maggi etc). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure  des condiments nécessaires pour une bonne cuisine. Elle s’approvisionne à Koutiala et  vend ces condiments en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Badeya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 75 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Aichata compte réaliser  90 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Badeya is a group of women from the Koko neighbourhood (Sossorobougou) of the town of Koutiala.  They live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members.  They are, on average, 28 years old, married and have at least two children.

The women sell various products such as fruit and vegetables, soap, clothing, bananas and food ingredients.  All the women want to expand their businesses so they have decided to start working with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso. 

Aichata (sitting on the far left in the photo) is a member of the Badeya Group.  She sells food ingredients (chillies, salt, okra, aubergines, Maggi stock cubes, etc).  She plans to use her loan, a little at a time, to buy the ingredients needed to make good food.  She buys her supplies in Koutiala, and retails them for cash to various customers.  While the other members of the group expect to make an average profit of 75,000 francs CFA over the loan period, Aichata expects to earn 90,000 francs CFA.  In addition to repaying her loan, Aichata will use her earnings to pay for personal expenses and increase her working capital.  

The women would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to guarantee their stock levels in the future.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Dermalila

texts.es: La señora Dermalila, casada madre ya no tiene hijos a su cargo, habitante del municipio de San Juan de la Concepción, tiene como actividad comercial la venta de Ropa, Cazuelas para cocinar, Ropas de Camas, ella solicita este crédito para la compra de Mercadería, ya que su clientela a aumentado un poco y quiere aprovechar las ventas para obtener mayores ganancias, muy agradecida doña Dermalila con Kiva y Afodenic por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan
texts.en: Dermalila is a married mother who no longer has dependent children. She is a resident of the town of San Juan de la Concepción. She has a business selling clothing, cooking pans, and bedclothes. She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise. Her clientele has increased slightly and wants to use this loan to gain further sales. She is grateful to Kiva and AFODENIC for the new opportunity they are providing for her.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Doña Maria Elsa, labora la tierra desde hace muchos años, ella es agricultora prácticamente toda su vida, actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de Fertilizantes, Abonos como: Triple, Urea, Completo para dar mantenimiento a media Manzana de Piña quien estableció el año pasado y así aprovechar el temporal de Lluvia para que su abono se introduzca mas a la cosecha, agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Maria Elsa has worked the land for many years. She has been a farmer most of her life. Now, she is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers and manure such as Triple, Urea, and Completo for taking care of her field of pineapples that she planted last year. She wants to take advantage of the temporary rain because the fertilizer will help her harvest more pineapples. She is grateful for the support given to her from Kiva and AFODENIC.

loans.use: to fertilize her pineapple field

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy new chairs and tables for her chips business and an aluminium cupboard to store cosmetics.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en: Josefina  has successfully repaid her previous loan. For more than seven years, her business enabled her to provide for her family's basic needs. With the generated income from nipa (palm frond) selling, she started a retail store to earn a larger profit. To buy additional grocery goods to sell, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit. In the future, Josefina wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Yeghishe

texts.en:
Yeghishe is twenty-six years old. He lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. He is married and has a son. Eghishe has vocational education and now he works at a private workshop and also runs a farm with his parents’ help. In his farm he has four pigs, ten bee hives and sixty chickens. He loves his farm and he does all the work connected with the farm with pleasure and care. His father taught him this attitude. The results of his hard work are high quality honey, pork and eggs, which he sells from his house with the help of his mother. Yeghishe says that he has decided to increase the number of pigs he has, as he would like to specialize in swine breeding.

Yeghishe requests a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a new sort of pig, which will in future have piglets, and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: to buy a pig of a new sort, which will have in future piglets of a new and better sort, and also fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana lives with her mother in Vanadzor city in the Lori region of Armenia. She has a graduate degree in accounting and she currently has a job in this field. Liana’s mother is retired and has some health problems, so Liana’s salary is just enough for her mother’s care and for their everyday needs. Liana has a dream of repairing her flat to make it brighter and more comfortable for their small family, but it is impossible to spend so much at this moment. 
Liana is hoping to get this loan in order to start the repairing of her flat, since the conditions with which they live now are far from being pleasant and comfortable.

loans.use: to start repairing her flat, since the conditions in which they live now are far from being pleasant and comfortable.

loans.name: Pepe

texts.es:
Pepe es un hombre de 52 años, que vive en Yarinacocha junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 06 años se dedica al servicio de pintado de vehículos menores (motos, mototaxis y carros), tiene muchos clientes porque ofrece un buen servicio y al mejor precio.
Es una persona trabajadora, alegre, entusiasta que día a día lucha para poder sacar adelante a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Pepe está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su apoyo brindado él podrá comprar calaminas para terminar de construir su casa y así su familia sienta mayor comodidad y seguridad; de esta manera, seguirá trabajando arduamente para que más adelante pueda cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propio taller”.
texts.en:
Pepe is a 52-year-old man who lives in Yarinacocha with his family.

For more than 6 years, Pepe has dedicated himself to painting smaller vehicles (motorcycles, motorcycle-taxis and cars). He has many customers because he offers good service at the best price.

Pepe is a hard-working, happy, enthusiastic person who day after day struggles to be able to advance his family and improve his quality of life. 

Pepe is grateful to Kiva lenders because with their offer of help, he will be able to buy corrugated iron sheets to finish constructing his house, and his family will feel more comfortable and secure. As a result, he can continue working arduously so that, in the future, he can realize his grand dream: “To have his own shop.”

loans.use: to buy corrugated iron sheets to finish constructing his house.

loans.name: Saneka

texts.en:
Saneka is a 34-year-old housewife from the village of Altagram in Dhupguri.  She lives with her husband Kanteshwar and two children.  Her children are students in grades 8 and 9. She is illiterate and can just sign her name, while her husband is a 48-year-old farmer who attended school up to grade 8.

Her husband is a farmer, cultivates different types of vegetables, and sells them in the local market. Being a housewife, she manages all household work and then assists her husband in the farmland. Both of them work very hard to take care of their family.

Now they have decided to cultivate ribbed gourd in summer in their farmland as an additional vegetable. Saneka thinks this will be a lucrative business because ribbed gourd has a great demand in her area. Most people cook delicious dishes with ribbed gourd. She has taken the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase ribbed gourd seeds and fertilizers to start cultivation as early as possible.  She is very hopeful to earn profit from this new business, which will help her to reach her goals of giving a decent lifestyle to her family, educating her children to establish them in life, and in future she dreams of building a concrete house.

Saneka and her husband are very much thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for giving them this loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure and pesticides for cultivating ribbed gourd in her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more ready-made clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her coffee crops during this new season.

loans.name: Tropangi 3 Group

texts.en:
Chona is the featured representative of Tropangi 3 group. She and the other group members left their home country of the Philippines to seek better work opportunities in Lebanon. All the members of the group have been best friends since they arrived to work in Lebanon, and now they have decided to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua with the hope of improving their lives.
Chona is a 43-year-old divorced mother of three. Her husband left her so she's been supporting her children alone, which has brought on a number of financial struggles. Kiva's trustworthy partner Al Majmoua is her only hope for sending some money to the Philippines to better provide for her children back home. She misses them a lot and she hopes to join them soon again. Chona is wearing the white top in the photo. The other members of the group are Marivic in the middle and Nancy on the far left side.

loans.use: to send some money to the Philippines to better provide for her children back home.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 23-year-old woman from Jabalia city. She is divorced and has lived alone in a small house for the past two years. Fatmeh has been working as a wedding photographer. It is a good business but the income is not stable due to fluctuating demand. Fatmeh is also a student at a local college where she studies graphic design. She would like to finish her degree and improve her photography career.
Fatmeh requested a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her classes. With this loan, Fatmeh will be able to use specific programs for graphic design and will also use it for her job as a photographer. 
Fatmeh appears in the photo with her laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her graphic design program.

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
Badegna est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui se connaissent et qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 5 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, Fruits et légumes, Savons, Habillements, Essence  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.  
Awa est un membre du groupe Badegna assise au bout et à gauche, fabricante et vendeuse  de Savon. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure des volumes d’huile auprès des usines concernées pour en faire  du savon en qualité et en quantité. Elle les vend en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse aux marchés de Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Badegna comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Awa compte réaliser  115 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Badegna is a group of women from the Hamdallaye neighbourhood of Koutiala.  They all know one another and live in large, traditional families with their husbands, children and other family members.  They are, on average, 40 years old, married and have at least five children.

The women sell various products such as fruit and vegetables, soap, clothing and fuel.  In order to expand their businesses, they work with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be their second group loan.

Awa (sitting on the far left in the photo) is a member of the Badegna Group.  She makes and sells soap.  Over time, she plans to use her loan to buy oil from the factories in order to make large quantities of high quality soap.  She will retail her soap for cash, to various customers at the markets in Koutiala.

While the other members of the group expect to earn an average profit of 105,000 francs CFA over the loan period, Awa expects to earn 115,000 francs CFA.  In addition to repaying her loan, Awa will use her earnings to pay for personal expenses and increase her working capital.

The women would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to guarantee their stock levels in the future.

loans.use: to buy soap for resale.

loans.name: Reyna Isaura

texts.es: Doña Reyna, continua con su negocio, venta de Ropa de Segunda Mano, este crédito lo solicita para comprar una paca de Ropa Premium y una paca de Zapatos, ella esta muy feliz por que sus ganancias han ido incrementado por eso desea invertir mas en el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Reyna continues with her business selling second-hand clothing. She is requesting this loan to buy premium clothing and shoes in bulk. She is very happy because her earnings have been increasing, which is why she wishes to invest more in the business to help her husband with their household expenses. She thanks the support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided to her.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Laarni

texts.en: Laarni is a mother of three. To make a living, she manages her own farm with the help of her husband. For five years, she has earned a good income that allows her to support the needs of her children. She took a loan from GDMPC to purchase new varieties of seeds and fertilizer. She hopes to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Raymund

texts.en:
Raymund is a married man with one child. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a farm that serves as their main source of income. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His farm is located in a good area . He describes his biggest business challenge as the changes in season.

He will use his loan to redeem his farm, buying farm inputs and covering cultivation costs. His business goal is to own an additional farm. He hopes that in the future he will be able to provide for his child's education.

loans.use: to redeem his farm, buy farm inputs, and pay for cultivation costs.

loans.name: Greis

texts.es:
Greis es una joven de 23 años de edad, que vive en el Distrito de Calleria junto a su esposo y sus dos pequeños hijos.
Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta del producto Aguaje y sus derivados como lo son la aguajina y grano de aguaje, también elabora chupetes de aguaje y los ofrece a sus clientes.
A su corta edad se ha convertido en una mujer exitosa porque ofrece productos de la mejor calidad y a un precio cómodo.
Ella tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y por eso trabaja incansablemente para brindar a sus hijos un mejor futuro y una mejor calidad de vida.
Greis está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con su apoyo brindado ella podrá arreglar el puesto donde ofrece sus productos para así brindar una mejor atención a los clientes; de esta manera, al obtener mayores ingresos ahorrará su dinero para más adelante cumplir su más grande sueño: “Comprar su terreno para construir su casa”.
texts.en:
Greis is a 23 year old who lives in the Calleria District with her husband and two young children.  For the past three years, she has been selling Aguaje (a local fruit) and its derivatives such as juice and powdered aguaje.  She also produces suckers made from aguaje and sells them to her customers.

At her young age, she has become a successful woman because she offers the best quality products and an affordable price.

She is eager to get ahead and for this she works tirelessly to give their children a better future and a better quality of life.

Greis is grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan because with it she can fix the stand where she offers her products in order to provide better service to customers.  In this manner, she can earn a higher income, save her money for the future, and fulfill her greatest dream: "Buying land to build my house."

loans.use: to remodel her food stand for the convenience of her customers.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Ruben es un hombre con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es natural de San Martin y vive en una casa junto a su esposa.
Este hombre emprendedor desde hace más de 5 años trabaja como Agricultor, alquila 2 hectáreas de terreno y tiene como cultivo el Arroz. Sale desde muy temprano a trabajar para que la siembra sea de la mejor calidad, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación hace que su producto sea uno de los más pedidos en el mercado.
Ruben está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus cultivos hasta la época de la cosecha y así sus productos serán de mejor calidad. De esta manera con más ventas ahorrará para más adelante poder cumplir su sueño: “Comprar su propio terreno agrícola”.
texts.en:
Ruben is a man who is eager to get ahead. He is a native of San Martin where he lives in a house with his wife.
This enterprising man has been a farmer for over 5 years. He rents 2 acres of land and cultivates rice. He goes to work very early so that his crops will be of the highest quality. Hard work and dedication makes his product one of the most requested in the market.
Ruben is very grateful to Kiva lenders because of the support they have give him. He can maintain his crops until harvest time so that his produce will be of better quality and, therefore, he can have more sales, save, and fulfill his dream to buy his own agricultural land.

loans.use: to maintain his rice crops

loans.name: Jeralyn

texts.en:
Jeralyn is 26 years old and has three children. Jeralyn is married and two of her children are still in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Jeralyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Jeralyn has been raising livestock for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is sixty years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Estrella has been in this business for thirty years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, candies, milk, juice, snack foods, soft drinks, sanitary pads and diapers. 

Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Suheir

texts.en: Suheir was born in 1952. She is a married woman living in a sector in Jordan called Marka. Her husband is a truck driver. Suheir has been helping her husband in paying their household expenses by selling antiques and housewares from their home. She started this business five years ago. Now she is seeking a loan that will help her expand the number of products she sells and do some marketing for her business.

loans.use: to buy more antiques and housewares to sell.

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita is a married woman and is blessed with four children.  Kabita attended school up to class V (grade 5). She lives with her husband Amulya and four sons in the small village of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri, in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw).  Their sons are students in grade 5, 9 and 10.

Kabita's husband is engaged in agricultural business. He has a farmland where he grows different kinds of vegetables. He sells his products in the local market and earns for their livelihood.  

As the prices of essential goods are growing day by day, it is impossible for him to bear all the expenses of their family. Kabita, being a housewife, is very energetic and hard-working.  She is determined to help her husband financially. She started a milk and milk products supply business a few years back. Her neighbors are her main customers.

Now the demand for milk and milk products is growing day by day.  So Kabita has taken a loan to purchase another dairy cow to grow her business as well as to satisfy the demand of her customers.  

She hopes her business will give her extra financial assistance to run her family smoothly. Kabita plans to invest the profit in further propagation of the number of cows, so as to further extend her business so that she will be able to give a decent lifestyle to her family. She dreams of building a pacca house (brick-built) for them with the profit from her business.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply and dairy products business.

loans.name: Ebtisam

texts.en: Ebtisam was born in 1980. She is a married woman who lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Karak with her husband who works as a security man and her four sons and daughters. Ebtisam has been helping her husband in covering their children's needs by selling detergents and shampoo at her house for two years. Now she is receiving a larger number of requests from her customers. For that, she is seeking a loan to expand the number of her products and to raise her profit.

loans.use: To buy more detergents to resell

loans.name: Rana

texts.en: Rana was born in 1984. She is married and a mother of one son. Rana started running her beauty salon three years ago where she practiced her hobby. She turned her hobby into a source of income that will help in improving her living conditions. She is now seeking a youth loan to purchase more cosmetic products and accessories for her business in order to do it professionally and to raise her profit.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetic products and accessories for her business

loans.name: Neysi Nanci

texts.es:
El Jicaral es un pequeño Municipio donde existen personas emprendedoras, con deseo de superar en su vida, es aquí donde habita la joven Neysi Nanci

Neysi Nanci  Es una joven de 22 años de edad Soltera, no tiene hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana ayuda se ayuda en sus gastos personales. 
 
Trabaja en la alcaldía municipal teniendo 3 años de laborar bajo el cargo de Promotora, hoy en día es de su deseo tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda. 

Se siente a gusto ser asalariada, pero su salario no le da para poder tener mejores condiciones en su vivienda, por lo que tomo la decisión de solicitarle a Kiva y Ceprodel un pequeño crédito para la compra de una Refrigeradora, ayudando a mejorar las condiciones de su vida. 

 
Ella considera que esto sería de gran importancia por lo que ayuda a mantener con mejor cuido los alimentos que consume y los de su mamita que habita en la misma vivienda.
Espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudan mucho.
texts.en:
El Jicaral is a small town with entrepreneurial people that wish to get ahead in life. This is where Neysi Nanci lives. 

She is 22 years old and does not have children to take care of. She pays for her personal expenses with the little she earns.

She has worked for three years at city hall as a promoter. Currently, her wish is to improve her living conditions. 

She is glad to be employed, but her salary is not enough to improve her living conditions. This is why she took the decision to ask Kiva and Ceprodel for a small loan to buy a refrigerator, which would improve her living conditions. 

She considers that this would be of great importance, as it would allow her to better maintain the food that her and her mom (who lives with her) consume.

She hopes that God will allow her to continue receiving the privilege of Kiva loans, as they help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Julia Emma

texts.es:
La Joven Julia Emma habita en el municipio de Jicaral departamento de león, un municipio donde los habitantes se dedican a brindar sus servicios como asalariados.
