La señora Julia Emma tiene 48 años de edad casado, cuenta con dos hijito bajo su cargo, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, produce Maíz, trigo y frijoles, con lo poco que el produce ayuda al sustento diario de su hogar, y ella como es de sus ingresos el salario ayuda a mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.  

Desde hace veinte años ejerce el trabajo como conserje en el centro de salud, pero son de sus sueños tener mejores condiciones en su familia, se dio la oportunidad de conocer a Kiva y Ceprodel a través de una de las promociones que se ofertaron.

Por tal razón se vio en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de: Zinc, Arena, Cemento y Ladrillo.    Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie por primera vez este crédito, apara mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho en el desarrollo de una mejor vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Young Julia Emma lives in the town of Jicaral in the Leon district, a town where the people are dedicated to providing their services as employees.

Julia Emma is 48 years old, married, and has two son under her care. Her husband is a farmer and grows corn, wheat and beans. The little income from that takes care of the daily needs of the home. And with her income as wages, she helps to improve their housing conditions.

For twenty years, she has worked as a janitor at the health center. But her dreams are to have better conditions for her family. She took the opportunity to find out about Ceprodel and Kiva through one of the promotions that were offered.

For this reason she is requesting a loan for the purchase of galvanized sheet metal, sand, cement and brick. She has a great need for Ceprodel and Kiva to finance her first loan to improve her housing conditions.

She is happy with her work because she has helped a lot in the making of a better life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, sand, cement and brick.

loans.name: Luzvania Isabel

texts.es:
La Joven Luzvania Isabel habita en el municipio del Jicaral departamento de león, una ciudad donde existen diversas actividades comerciales.

Luzvania Isabel Es una joven de 37 años de edad Madre soltera con 2 hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus hijos que tanto ama y estima. 

Desde hace tres años ejerce el trabajo como farmacéutica en uno de los centro de salud del estado, pero son de sus sueños tener una vida mejor con sus hijitos. 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie un crédito, para la compra de: Zinc, clavos y madera esto lo ve de gran importancia para mejorar el techo de su vivienda ya que en etas temporada le afectan mucho las fuertes lluvias. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho con su familia y a podido ir comprando materiales para la construcción hoy en día tiene gracias a Dios y A su Trabajo su pequeña vivienda.

Comenta que ahora que logro conocer a Kiva y ceprodel se le abren nuevas puerta para poder mejorar su vivienda y espera en dios que estas instituciones le brinden el apoyo necesario
texts.en:
The young woman Luzvania Isabel lives in the town of Jicaral in the Department of León, where there are various commercial activities.
Luzvania Isabel is a young 37-year-old single mother with two children under her care. What little she earns barely helps maintain a livelihood for her children who she holds with both love and esteem.
For three years, she has worked in a pharmacy in one of the state-run health centers but she dreams of a better life with her babies
It is her great need for CEPRODEL and Kiva to fund the purchase of metal, nails, and wood because it is very important for her to improve the roof of her home that will is very affected by the arrival of the season of heavy rains.
She is comfortable in her job because it has helped her family a lot. She will buy these building materials today because thanks to God and her job, she has a small house. 
She says that the opportunity to know Kiva and CEPRODEL will open a new door to enhance her home. She hopes in God that these institutions will provide her with the support she needs.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to repair her roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 54-year-old married mother of two children, who are enrolled in a private school. Her husband has a cellular phone and accessories shop. She established a bread bakery 15 years ago in an effort to help make her family more financially comfortable. Salma has learned this profession from her mother, who taught her the art of bread making well. At first, she faced some difficulties in building a good reputation and clientele, since the regional conditions were not stable enough to sustain profits.

This is Salma’s 7th loan cycle with Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua. She is acquiring a new loan to pay her car registration fees in order to provide her family with the transportation they need. Salma is an ambitious woman and her positive vision pushes her forward to explore more in her business endeavors.

loans.use: to pay car registration fees.

loans.name: Maryuri Melania

texts.es: Maryuri es comerciante desde hace más de 5 años, cuenta con buena clientela, su compañero de vida le ayuda con el negocio en tiempos libre, ya que él se desempeña como Guarda de Seguridad en una empresa privada, ambos han salido adelante con esfuerzo propios y desean lo mejor para su hijo de 8 años que estudia la primaria.  Doña Maryuri solicita este crédito con el ánimo de crecer en su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, comprará Arroz, repollo, carnes, utilizados para su negocio de venta de enchiladas, repochetas, carne asada, y tacos, esto le permitirá incrementar su ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en: Maryuri has been a merchant for over 5 years. She has good customers. Her life partner helps with the business in his free time. He serves as a security guard in a private company. Both have gotten ahead with their own efforts. They want the best for their 8-year-old son, a student in primary school. Maryuri is requesting this loan with the intention of expanding her business selling street food. She wants to buy rice, cabbage, and meat. She sells enchiladas, repochetas [Nicaraguan-style quesadilla-tacos], carne asada, tacos, and more. This loan will allow her to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her street food business

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en: Amanda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business in the Philippines selling kitchenware.  Amanda requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of kitchenware to sell.  She has been in this business for nine years now.  Amanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchenware to sell.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Viviana en su anterior credikiva, el que aplicó a sus dos negocios de venta de mercancias  y de preparación de alimentos.  Con esta inversión incrmentó sus inventarios y pudo cumplir las solicitudes de pedidos de su clientela. Con el incrmento de sus ingresos tambien mejoró parte de su vivienda y solo queda la otra mitad de la casa por adecuar. Viviana envia un mensaje de agradecimeinto a los finaciadores de Kiva y pide que sigan apoyando  a los microempresarios de la Costa Caribe , para ser los futuros empresarios. En la actualidad Viviana está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual compará ropa que tiene encargada, materias primas e insumos para preparar alimentos en harina de maíz y finalmente materiales constructivos para terminar de construír su vivienda.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Viviana with her former Kiva loan, which she applied to her two businesses - merchandise sales and food preparation. With that investment, she increased her inventory and was able to fill the orders requested by her clientele. With the increase in income, she also improved part of her home and there is only the other half of the house left to adjust.

Viviana sends a message of gratitude to the Kiva lenders and asks that they continue to support the micro-entrepreneurs of the Caribbean Coast in becoming the entrepreneurs of the future.

Currently, Viviana is applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy clothing that has been ordered from her, raw materials and supplies to make cornflour-based foods, and finally, construction materials to finish building her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing that has been ordered from her, raw materials and supplies to make cornflour-based foods, and finally, construction materials to finish building her home.

loans.name: Muneera

texts.en: Muneera is a 25-year-old married mother of two girls. Her husband is serving in the military. Muneera has been helping her husband to cover their daughters’ needs by selling blankets at her house for one year. Now she is seeking a youth loan to improve her business.  She will be buying a new collection of clothes to sell in order to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to improve her coffee crop.

loans.name: Souriya

texts.en:
Souriya is a 26-year-old married mother of two who was forced to quit school at the intermediate stage. She owns a grocery shop in her village and her nine years of experience in the field has given her great sales skills and has made her well appreciated by her neighbors and friends. At first she lacked a good source of income to stock her shop with the best products. Now Souriya is happy with the significant progress her shop has made.

Souriya has found Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to be a source of support. Her acquired YOUTH loan enables her to increase her business merchandise with special offer released items which will improve her financial situation, and develop her living. She hopes to make more progress in her business and better her livelihood.

loans.use: to increase her grocery merchandise

loans.name: Petrona  Ignacia

texts.es: La Sra petrona Ignacia es profesora docente de un colegio publico de la ciudad impartiendo clases a niños de entre 10 a 14 años desde hace 27 años, siendo una madre preocupada por la educacion de sus hijos esta solicitando este credito para la compra de una computadora que necesita su hijo para sus estudios en la universidad .
texts.en: Petrona Ignacia is a teacher at a public school giving classes to children between the ages of 10 to 14 years old. She has been doing this for 27 years. She is a mother who is preoccupied about the education of her children. She is requesting a loan to purchase a computer that her son needs for his university studies.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El joven Miguel Ángel habita en el municipio de El Jicaral un pueblo  religioso, donde se mantiene la educación y la humildad. 

Es un joven de 37 años de edad con 3 hijos bajo su cargo, dos de ellos estudian en la primaria,  con lo poco que el gana de su salario a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus tres hijos que tanto ama y estima.
 
Desde hace 16 años ejerce el trabajo como responsable de combatir enfermedades trasmitidas por vectores y rodedores en uno de los centro de salud, pero son de sus sueños llegar a brindarle una mejor condiciones de vida a sus tres hijitos, por lo que solicita por primera vez un crédito a Ceprodel y Kiva para la compra de: Un Televisor de 21 Pulgadas. 
Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie este crédito. 

Agradece mucho por la mano amigable  que Ceprodel y Kiva le brinda y espera en Dios empezar a recibir este tipo de bendición y así poder obtener el sueño de su vida llegar a brindarle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel Angel lives in El Jicaral, a religious town where good manners and humility have been maintained. 

He is 37 years old and has three children to take care of (two of them are in elementary school). His meagre earnings are barely enough to support his three children, whom he loves deeply.

He has worked at a health center for 16 years combatting illnesses transmitted by rodents. Nevertheless, his dream is to provide better living conditions to his three children. This is why he is requesting for the first time a loan from Kiva and Ceprodel to buy a 21" TV. He greatly needs Kiva and Ceprodel to finance this loan. 

He thanks Kiva and Ceprodel for their helping hand and hopes that God will allow him to receive the blessing of providing better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy a 21" TV.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila is a 38-year-old married mother of four, one of whom is enrolled in a private school. Jamila is an accessories designer who launched her home business in 2003. In the past, she worked as a hair stylist and a glass painter. Her designs are in high demand by clients and tourists. Tourists come in the summer months, which is her peak season where sales are above average. She has learned this profession from college and from her years of experience. At first she faced the challenge of making a good return on her work. Now her business is going well and she is able to assist her husband with added income.

This is Jamila’s third loan cycle with Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua. The previous loans left a good impact on her work and helped to increase her revenue. Now she needs to increase her merchandise to prepare for the busy summer. Her extraordinary ambition pushes her to expand her business plans in the future and to market her attractive designs in unique ways.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise to prepare for the busy summer.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 37-year-old married mother of four whose husband is a retired officer. She has been working with her husband to provide her children a good education in a private school. She established an internet café in an area that is frequented by many children from the surrounding area. At first she faced some difficulties since her café wasn’t technically equipped and it was limited to some games services only. Now her business is going well and it is able to provide the residents and neighborhood with a good internet connection. 

Fatima is borrowing a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua for the first time. She believes the acquired loan will be open more opportunities in her business since she intends to expand her services to start selling prepaid mobile cards. She believes this will increase her number of clients and allow her to increase the size of her café in the future.

loans.use: To expand her services to start selling prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Naret

texts.en:
Naret is a 39-year-old married woman and a loving mother of two unmarried children. She has worked as a Hol (Khmer transitional skirt) weaver for nearly 20 years and her husband is a farmer. This family resides in the Prey Kabbas District of Takeo Province. Their main source of income utterly relies on farming. 

Naret would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 800.00 to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate rather than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for a biogas digester

loans.name: Dora Isabel

texts.es: La señora Dora, habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, en la comarca llamada Pablo Calero, tiene como actividad la Agricultura quien desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar la tierra, este crédito lo esta solicitando para dar mantenimiento a 3 manzanas de Piña que tiene cosechadas por lo que comprara, Fertilizantes, Triple, Completo, Urea, Byfolan, etc. así su producto crecerá con mayor calidad, muy agradecida se muestra doña Dora con Kiva y Afodenic por el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en: Dora is a resident of the town of Ticuantepe in the region called Pablo Calero. Her work is in agriculture which she has done since she was very young. She has worked the land for a long time. She is requesting this loan for the maintenance of her three fields of pineapple that she will harvest. She will buy the fertilizers Triple, Completo, Urea, and Byfolan so that her product will grow and be of greater quality. Dora is very grateful to AFODENIC and Kiva for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to fertilize her pineapple fields

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Adi runs a small stall which sells electrical accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. He has been running this stall for one year.  Adi lives in Sukabumi, an semi-urban area.  Adi is married.

To increase the family income, Adi also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma two months ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Adi is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Adi is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using a printer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is forty-five years old and married with three children aged thirty-one, twenty-six and sixteen. Only one child attends school. She has a general dealer retail shop in the South Eastern region of Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for nineteen years and sells groceries such as sugar, bread, rice, and drinks to the local market of Chipinge. She also earns income from her transport business.

Grace says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to buy more goods and build her own business premises. Grace requested this loan of USD1000 to purchase stocks of uniforms, jerseys, jackets and groceries for resale. She says the extra income from this loan will help her boost her inventory and profits. In the future she would like to buy a truck for easy transportation of her stock.

loans.use: To pay for more uniforms, jackets and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase wool for knitting school jerseys and to buy school uniforms for resale

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Adi runs a small stall which sells mobile phone airtime credits. He has been running this stall for six months.  Adi lives in Ciamis, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta.  Adi is single.

To increase the family income, Adi also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma two months ago to increase his income and feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Adi is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Adi is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using a printer

loans.name: Atmije

texts.en:
Atmije is a widowed Egyptian Albanian mother of three children. Her profession is stitching and repairing clothes, mostly for the most vulnerable people in her Egyptian community. She is seeking your help to buy some fabric needed in this activity.

Atmije is a retiree whose pension is only $50 per month. “It’s only enough for the bread, but never enough for food and other living needs. Like me, there are so many more retirees in Albania who live on such a budget, if you call it such. This is why I tried to do some stitching and repairing of clothes, to earn a little income for myself. My kids can’t help me financially, because they are very poor as well,“ said Atmije. 

Living under very poor conditions, Atmije has been VisionFund's client for a very long time. This loan will be her ninth.

loans.use: to buy fabric for her clothing repair activity

loans.name: Marije

texts.en:
Marije is a mother of four who is seeking your financial help to buy a dairy cow. Currently, she has a female baby calf, pigs, and chickens. She sells piglets, hens, and eggs to the market. In addition to all these, she plants and sells corn and beans in the dried form. 

Marije was imprisoned for ten years during the communist era. What you see in the background of the photograph is the so called family house, where five people live. According to Marije, they lived more poorly before. Their house was in a very rural village, where there was no electricity or roads. 

Not only that, but the weather conditions made the living harder. The village was covered in snow for most of the year and, when there was no snow those four months, they could not plant anything because the village was built almost on top of the mountain and there was no agricultural land.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sanjita

texts.en:
Sanjita is 23 years old and married to Bishwajit. She and her husband are raising their two children. Sanjita has an education up to grade 6 and her husband has completed his education up to grade 10.  

Sanjita is involved in her animal husbandry and her husband works as a mason. They live in the small village of Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri in their own kaccha house (made of mud and straw).

Sanjita is very responsible and cheerful lady. She has been associated with a business for five years, when her husband's business was not going well.  Unfortunately, together they are unable to earn sufficient money to cover the necessities of their family. With an aim to further developing her business, Sanjita has applied for a loan to BJS.  

She plans to purchase a cow with the loan.  She will start a milk products business selling curd, butter, cheese etc. in addition to milk.  She will sell the products to her neighbors. It is a lucrative business as the products have a great demand in her local market. Sanjita dreams of helping her husband financially for the improvement of their family income and to give higher education to her children. She also wants to invest the profits in acquiring more cattle to build a cattle herd to earn more for their secured future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a business of supplying milk and dairy products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy barber equipment like scissors, barbering machines, blades, combs, and swivel chair to add value to his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy drinks and cooking ingredients in bulk so that she won't have to pay retail prices.

loans.name: Roula

texts.en:
Roula is a 41-year-old married mother of two whose husband is an officer. She is a handcrafts designer and has her own home business. Roula is a talented woman who explores her own artistic taste to prepare her superb collection of souvenirs for special occasions. Her 17 years of experience have been fruitful in growing her chain of clients, ranging from tourists to neighborhood residents. At first she found difficulties in marketing her work since she was limited to a home business.

Roula is an ambitious woman who believes in growing opportunities. Thus she has successfully completed six loan cycles with Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, all of which have made a great impact on her life. Now she is acquiring a loan to buy equipment for her workshop, which will allow her to sell more crafts in the coming summer months. In the future, she hopes to open a small shop where she can better display her attractive designs and increase her sales.

loans.use: To buy equipment for her workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for special business needs, which he ordered previously, to make work faster and easier to do, with a high quality production.

loans.name: Jesus Mi Salvador Group

texts.es: El grupo “JESUS MI SALVADOR” está conformada por socios dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio minorista.  Felix tiene 55 años de edad es soltero dedicado a la venta de menú hace muchos años. Años atrás trabajaba como ayudante de cocina. El crédito lo invertirá en el arreglo de su puesto de trabajo. Su mayor deseo es terminar de construir su vivienda. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas  KIVA por el crédito brindado. Felix se encuentra parado viste chompa verde a rayas
texts.en:
The Jesus Mi Salvador group is made up of partners who make a living in different retail occupations. Felix is 55 years old, is single, and has made a living selling meals for many years. Years ago he worked as a kitchen assistant. He will invest the loan in the repair of his work station. His greatest wish is to finish building his home. 

The group thanks the KIVA investors for the given loan. Felix can be found standing, wearing a striped green sweater.

loans.use: to fix up his work station.

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jacqueline habita en el municipio de santa rosa del Peñón del departamento den león, un municipio donde los habitantes son luchadores por su vida. 

La Señora Jacqueline tiene 43 años de edad casado, cuenta con un hijito bajo su cargo, su esposo es maestro, con lo poco que el gana ayuda al sustento diario de su hogar, y ella como es de sus ingresos el salario ayuda a mejorar las condiciones de su hogar.  

Desde hace 21 años ejerce el trabajo como despachadora de farmacia en el centro de salud, pero son de sus sueños tener mejores condiciones en su familia, se dio la oportunidad de conocer a Kiva y Ceprodel a través de una de las promociones que se ofertaron.

Por tal razón se vio en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de: electrodoméstico tales como Refrigeradora y Microonda,   Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie por primera vez este crédito, esto le ayudaría mucho a su hogar. 

Se siente a gusto con este tipo de empleo porque le ha ayudado mucho en el desarrollo de una mejor vivienda y vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives in the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón in the department of León, a town where the inhabitants are determined to get on on life. Jacqueline is 43 years old and is married. She has a young son under her responsibility. Her husband is a teacher and with the small amount he earns he is able to help provide the household's everyday needs. 

The income from her salary helps to improve conditions in their home. For 21 years she has worked as a pharmacy dispatcher in the health centre, but her dream is to improve her family's living conditions. She was given the opportunity to find out about Kiva and Ceprodel through one of the promotions they were offering. 

This is why she saw the need to ask for a loan to buy domestic appliances such as a refrigerator and a microwave. She really needs Ceprodel and Kiva to give her this first loan, which would help her household a lot. 

She likes the type of work she does because it has helped her a great deal to be able to have a better home and life with her family.

loans.use: to buy domestic appliances such as a refrigerator and a microwave.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Don Julio es Docente de un Colegio Estatal, muy responsable, su esposa es docente tambien y se ayudan mutuamente con los gastos del hogar, el con sacrificio ha sacado adelant a su familia por quien trabaja a diario y desea que no le falte el pan de cada dia, su mayor gastos es su pequeño hijo que esta en edad escolar a quien desea ver todo un profesional. Se remite a solicitar credito con el fin de Comprar Ceramica para poner a su vivienda y asi brindarle mejore condiciones a familia.
texts.en: Julio is a teacher at a public school. He is very responsible. His wife is also a teacher and they both help with their household expenses. He has supported his family with a lot of sacrifice and daily work. He wishes for them to always have food on the table. His largest expense is his young son, who is in school and whom he wants to see become a professional. He is requesting this loan to buy ceramic tiles for his home in order to provide better living conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles for his home.

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en: Efrena had successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her piggery business. Selling her pigs in volume makes her income bigger than usual. With her income, she was able to open up  a retail store that adds income for her family's needs. She took a new loan recently to buy feed to boost her pigs. She hopes that continued success in her business will allow her to earn a better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Sa is 55 and a native of Takeo province, where he lives and operates a farming business. He has been in this business for more than 20 years, earning approximately USD 7. He has nine children, including three who are already married. Farming is the main business that he operates to support his family.

Sa said that he is grateful to Kiva and the cooperating partners because through them he was able to gain access to financial services. He is requesting a loan to build a hygienic latrine. This loan will improve his general living conditions, promote health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Sa is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower than usual interest rate for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine

loans.name: Channon

texts.en:
Channon, 40, is a married woman and has four children as her responsibility. Channon and her husband are farmers in a cassava field which is located not so far from their house.This family is residing in Prey Chhor District of Kampong Cham Province with a daily income of USD 5. 

This is the first loan for Channon with Hattha Kaksekar. She would like to use this loan for doing her cassava farming such as buying some farming materials and hiring some laborers to help her. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate other than its general loans. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for farming materials and hire laborers

loans.name: Yadira Petrona

texts.es: La señora Yadira habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo e hijos quien es comerciante al igual que ella, el sueño de doña Yadira es ver terminada su vivienda, por ello solicita este crédito para poder repara mas bien, hacer nueva su cocina ya que donde esta actualmente, es fuera de la vivienda y con las lluvias se moja, ella comprar Bloques, Zinc, Cemento, Arena. Agradece la confianza que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Yadira lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her children and her husband, who like Yadira is a shopkeeper.  

Her dream is to see the building of their home completed.  She is asking for this loan to be able to repair the home, and to remake her kitchen since the kitchen is now located outside the house and gets wet in the rainy season.  She wants to buy concrete blocks, zinc, cement and sand.  She appreciates the trust that Kiva and AFODENIC have placed in her.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia  has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for her farming activities. With her income, she was able to provide for her family, working the farm for more than 12 years as their main source of income. She also provides manicure and pedicure services to add to her income. To  purchase more nail polish and new nippers, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC microfinance. Virginia plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase more nail polish and new nippers for her manicure service

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 22 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Eten junto a su conviviente.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, desde hace 3 años se dedica al servicio de transporte a distintos destinos con su mototaxi.
Es una persona muy emprendedora, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que sale desde muy temprano a trabajar para poder ofrecerle a su pareja todas las comodidades y poder mejorar su nivel de vida.
Luis está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con su apoyo brindado él podrá realizar un completo mantenimiento de su mototaxi para no tener inconvenientes en el momento del transporte de pasajeros. Más adelante, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación quiere llegar a cumplir su gran sueño: “Poseer varios mototaxis para alquilarlos”.
texts.en:
Luis is a 22 year old young man who lived in the city of Eten together with his partner.

He is a very hardworking person. For three years, he's earned his living through the service of transportation to various destinations with his taxi.

He is a very entrepreneurial person with a desire to get ahead. This is why he goes to work very early, to be able to offer his partner all the comforts of life and improve her standard of living.

Luis is very grateful for the Kiva lenders. With their support, he will be able to do complete maintenance on his mototaxi to not have inconveniences when he's transporting passengers. 

Later, with a lot of effort and dedication, he wants to achieve his greatest dream: to own several mototaxis to rent them out.

loans.use: to maintain his motor taxi,

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 63 years old and she lives in Kapan city in Syunik region. She has vocational education. For many years she worked as an accountant, but it is already 10 years that she is engaged in agricultural activities. She has a nice orchard and a rich vegetable garden. From her orchard she gathers a perfect harvest of apples, plums, strawberries and currants. As vegetables Susanna raises potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers and beans. All these she sells right from her house to re-sellers. As she says, she is very pleased and happy with her occupation, since she likes to work with land and to be close to  nature.

Susanna is married and she has two sons who are married and live separately with their families. Her husband is already retired and helps her in gardening activities. 

Susanna needs this loan since some of her fruit garden needs to be fenced; the other part of it needs to be walled, and she also wants to buy some seeds and seedlings.

loans.use: to fence a fruit garden and also to buy some seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks and provisions to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate her house from the inside

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita lives in Accra metropolis, in Ghana, a region where major trading activities occur. Rita is 53 years old, single, and has one dependent child. With the little she earns, she supports her home. 

For 22 years she has been selling smoked fish. This business began with a bit of capital that she saved from her previous trade, but her dream is to have better living conditions. She  goes from house to house to sell the fish to her customers. 

The loan will be used to buy two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers. She trusts in God to continue receiving support from Kiva through ID-Ghana to help her so much in the development of her life.

loans.use: to buy two cartons of fish to smoke and sell to customers.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan lives in Dilijan town with her husband and elderly retired mother-in-law. Their only son is a migrant worker in a neighboring country. 

Year ago Susan started her small business in Dilijan town where she lives. The cafe that Susan and her husband run is located in the center of the town and provides good conditions for its customers. 

Susan currently needs the requested loan of USD 1000 to be able to make some investments on her cafe. She plans to purchase a new stock of supplies for the cafe and repair the car for delivery service. The loan will be a big support for Susan and her husband and they hope for lenders' goodwill. 

As this is Susan's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for a new stock of supplies for the cafe and repair the car for delivery service

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent, Emelia works hard to support her family. She has a business selling frozen food and groceries in Ghana-Accra. 

Emelia is borrowing GHS 1600 through ID-Ghana to buy additional groceries and frozen food to sell at her business center at her residence. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from ID-Ghana. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can take good care of her family. She is 56 years old.

loans.use: To buy additional groceries and frozen food to sell at her business center at her residence.

loans.name: Haneya

texts.en: Because Haneya is a conservative lady, she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Haneya was born in 1964. She is married and is the mother of five sons and daughters. Haneya has been helping to improve her family's living conditions by selling clothes and doing laundry for three years. After she built a good customer base, she decided to expand her business. She is now seeking a loan to buy a washing machine, which will help her raise her productivity.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy provisions in larger quantities to add to her current stock for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 28-year-old single man from Khanyounis city. He lives alone in a small house. Bilal is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. He is also a student in a local university where he studies Arabic literature. He would like to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future.

Bilal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Bilal will be able to read articles and write the reports easily.

Bilal appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails to repair the home roof and rebuild the storeroom.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es:
El jicaral es un pequeño Municipio donde existen personas emprendedoras, con deseo de superar en su vida, es aquí donde habita la señora María Mercedes. 

Maria Mercede Es una señora de 48 años de edad casada, cuenta con un hijito bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener a su hijito que tanto ama y estima. 
Trabaja en el Minsa el Jicaral teniendo 16 años de laborar bajo el cargo de bodeguera, hoy en día es de su deseo tener mejores condiciones en su Familia. 

Se siente a gusto ser asalariada, pero su salario no le da para poder tener mejores condiciones en su familia, por lo que tomo la decisión de solicitarle a Kiva y Ceprodel un pequeño crédito para la compra de una Refrigeradora y un tv de 14´´ con esto le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de su familia. 

Espera en Dios recibir por primera vez este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudaran mucho.
texts.en:
El Jicaral is a small town where there are entrepreneurial people with a desire to improve their lives. This is where María Mercedes lives. 

María Mercedes is 48 years old, married and with a young son in her care. The little she earns barely helps to look after her little son, who she loves and values so much. She has been working at the Minsa maize flour factory in El Jicaral for 16 years, where she is employed in the warehouse. Today, it is her desire to have better conditions for her family. 

She is pleased to be employed, but her salary does not allow her to be able to have better conditions for her family. This is why she made the decision to ask Kiva and Ceprodel for a small loan to buy a refrigerator and 14'' TV . With this, it will help to improve her family's conditions. 

She hopes in God to receive this privilege for the first time, these small loans which will help her a lot.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a 14" TV

loans.name: Yaneth

texts.es: Yaneth tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de dos años de edad. Yaneth posee una tienda en su lugar de residencia en la cual distribuye variedad de productos como: cereales, pan dulce, golosinas, detergente, etc. Ella desea mejora las condiciones del piso de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena y grava para enladrillar el piso de la vivienda ya que en tiempos de lluvia se pone húmedo.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 23 years old and lives in her own house, together with her life partner and her two year old son. Yaneth owns a store in her place of residence in which she distributes a variety of products like grains, pastries, candies, detergent, etc. 

She wants to improve the condition of the floor in her home, which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of cement, bricks, sand and gravel to pave the floor of her home since, in the rainy seasons, it becomes wet.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, sand and gravel to pave the floor of her home.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Emanuel” la cual está conformado por 07 socios progresistas. Sorayda de 33 años es separada con 04 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de edredones. Fruto de su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida. Su mayor deseo es de crecer en su negocio llegando a más clientes. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de sabanas, almohadas y colchas.  El grupo “Emanuel” Agradece a todos los inversionistas Kiva por facilitar este crédito. Sorayda es el segundo del lado derecho y viste chompa rojo.
texts.en:
This is the “Emanuel” group which is comprised of 7 progressive members. Sorayda is 33 years old and is separated with 4 dependent children. She makes a living selling down quilts. From the fruit of her effort and dedication she has managed to improve her quality of life. Her greatest desire is to grow her business and reach more customers. 

She requested a loan to purchase sheets, pillows and quilts. The group “Emanuel” is grateful to all of the Kiva investors for providing this loan. Sorayda is the second from the right and wearing a red sweater.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, pillows and quilts.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia lives with her children in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. She has a daughter and two sons. Her elder son works in the Russian Federation and from there, he transfers money for his family and greatly supports them financially. Lilia’s younger son is disabled. Her daughter is in her last year of studying at the economics college.  Lilia works very hard as a cleaner to sustain her family needs. Her husband died several years ago during liberation fights in the Nagorno Karabakh conflict. Despite being alone with many hardships, Lilia tries to overcome and solve her family’s problems.  
She asks for this loan since her daughter is graduating from her college and there are a lot of costs connected with it. She also dreams for her daughter to continue her education and have a higher degree. So she wants her to attend private courses and become a highly knowledgeable economist.

loans.use: to pay costs connected with her daughter's college graduation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and pay for labour to look after the coffee plants.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Tasik village with her husband and two children, a 17-year-old daughter and a 13-year-old son.
 
Marine has been involved in agribusiness for 18 years. She runs a big and beautiful farm that includes livestock (cows, oxen and calves), cultivation of wheat, emmer wheat, potatoes and cabbage, as well as a small orchard where nut, apple and pear trees grow. Marine's husband and son sell the harvest in the local markets and gather income for the family. The requested loan of USD 3000 will be a great support for Marine's farming business. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and a harvester (agro machine) needed for her farm. As this is Marine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and a harvester (agro machine)

loans.name: Maricela Del Socorro

texts.es: Maricela es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, imparte el pan de la enseñanza en universidad Privada, ademas recibe ingresos de su pequeño negocio de Libreria que atiende en tiempos libres con la ayuda de sus dos hijos que estudian secundaria y primaria respectivamente, Maricela ha salido adelante con esfuerzos propios y sacrificios, logró establecer su libreria con la ayuda economica que les dió el papá de sus hijos al separarse.  Solicita este credito para  comprar e intalar Ceramica en el area de Cocina, Sala  y comedor de su vivienda; con esto dará mejores condiciones en su hogar a su familia.
texts.en: Maricela is a very hardworking and enterprising person.  She shares of the gift of teaching at a private university and also receives income from her small bookstore business which she attends in her free time and also with the help of her two children that study in secondary and primary school, respectively.  Maricela has moved ahead thanks to her own efforts and sacrifices.  She succeeded in opening her bookstore with the financial assistance given to her by the father of her children once they separated.  She requests this loan to purchase and install ceramic in her kitchen, living, and dining room of her house.  This will improve the conditions of her home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic for her home.

loans.name: Lia

texts.en:
Lia is a 41-year-old married woman from Batumi city. Her parents-in-law are pensioners and her son and daughter are students. Her husband works as a bus driver and earns approximately 400 GEL a month. 

Lia is involved in her own business. She has opened a general store, where she sells various home and personal-use products. Now she needs financial support to purchase stock for the store and to have working capital to continue running her business. 

Lia has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan will greatly assist Lia and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her large family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To purchase stock of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es:
La Joven Sandra María habita en el municipio del Jicaral departamento de león, una ciudad donde existen diversas actividades comerciales e industriales.

Sandra María Es una joven de 33 años de edad Madre soltera con dos hijos bajo su cargo, con lo poco que ella gana a duras penas ayuda a mantener el sustento diario a sus hijos que tanto ama y estima. 

Desde hace nueve años ejerce el trabajo como contadora en una de las instituciones del estado, pero son de sus sueños tener una vida mejor con sus hijitos. 

Es de su gran necesidad que Ceprodel y Kiva le financie por primera vez un crédito, para la compra de: Zinc, Arena, Cemento y Ladrillo esto lo ve de gran importancia para poderle Construir un dormitorio en su vivienda y así poderle bridar un mejor espacio a su familia que tanto ama y estima.


Agradece con el apoyo que Ceprodel y Kiva le ha brindado y espera en Dios seguir recibiendo este privilegio, de estos pequeños créditos que le ayudaran mucho.
texts.en:
Sandra Maria lives in the town of El Jicaral in the Leon region. This is a town with diverse commercial and industrial activities. 

Sandra Maria is a 33-year-old single mother with two children to take care of. The little she earns is barely enough for the daily support of her children, whom she loves deeply. 

She has worked for 9 years as an accountant at a state institution. Her dream is having a better life with her children. 

She greatly needs Kiva and Ceprodel to finance her first loan to buy zinc, sand, cement and brick. This will be of great importance for being able to build a sleeping room in her home, which will allow her to provide a better living space to her family. 

She thanks the support provided by Kiva and Ceprodel and hopes that God will allow her to continue receiving the privilege of these small loans, which will help her significantly.

loans.use: to buy zinc, sand, cement and bricks.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño Jesus es un grupo nuevo, está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus familias y a sus seres queridos por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teodora, quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de pobreza mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir que a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de comestibles que ella misma hace está luchando por salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
La Sra. Teodora solicita de este préstamo para la compra de verduras, condimentos, hortalizas y demás, para la elaboración de comestibles, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group Divino Niño Jesus is a new group. It is in its first cycle of the program focused on women groups, through which each of them is putting forth her best effort in order to help her family and loved ones by working together.

One of the members is Teodora, who showed a level of poverty within level three on her last survey about eliminating poverty. This means that by way of her continuous effort and work through the sale of food products that she makes herself, she has been fighting to move forward and help her family.

Teodora is requesting a loan in order to buy greens, spices, vegetables, and other things for the production of foods, which will help her to solidify her business plan. This will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy greens, spices, vegetables, and other things to make food products.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Divino Niño Jesus se llama este grupo formado en la ciudad de Luque, donde las 17 integrantes de este grupo están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirtha, quien se dedica a la venta de leche, que ella misma sale a vender de manera ambulante. Comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que tiene que dar a sus clientes la leche para el desayuno.
La Sra. Mirtha  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de una vaca, de manera a tener una mayor producción de leche, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de poder seguir luchando.
texts.en:
This group is called “Divino Niño Jesús” (“Divine Baby Jesus”) and was formed in the city of Luque. The 17 members of this group are doing their best to grow and get ahead in life.

One of the members is Mirtha, who makes a living by selling milk on the streets. She says that every day she starts work very early in the morning since she has to get the milk to her clients before their breakfast.

Mirtha is requesting this loan in order to buy a cow so she can have greater milk production, which will help her to cement her business plan and improve her earnings. 

All of the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving of being able to continue striving to get ahead in life.

loans.use: buy a cow to improve milk production

loans.name: Raed

texts.en:
Raed is a 22-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. Raed works in a general service office for students as an employee. He is also a student in a local university where he studies Business Administration. He would like to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future

Raed took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Raed will be able to read articles and write his reports easily.

Raed appears in the photo with his laptop

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Doña Rosa Emilia es una señora esforzada y muy trabajadora, con su labor de Docente de Preescolar ha sacado adelante a su familia ademas ha sido beneficiada con créditos de Kiva utilizados en poner cerámica a su vivienda, esta vez necesita otro crédito para construir una habitación para uno de sus hijos menores que actualmente duermen en el mismo cuarto, ya que la hija mujer es independiente y trabaja aportando en los gastos del hogar en lo poco que puede y ella tiene su propio dormitorio. Rosa Emilia como toda madre se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Emilia is a courageous and very hardworking lady. With her work as a pre-school teacher she has helped her family get ahead. As well she has benefitted from Kiva loans used to install ceramic in her home. 

This time she needs another loan to build a bedroom for one of her younger children who currently all sleep in the same room since her adult daughter is independent and works contributing to household expenses, as much as she can, and she has her own bedroom.

Rosa Emilia, like all mothers, works to provide the best for her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Karam

texts.en:
Karam is a 19-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. Karam's father works as an employee in the public sector with a very low income. Karam is a student in a local university, where he pursues Islamic studies. He would like to take his BA degree and find a job to help his family

Karam has accessed a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Karam will be able to read articles and write reports easily.

Karam appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Manushak

texts.en:
Manushak is a teacher at Artik's local school. She lives with her elderly retired parents and helps them with running the family’s farming business. Their farm includes cows, sheep, oxen and chickens. Near their house, the family also owns arable land where they cultivate wheat and barley. 

Manushak has requested this loan of 1,500 USD to purchase five piglets and two calves needed for her farm. She has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, after ensuring that her agribusiness is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Manushak has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for five piglets and two calves

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine is from Sipan village, in Aragatsotn region. She lives with her husband and two-year-old daughter. Lusine and her husband have been involved in agriculture for 10 years. They keep livestock including cows, calves, sheep and chickens, and they cultivate potatoes and some grass, as forage for the livestock. Lusine's husband sells their gathered harvests in local markets and gathers income for their family's living.

The requested loan of USD 1,000 is very important for Lusine and her family farm. She will use the loan to enable her to add two more calves, as well as purchase wheat and barley seeds. As this is Lusine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products in the past, because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for two calves and seed for wheat and barley crops

loans.name: Heghush

texts.en:
Heghush is an agronomist with many years of experience. She lives with her elderly retired parents in Getavan village in the Lori region. 

Heghush is involved in cattle breeding. She keeps four cows and six calves and sells their milk and milk products to a local cheese-making factory. She has requested this loan of 1,500 USD to purchase a cow and three calves for her herd. 

Heghush has taken a loan from local financial institutions before, but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time. Now, after ensuring that her farming business is successful and she is able to provide monthly payments for this loan, Heghush has been approved for this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and three calves

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
This group is called Discipline. It consists of five women and one man. They all live in traditional and simple families in Teshie, Accra. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They have applied for a loan of 2,800 GHS from Kiva through ID Ghana. They sell foodstuffs, fish, corn dough, soft drinks, local food, glasses, plates, coal pots, charcoal, etc.  

Beatrice is a 36-year-old married woman with three children. She is the featured borrower of the group. Beatrice lives with her family in a rented apartment. She attended elementary school but could not complete her studies because she got married very young. She is a very dynamic and vigorous woman. Beatrice has to help her husband in taking care of the family. As a result, she is requesting a loan of GHS 500 from ID Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase yams and vegetables to sell at her residence to her customers.

Beatrice hopes to expand her business to a wholesale shop a few years from now with the help of Kiva through ID Ghana.

loans.use: To purchase yams and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina es una persona bien conocida en la zona, se dedica a impartir clases de Secundaria para un colegio Estatal, su esposo es comerciante, ambos son muy responsable y compartes los gastos del hogar, ella con sacrificios y multiples créditos obtenidos ha salido adelante con su familia. Agradecida por formar parte de los clientes A en Afodenic, se remite nuevamente a Kiva con el propósito de solicitar nuevo crédito para comprar Materiales de Construcción como Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Piedrin y pagar mano de obra para construir un Porche y  tapia en la parte de atrás de su vivienda.  Con este proyecto dará mas seguridad y valor a su Vivienda que sera el Patrimonio de sus 4 hijos.
texts.en:
Martina is well-known in her area. She works as a teacher in a state secondary school. Her husband is in sales, and they are both very responsible people who share the household costs together. By making sacrifices and using multiple loans, she has managed to help her family get on.

She is grateful to be among the A-list of clients with Afodenic. She is now applying again to Kiva to ask for a new loan in order to buy construction material such as cement, sand, iron, stone and gravel, as well as to pay workers to build a porch and a wall in the back of her house. Through this project she will make her house more secure and valuable, which will be the legacy for her 4 children.

loans.use: to buy construction material to build a porch.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Benkola est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui se connaissent bien car elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 4 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de Fruits et légumes, Riz, Habillements, Tasse, Beurre de karité, Gombo  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.  
Jeanne est un membre du groupe Benkola  assise au bout et à gauche, vendeuse  de Pagnes de toutes qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter des pièces de pagnes de toute qualité et en quantité. Elle les vend en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse aux marchés de Koutiala. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Benkola comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 110 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Jeanne compte réaliser  120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
The Benkola group Benkola is composed of women living in Hamdallaye who know each other well because they all live in extended traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On the average they are 35 years old, married, with at least four children each.
The group members sell miscellaneous items, such as fruits and vegetables, rice, clothing, caps, palm oil, okra etc. In order to expand their business, the group members have decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program. They are on their second group loan.
Jeanne, the one seated at the far left, is a group member who sell traditional “pagnes” cloth in various quality grades. She plans to use her loan to stock up sets of “pagnes” of various quality grades. She sells retail, fro cash, to a mixed clientele, at the markets of Koutiala.
While other group members plan to earn an average monthly benefit of 110,000 West African francs each during this loan cycle, Mrs. Jeanne plans to earn 120,000 francs.

Apart from repaying their loan, the group members will use their revenues to cover personal expenses and bolster their working capital.
They would like to continue building on this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to avoid running out of stock.

loans.use: to buy traditional cloth.

loans.name: Mario Javier

texts.es: Don Mario tiene su familia formada de su esposa y sus dos niños una mujer y un varón, ambos menores de edad están al cuido de su esposa, Mario es asalariado y con lo que gana alcanza la manutención de su familia ya que él es el único sustento.  Con el crédito anterior logró sacar su carrera, esta vez necesita crédito para la compra de cemento, arena, arenilla, ladrillos e instalación de piso y repello de paredes de la vivienda de su mamá que es donde habita con su familia.  Su mayor propósito es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Mario has a family formed of his wife and two children, one daughter and one son.  Both children are in the care of his wife.  Mario is paid and with what he makes, he is able to support his family.  He is the sole breadwinner.  With the previous loan he received, he was able to finish his studies.  He now needs this loan to purchase cement, sand, stone, gravel, and brick for floor installations and plaster walls for his mother's house where he lives with this family.  The major purpose of this is to give the best to his family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, stone and gravel to plaster walls.

loans.name: Greccia Kristhel

texts.es:
Greccia es una joven emprendedora, con 27 años de edad, soltera y vive en Nazca con su tía.
Desde hace 1 año trabaja como Moza en el restaurante de su tía desempeñándose muy bien porque es una persona responsable, trabajadora y siempre atiende a los clientes con mucho respeto.
También estudia la carrera profesional de Estomatología en la Universidad de la zona donde reside. Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
Greccia está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para realizar sus prácticas y así poder sacar excelentes calificaciones y convertirse en una buena Profesional, de esta manera más adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación podrá cumplir su gran sueño: “Tener su propio consultorio”.
texts.en: Greccia is a young entrepreneur.  She is 27 years old, single, and lives in Nazca with her aunt.  For one year she has been working as a waitress in her aunt's restaurant.  She has been performing very well because she is a responsible, hardworking person and she always serves the customers with much respect.  She also studies the professional career of Dentistry at the University in the zone where she resides.  She is a person who is eager to get ahead and succeed in life.  Greccia is grateful to the Kiva lenders, for with the support they give she can buy materials to realize her studies and be able to get excellent grades and become a good professional.  With much effort and dedication she can fulfill her great dream: "To have her own clinic."

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to realize her studies in the University.

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: Doña Maria Sonia diario se dedica a vender sus productos como es ropa, zandalia, zapatos entre otros,la ganancia la reinvierte en comprar nuevamente para mantener su negocio surtido y de lo poco que gana mantiene su familia ademas de contar con la ayuda de su esposo quien es conductor de maquinaria pesada. sus hijos son mayores de edad y todos trabajan para mantener su propia familia. Maria Sonia solicita su primer crédito para Construir un sumidero en su propiedad y así contar con mejores condiciones en su hogar, por lo que necesita comprar, cemento, arena, piedras canteras y pagar mano de obra.
texts.en:
Maria Sonia works everyday selling products such as clothing, sandals and shoes, among other items. She reinvests the money she makes to maintain the selection in her business. 

From what little she makes, she supports her family as well as counting on her husband who is a heavy machinery operator. Her children are adults and they all work to support their own families. 

Maria Sonia is requesting her first loan to build a drain on her property and thus she can look forward to better conditions in her home. Consequently, she needs to buy cement, sand, quarry stones, and to pay for the labor.

loans.use: to buy sand, quarry stones, cement, boulders and to pay labor costs to put in a drain.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years.

Anecita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use it to buy ingredients, like flour, sugar, and butter, for her food production business.

In the future, Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, like flour, sugar, and butter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Daniela Melisa

texts.es:
Daniela, tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltera y vive con sus padres que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el credito va comprar los insumos para la asistecia de los cultivos que poseen. Ella va comprar el abono y plaguisidas necesarios para el buen desarrollo del cultivo. Su padre cuenta con los terrenos aptos para la explotacion de estos cultivos y actualmente estan sembrando y necesita apoyo para la asistencia de esto productos, por lo cual ella opto por el credito. Ella espera poder ayudar con el mantenimiento de la cosecha y asi coloaborar con los ingresos economicos de su hogar.

Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Daniela is 20 years old, single, and lives with her parents, who are her first concern. Daniela will use funds from this loan to purchase supplies the family needs to care for their corn and bean crops. She will purchase the manure and pesticides required to grow successful crops. Daniela's father has good land for growing corn and beans; the family is now planting and needs support to care for the crops, so Daniela is applying for a loan. She hopes to be able to help with the harvest and contribute to her family's income. 

This is Daniela's first loan from FUDECOSUR, and she's never received a loan from a state-owned bank. FUDECOSUR, however, is providing a loan with an easier application process and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to help with the planting of corn and beans.

loans.name: Maricela Abigail

texts.es:
Maricela, tiene su negocio con poca mercadería y no logra cumplir de lleno con las demandas de sus clientes, es por esa razón que se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito con el objetivo de renovar los estilos, colores y tallas de ropa ofrece, comprara blusas, camisas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, ropa interior ambos sexos y trajes para niños/as.
Con la ayuda del financiamiento anterior ha mantenido su negocio funcionando el cual consiste en venta de ropa y fruta; generando ingresos que necesita para cumplir con sus compromisos económicos.
texts.en: Maricela has her business and not much merchandise and she cannot meet the demands of her customers. So for this reason she has decided to request a new loan with the objective of renewing the styles, colors and sizes of the clothing she offers. She will buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, undergarments for both sexes and children's clothes. With the help of the last loan she kept her business operating where she sells clothing and fruit; generating the resources needed to comply with her economic compromises.

loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, skirts, pants, dresses, undergarments, etc.

loans.name: Vidalia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vidalia tiene 44 años de edad,  estudió hasta 3°grado de educación Básica, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica al comercio (venta de ganado) de los cuatro hijos que viven en casa solo una va en la escuela, y son los únicos que dependen de ella.

Vidalia se dedica al trabajo doméstico, pero también se dedica a la venta de frutas, tiene 17 años de realizar este trabajo el cual lo aprendió de sus tías, el trabajo le queda a una distancia de 45 minutos en bus, y trabaja de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar dos vacas y más frutas para vender.
 
Ella sueña con mejorar sus condiciones de vida por lo cual seguirá trabajando muy duro para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Vidalia is 44 years old and completed her basic education through the third grade. She is in a relationship and her partner is a trader who sells cattle. They have four children who live at home, but only one attends school. The children are the only ones who are dependent on her.

Vidalia works as a domestic employee, but she also sells fruit. She has been in this trade for 17 years and learned it from her aunts. Her job requires that she travel 45 minutes by bus and her work schedule is from 6:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M.

Vidalia needs a loan so that she can buy two cows and more fruit to sell. Her dream is to improve her living conditions, so she continues to work very hard so that she can achieve that goal.

loans.use: to buy two cows and more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more beans to expand her business.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 50 years old and is married. She lives with her family, in Ho Chi Minh City. She has been running a store for 10 years, where she sells building materials.

She is requesting a loan to expand her business, by buying a large quantity and variety of tiles to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that as a result of the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy tiles to sell from her store

loans.name: Nhan's Group

texts.en:
Nhan is 48 years old, married, and has two sons. Her husband supports the family by working as a taxi-driver. Nhan earns a living by running a small cafe, in front of her house. She began her cafe five years ago, but it remains small.

She is the leader of an eight-member loan group. The group members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, Nhan is the second one from the right, wearing dark blue pants. Each of the other members of Nhan's group is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities.

Nhan intends to use her share of the loan to increase the size of her cafe business, by buying coffee in bulk to sell from her store and an old motorcycle. The motorcycle will make it easier for her to transport coffee and other foods and beverages she buys, from the local market to her cafe. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to increase the size of her business. She hopes that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy coffee in bulk and an old motorcycle, for transporting goods to her business

loans.name: Ramiro Frederman

texts.es:
Ramiro  de 34 años de edad, un joven luchador esmerado en su trabajo con firmes deseos de superación apoyando a su padre en su pequeño negocio, son muy unidos como familia con sus hermanas menores se apoyan mutuamente en todo lo relacionado al pequeño negocio familiar; comenta que desde que era muy pequeño su padre lo llevo al puesto a vender y por ello le gusto mucho estar apoyándolo, aunque él es mecánico en enderezado y pintura le gusta mucho el comercio y la venta de frutas y otros, así que decidió hoy apoyar mas a su padre y mejorar un poco el negocio de su padre vendiendo otro tipo de productos en el pequeño puesto.


El préstamo se empleara para la compra de frutas y otro tipo de mercaderías para ser comercializadas en el pequeño puesto, ya que actualmente solo vende revistas, periódicos y agua en bolsa y hoy quiere vender mas productos, su intención es fortalecerlo ya que su padre ha decidido dejárselo como herencia.
texts.en:
34-year-old Ramiro is a determined young man who is committed to his work, with a strong desire to make progress in life by helping his father with his small business. They are a very close family and he and his younger sisters all work together in all aspects of the family business. 

He says that ever since he was little his father has taken him to the stall to help with sales and so he really likes helping him. Although he is a mechanic in car body repair and painting, he really likes retail, selling fruit and other items, so he has now decided to support his father more and improve his business by selling other kinds of goods on the small stall. 

Currently he just sells magazines, papers and bottled water and now he wants to sell more products. His intention is to strengthen the business, since his father has decided to leave it to him as an inheritance.

loans.use: to buy fruit and other goods to sell on his small stall.

loans.name: Maria Modesta

texts.es: María, tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en una aldea rural del Municipio de Lepaera, Departamento de Lempira. Ella tenia un negocio de pulperia anteriormente pero no le fue bien, y decidió dedicarse solo a la agricultura. Actualmente solo atiende el cultivo de café junto con su esposo. La producción que obtiene la vende a intermediarios de la zona. Ella ha solicitado varios préstamos para darle mantenimiento al cultivo ya que es su fuente de ingresos, con el actual son cinco ciclos y es por 25,000 Lempiras, el cual piensa invertir en compra de fertilizantes y siembra de mas plantas de café. Con la asistencia que le de espera seguir mejorando la  finca y la cosecha. Su plan es cultivar mas plantas y obtener mas ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Lepaera in the Department of Lempira.

María previously had a grocery store, but it did not do well, so she decided to focus only on agriculture. She currently cultivates coffee along with her husband. The output that is produced is sold to brokers in the area. María has requested several loans in order to maintain her crops since they provide her a source of income. At the moment, she has requested five previous loans and is asking for another one in the amount of 25,000 HNL. She plans to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and the cultivation of more coffee plants. With the care she provides to the crops, she hopes to improve her farm and her harvest. Her plan is to cultivate more plants and obtain more income so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and invest in the cultivation of more coffee plants.

loans.name: Laxmi Narayan Shg Group

texts.en:
Basanti is a member of Laxmi Narayan Self Help Group and is pictured here (with her hand raised). She is planning to use her loan to help grow her brick business by purchasing items like coal and sand and a better machine that will improve the quality and quantity of the bricks she produces.
