She is in this business with her husband, and it is her family’s main source of income to support their three children. They live in a small village in the Bhadrak district.  

Basanti says, “Now our business will be very good, with the support of the loan. In the future, we want a brick factory built in an even more modernized way.” She is proud of the work they do and excited to be taking the loan. She says, “With the continued support of Kiva lenders, I can change my and my family’s life in the long term. Thank you, Kiva!” The other women in Laxmi Narayan Self Help Group are using their loans to improve their agriculture, dairy, and other small businesses.

loans.use: to purchase items like coal and sand and a better machine to make bricks

loans.name: Byron Antulio

texts.es: Byron Antulio tiene 29 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Pablo Jocopilas, departamento de Suchitepéquez, tiene 1 hija de 6 años de edad, esta asistiendo a clases de kínder, él obtiene sus ingresos trabajando como maestro, además tiene una venta de sandias y venta de alhajas  de plata, desde hace 5 años se dedica a esta actividades, Byron Antulio solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 10,000.00 para comprar sandalias y alhajas y parte del dinero lo utilizará para pagar colegiatura de la universidad, su meta es terminar sus estudios universitarios y graduarse.
texts.en: Byron Antulio is 29 years old and lives in the city of San Pablo Jocopilas, province of Suchitepéquez. He has one 6 year old daughter who is attending Kindergarten. He has earned his income for five years working as a teacher in addition to selling watermelons and silver jewelry. Byron Antulio requests a loan for Q. 10,000 in order to buy sandals and jewelry and to pay his college fees. His goal is to finish his studies and graduate.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Salma Al- Baladia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Salma Al-Baladia. It is comprised of five women. They all live in traditional and simple families, in Sana'a, Yemen. They know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They applied for a loan of 260,000 YER from AMB.

Yasamin is a 21-year-old, single woman. She is the leader of the group. Yasamin lives with her family in their own house. She is an uneducated woman, and she is very dynamic and vigorous. Recently, she has been working as a cleaner in the private sector. Her father is the breadwinner of the family. His income is very low, and Yasamin helps him in the expenses of the family.

Over time, her father accumulated a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. Yasamin supported him, with a lot of her money. Many years ago, Yasamin's father was able to build a house on the land he bought. Now, the family lives in their own house, but the yard of that house is not a paved surface. As a result, Yasamin is requesting a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB. She will use that amount (her share of this group loan) to purchase paving for the yard of their house.

Yasamin's dream in the future is building one more floor and renovating the house.

loans.use: to purchase paving for the yard of the house.

loans.name: Maa Bijayalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en:
The women pictured here are united in the Maa Bijayalaxmi Shg. They support each other in their businesses and encourage group savings so they can help themselves through difficult times and improve their lives. They are now requesting a loan of 120,000 INR to use for their small businesses, including agriculture, cattle, and the small shops they own. 

The featured borrower of this group is Manjulata, who is standing with her raised hand. She runs a candle-making business, supplying candles to families for religious purposes and to the shops and households in her village that do not have access to reliable electricity. Her husband works with her in the business, and they support their family. Manjulata has been doing the candle business for five years now and is planning to use her portion of the group loan to buy a new machine to help making the candles and to purchase more materials in bulk, because that way they are cheaper and she can earn a higher profit. She enjoys her work and hopes to build a big candle factory so she can provide herself and her family with a high quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and materials in bulk for her candle-making business.

loans.name: Jay Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
Anusuya is a 42-year-old lady living with her husband, parents-in-law and one 15-year-old son in a small village in Odisha, India. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Anusuya. She is a very responsible and hardworking woman, having a leadership trait within her. She stepped out from her house and formed a group with other women from her village. They gave the name "Jay Maa Mangala Shg" to the group. All the group members are doing some business to support their families. All the group members support and help each other in their business activity. 

Anusuya has been engaged in the spice-making business for the last 10 years. She purchases raw spices like turmeric, ginger, white pepper, black salt, chilies, etc. and makes mixed spices using a grinder machine. From this activity, she earns 4,000 INR per month. She wants to expand her business, and for this reason, she requires financial support. So she, along with her group members, is asking for a loan of 198,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase a new grinder machine and raw spices in bulk for her spice-making business. She says, "In the future, I want to be a big manufacturer of spices." She also says, "I am very grateful to Kiva for supporting my business".

loans.use: to pay for a new grinder and raw spices in bulk

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Waleed is a 19-year-old single man from Khan Younis city. He lives with his family in a small house. Waleed works as graphic designer with a very low and unstable income. He is also a student in a local university where he studies advertising and marketing. He would like to take his BA degree and find a better job to help his family.

Waleed took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Waleed will be able to use advanced programs for graphic design.

Waleed appears in the photo with his laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
Muhabbat is a goal-oriented woman. Thanks to her parents, she got a higher education. Muhabbat is an economist. She has a small salary, so she began her own business with the aim to get a good profit. She has been busy with this business for more than a year. Her shop is located near her living house. Her neighbors are her customers. Muhabbat tries to sell fresh and high-quality food products to her customers. She is a careful mother of three children. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. So, she manages all the home cares alone.

She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. She is asking for a loan of 12,000 Somoni. She will use the loan to buy food items to sell, such as bread, eggs, meat products and milk products. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items to sell, such as bread, eggs, meat, and dairy products.

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Hue is a 61-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her four children in Ho Chi Minh City. For fifteen years she has operated a cafe in front of her house.

Hue would like a loan to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

Hue also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater range and quantity of beverages and coffee to stock her store

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is a 63-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for 26 years. Mai would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks, and confectionaey to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of soft drinks and confectionary to stock her general store

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 50 years old and married with three children.

Candelaria works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, salt, cereals, etc. to sell.

Candelaria has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending.

Candelaria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like canned goods, soft drinks, cooking oil, sugar, salt, and cereals to sell

loans.name: Hung

texts.en:
Hung is 40 years old and is married. He has two children, a son and a daughter. Hung and his wife support their family, by making and selling clothing and by running a cafe in front of their home. Hung has been running the cafe for 20 years. He started this business to cover his expenses and to generate income to raise his children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hung is requesting a loan to buy cloth and other materials to make more clothes to sell. He hopes that through the loan he will be able to expand his family's business, and that they will be able to save more money for any difficulties that they may face in the future.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other materials for making more clothes to sell

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is 40 years old and happily married. He has four children, ages 21, 11, 6 and 4. He obtained his first Kiva loan in 2012, and used the money to serve customers in need of money transfer services, in his community.

Maurice has been running his business for over three years, now. He says the first Kiva loan helped him to expand his business. He managed to open two more outlets in the capital city, Lusaka. Maurice now employs six young people to help him in the day-to-day running of his business. He is happy with how the business has given him the opportunity to provide for his family. He is able to pay his children’s school fees, as well as the basic household expenses of his family, from the profits he earns.

Maurice is requesting a second loan, which he will use to continue to grow his existing business. This loan will be used to add to his working capital, so that he can successfully serve more customers who are looking to send and receive money from his booth. Being able to serve more customers will bring Maurice additional profits that he can use, to reinvest in his business and provide for his family.

loans.use: To serve more customers who need money transfer services

loans.name: Maa Aruhasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Maa Aruhasuni Self Help Group is a group consisting of 11 members, all of whom are women. These entrepreneurs are very humble, hardworking and responsible people with good manners and lots of enthusiasm to improve their lives. A few years back, they all were facing the same kind of situation of poverty, so they planned to start grocery shops where they can provide the basic household consumables to their customers. One of them is Surati, who was selected as their president. 

Surati is a 44-year-old lady living with her husband and her five children. The lady in the picture standing with her raised hand is Surati. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory situated near to her village. She runs a grocery shop to help her husband financially. She sells rice, grains, lentils, edible oil, spices, biscuits, soap, detergent, hair oil, etc. in her shop. She has developed a very good relationship with her customers in the village. She likes the fact that she can cater to the needs of the people in her village. She has a plan to make her shop bigger and keep multiple things in her shop to satisfy her customers. She also wants to purchase the items for her shop in bulk directly from the wholesalers. She has requested a loan to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables.

loans.use: to purchase items like toothbrushes, toothpaste, soft drinks, wheat flour, grains and other household consumables in bulk

loans.name: Bhabani Sankar Shg Group

texts.en:
Kabitarani is a 28-year-old woman who lives in a small village in the Bhadrak district, Odisha, India with her two children. In the picture, the woman standing with her raised hand is Kabitarani. A few years back, she started a business making and selling flour, such as wheat flour, maize flour, gram flour, lentil flour, rice flour, etc. She makes these flours with the help of grinders. She makes a variety of flours depending on the demand for flour in the market. 

All the members of this group do different businesses like fishing, dairy, vegetable cultivation, etc. Kabitarani, along with her group, is requesting a loan of 225,000 INR. Kabitarani will use her portion to buy more supplies such as wheat, maize, grains, etc. and a new grinder machine. With this investment, she will expand her business so that she can generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her family. She is requesting within a group of nine members who are all women and live in the same community. They named their group “Bhabani Sankar Self Help Group”.

loans.use: to buy more supplies, such as wheat, maize, and grains and a new grinder machine

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban es divorciado pero tiene dos hijos Esteban esta viviendo en la casa de sus padres en la comunidad de Jalumi en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus padres Esteban trabaja como albañil  y necesita un credito para comprar herramientas para sus trabajos  Esteban es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Esteban is divorced but has two children. He is living in his parents' home in the Jalumi community in an adobe house.

Esteban works as a builder and needs a loan to buy tools for his jobs. Esteban is the only source of income for his household, and that is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy tools for his jobs.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Group

texts.en:
Yehowa Dzi group is beginning their first loan with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner. It is made up of four members who sell clothing, second-hand bags, charcoal, wigs and batiks.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small businesses of the group of which Rita is a member. She tells us that she joined ID-Ghana barely six months ago. She currently has a business selling clothing and bags. She started this business two years ago. Some time passed and she decided to open her business independently with a small amount of capital.

The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital so she can purchase clothing and bags in bulk. She will purchase clothing and bags from the market and will later sell the goods to customers through hawking. This type of work allows her to generate the resources that she needs to support her family. 

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the loans and the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and bags from the market to sell to customers through hawking.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto es soltero no tiene hijos y vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento  donde paga un alquiler Sixto es costurero y también es músico en una banda donde toca la trompeta Sixto necesita un credito para comprar una maquina recta de costura  Sixto es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar (por el momento vive solo) y necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Sixto is single with no children and lives in El Alto. He lives in a brick and cement where he pays rent. Sixto is a tailor and also a musician in a band where he plays the trumpet. Sixto needs a loan to buy a sewing machine. He is the only source of income in his home (for the moment he lives alone) and needs your help.

loans.use: to buying a sewing machine.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 22-year-old single lady from Jabalia city. She lives with her family in a small house. Samar's father works in a sewing workshop with a very low and unstable income. Samar is a student in a local university where she studies Elementary Education. She would like to earn a BA degree and find a better job to help his family

Samar took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Samar will be able to read articles online and prepare for her seminar 

Samar appears in the photo with her laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies in accounting

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 49-year-old, married woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City, and she has two children. She and her husband earn a living running a general store, which they have done for seven years.

Hoa would like to take a loan. She will use it to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store, such as snack foods and confectionery. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers, and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan, her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions. She also wants to save money, for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to stock her general store

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose es soltero no tiene hijos Jose vive en El Alto en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que le pertenece a sus padres  Jose trabaja como tecnico instalador Jose quiere un credito para comprar material de construccion y hacer construir una habitacion para alquilarla Jose es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Jose is single, and he does not have any children. He lives in El Alto in a brick and cement house that belongs to his parents. He works as an installation technician.

Jose wants this loan to purchase construction materials and to build a room to rent out. Jose is the only one who earns an income in his home, which is why he needs the help.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, and to build to a room to rent out.

loans.name: Victor Francisco

texts.es:
el Sr. Victor Francisco labora para una empresa publica que suministra el agua potable desde hace 14 años imiciando sus labores desde las 6:00 am finalizando a las 6:00 pm de luenes a sabado.
el Sr Victor Francisco necesita este credito para la contruccion de un cuarto de habitacion ya que su familia va creciendo y siente la necesidad de ir creando las condiciones necesarias para brindarle una comodidad para el y su familia.
texts.en: Victor Francisco has worked for a public business that supplies potable water for 14 years, starting his work at 6 A.M. and finishing at 6 P.M. Monday to Saturday. Victor Francisco needs this loan for the construction of a bedroom because his family is growing, and he feels the necessity of creating necessary conditions to afford himself and his family comfort.

loans.use: to buy blocks, sand, iron, cement, zinc, and beams

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 25-year-old married man from Khan younis. He is a father with one son and two daughters. He works as an employee in the public sector where he earns very little. Shadi decided to start a business, which is transferring goods using his rickshaw. This will help him to increase the family income and improve their living conditions. 
Shadi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new Rickshaw to replace the old one. By taking this loan, Shadi will be able to improve his productivity and also his income. 
Shadi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new Rickshaw to replace the old one

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Djiguiya est un regroupement de femmes de Hamdallaye qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans, sont mariées et ont  au moins 3 enfants. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, de Beignet, Bois de chauffage, Habillements, Produit cosmétiques  et divers. Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe.  
Kadia est un membre du groupe Djiguiya assise au milieu, vendeuse des Produits cosmétiques (pommade, déodorant, crèmes, lotions, etc.). 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter au fur et à mesure  les produits cosmétiques en qualité et en quantité. Elle s’approvisionne aux marchés de Koutiala et  vend ces produits en détail et au comptant à une clientèle diverse. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Djiguiya comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle Mme Kadia compte réaliser  120 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnelles et augmenter son fonds de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent voir renforcer ce partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Djiguiya is a group of women from Hamdallaye who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children and other relatives. They average 47 years of age, are married and have at least three children each. 

This group of women buy and sell a variety of products including fritters, firewood, clothing, cosmetics and others. The members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program so that they could increase their business volume. They are on their tenth group loan.

Kadia is a member of the Djiguiya group and she is sitting in the middle of the photo. She sells toiletries and cosmetics (ointments, deodorant, creams and lotions etc.). She is planning to use her loan progressively to buy large quantities of quality toiletries and cosmetics. She gets her supplies in the Koutiala markets and sells her products on a retail basis for cash to a diverse customer base. 

While the other members of the Djiguiya group expect to make an average profit of 105,000FCFA each during this cycle, Kadia expects to make 120,000FCFA. The women use their income to repay their loans but also to cover personal expenses and expand their businesses. They would like to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that they do not run low on their stocks.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy is 41 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cathy is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feed and vitamins for her business.

Cathy has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from shoe repair.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feed and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen is 55 years old. She is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns money by making bags. She is requesting a loan in order to repair the roof of her house, which currently leaks when it rains. She hopes this loan will help her be protected from the sunshine and the rain, and will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her house

loans.name: Cheryl Marie

texts.en:
Cheryl Marie is 33 years old and single.  

Cheryl Marie is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Cheryl Marie requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cheryl Marie has been in this business for 8 years and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cheryl Marie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gülşen

texts.en:
Gülşen is a single mother raising her daughter by herself and working to provide a good future for her. Gülşen is earning money by selling cleaning products.  She started small but over the course of time, she increased her sales.  She is selling her products to stores or individual buyers. With this loan, she will buy goods. She is planning to increase her business so she can open her own store.  She is hard working, ambitious and planning to send her daughter to a good school.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Gülşen Hanım, kızını tek başına büyütmeye çalışan ve kızına iyi bir gelecek sağlamak isteyen genç bir anne.Gülşen hanım Ersağ temizlik ürünlerini satarak geçimini sağlıyor.  Bu işe küçük bir sermaye ile başlamış ve zamanla daha çok mal alıp satarak sermayesini ve satışlarını artırmış.  Evde ve tezgahta ürünlerini ihtiyacı olan herkese satıyor. Aldığı kredi ile malzeme alacak.  Sermayesini ve işini büyüterek dükkan açmak istiyor.  Çalışkan ve azimli olan Gülşen hanım kızının en iyi okullarda okumasını istiyor.

loans.use: to buy more cleaning products to sell

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik lives in Yerevan town with her son. She has been providing manicure service to locals in her town for many years. Hasmik is very hard working and enthusiastic woman who loves her work. She has requested this loan to be able to purchase manicure accessories, tools and equipment needed for her work. Hasmik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for manicure accessories, tools and equipment

loans.name: Selver

texts.en:
Selver is married, 20 years old and has a son.  When her son was older she heard that she could sell products from home.  She bought her own products and started to sell them to friends, but after she made some money she started to reach more people and earned some extra support for her family budget.  She heard about Maya's micro loans from friends  and applied.  She increased her products and made more sales with the loan.  She wants to provide a good future for her son.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Selver Hanım, evli ve 20 yaşında bir oğlu var.  Oğlunu büyüttükten sonra evden satış sistemiyle satış yapılabildiğini duymuş. Ürünleri önce kendi için almış sonra yakınlarına satmaya başlamış.  Satışlardan para kazanınca daha çok insana ulaşmaya başlamış ve aile ekonomisine katkı sağlamış.  Maya mikro kredi kullananlardan maya ile bilgi almış ve müracaat etmiş.  Aldığı kredi ile network sisteminden ürün çekerek satışlarını artırmış.  Çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek hazırlamak  istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods for resale

loans.name: Sr De Coyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR DE COYLLORITY CACHIMAYO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cachimayo, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Carmen ella es casada, tiene 46 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y comida para su negocio.
La foto fue tomada en dos grupos ya que el grupo de 5 socias estaba cocinando para el resto del grupo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de chompas, negocio de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, crianza de animales menores, ganadería y venta de comida.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the community bank "Sr de Coyllority Cachimayo." This bank is situated in the Cachimayo district. It belongs to the Anta province and the department of Cusco.

The member is Carmen. She is married, is 46 years old, and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens. She has been in this business for a good while. It is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her business everyday.

The member raises these small animals in order to sell them later to her customers who ask for them. She would like to continue working in order to continue supporting her family in this way. The member is applying for the loan to buy guinea pigs and food for her business.

The photo was taken in two groups, since the group of 5 members was cooking for the rest of the group. The other members make their living in the sweater-selling business, the clothing business, the grocery store business, raising small animals, livestock, and food sales.

The member is grateful to all who form part of this dream through these means, and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and food for her business.

loans.name: Haman

texts.en:
Haman is 49 years old and married to Naomi. They have three children. He has been in the farming business and also runs a retail shop. He earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES.                                                                           

He has applied for his second loan of 15,000 KES with Vision Fund Kenya to buy farm inputs (e.g., seedlings) and to add more inventory of wheat flour, sugar, and rice for the retail shop. He plans to use the anticipated income to expand his business and educate his children.
	
He hopes to have a bright future and open a supermarket.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to add store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy creams, lipstick and perfume.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charlyn is 33 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Charlyn has a business raising pigs in the Philippines. Charlyn requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Charlyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, Charlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dionesia would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is a married woman with five children, four of whom are still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for five years.

Emelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use it to buy additional materials for fishing, like fishing nets, bamboo, and gasoline.

In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for fishing, like fishing nets, bamboo and gasoline

loans.name: Nazife

texts.en:
Nazife is a young, 25 year old entrepreneur. A hardworking and ambitious woman, when she graduated from university she opened an office to provide consultancy and education services to people and married couples. She will use the loan from Maya to buy supplies she needs for her office. She has big goals for her career in consultancy and life coaching. She wants to expand her business and open branches in other provinces.
Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Nazife Hanım, 25 yaşında genç bir girişimci. Çalışkan ve hırslı bir yapıya sahip olan Nazife hanım  Üniversiteden mezun olunca açtığı bürosunda kişilere ve evli çiftlere danışmanlık ve eğitim hizmeti veriyor. Mayadan aldığı kredi ile ofisinde eksik olan malzemeleri aldı. Danışmalık ve yaşam koçluğu yaptığı meslek hayatında büyük hedefleri var.İşlerini büyütmek ve ülkenin diğer illerinde şubeler açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her office

loans.name: Lucas Santiago

texts.es:
Lucas tiene 61 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado debido a que en el  lugar donde él vivía las escuelas quedaban lejos de su casa y por la distancia no pudo continuar estudiando más tiempo, es  casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  tiene 3 hijos entre 7 y 16 años de edad y están bajo su responsabilidad, en su hogar solo habitan su esposa, él y sus tres hijos.

Lucas se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra granos básicos como el maíz y frijol, se dedica a este trabajo desde pequeño gracias a que su padre le enseñó hacer los siembras y el continuó para poder tener sus propias cosechas, el trabajo le queda a un kilómetro de distancia, y no tiene un horario definido debido a que sus cosechas necesitan de mucho cuido.

El préstamo lo necesita para el trabajo agrícola, la preparación de la tierra, comprará fertilizantes, abono, también para mejorar su vivienda pues se ha deteriorado, comprará cemento, arena, hierro, madera y otros materiales que necesite para la reparación.

Lucas desea para un futuro poder expandir  sus cultivos, también ampliar su vivienda para poder darle una mejor vida a su familia, y desea poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lucas is 61 years old and studied through the third grade.  In the place where he lives, the schools are located far away from his house.  Due to the distance, he was not able to devote more time to continuing his studies.  Lucas is married and his wife takes care of the household duties.  They have three children between the ages of 7 and 16, all of whom are still under his responsibility.  Lucas, his wife, and their three children live by themselves at home.  

Lucas is a farmer who cultivates basic staples, such as corn and beans.  He has been in this line of work from a very young age.  His father taught him how to plant crops, so Lucas continued the trade so that he could have harvests of his own.  His work requires him to walk a distance of one kilometer.  Lucas does not have a defined schedule since his crops need a great deal of care.  

The loan he is requesting will be used for his farm work and preparing the land.  He will buy fertilizers and compost.  Lucas will also make improvements to his dilapidated home, so he will buy cement, sand, iron, wood, and other materials that are needed for repairs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and materials for making home repairs.

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Son las siete de la mañana y tras haber tomado su cafecito caliente, doña Haydee sale de su casa a vender en algunas calles el mejor pan, fresco y recién horneado de la ciudad. Tiene 45 años de edad, está soltera y tiene 5 hijos, tres de ellos son mayores e independientes, los menores asisten a clases, que es lo primordial para ella. Hace 18 años inició con la venta de pan desde su casa, pero las ventas eran bajas por lo que decidió vender el producto de casa en casa.  Poco a poco, con el apoyo de su familia ha logrado salir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar variedad de pan, así como pan dulce, pan tostado, pan con mantequilla, entre otros. Haydee deposita su confianza en el financiamiento para poder elevar sus ganancias y así cumplir uno de sus sueños tener su propia panadería. Por lo tanto, esta mujer luchadora y trabajadora, no se va a rendir fácilmente, puesto que su familia es su fuente de inspiración y desea brindarles mejores condiciones de vida y un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
It is 6 in the morning, and after having had her hot coffee, Haydee leaves her home to sell the best, fresh baked bread in the city. She is 45 years old, single, and she has five children. Three of her children are grown up and independent, and the younger ones go to school, which is the most important thing for Haydee. 

She began her bread sales 18 years ago from her home, but her sales were low, so she decided to sell her product door to door. Slowly, with the help of her family, she has been able to get ahead. 

She is requesting this loan to increase the production of her capital, which requires purchasing a variety of bread: sweet bread, toasted bread, and bread with butter, among others. Haydee is leaving her trust in the financing to be able to increase her earnings and be able to fulfill one of her dreams, which is to have her own bakery. This fighting and hard-working woman will not give up easily, because her family is her inspiration, and she wants to give them better living conditions and a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of bread, including sweet bread, toasted bread, and bread with butter, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and the feed and supplies needed to raise them.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase large bales of clothing to increase and diversify her stock and expand her business profits

loans.name: Placksedes

texts.en:
Placksedes is a 32-year-old married mother with four children. She lives in Zimbabwe’s Buhera District. Since 2012, Placksedes has been operating a flea market where she buys and sells clothing including shoes, jeans, hats, and socks. She also volunteers as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school promoting the use of study groups and teaching students life skills. 

Placksedes is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her inventory by buying more clothing including shoes, jeans, hats, and socks. Her loan will boost her profits, raise her standard of living, and allow her to better care for her four children.

loans.use: to buy more clothes in bulk

loans.name: Ropafadzo

texts.en:
Ropafadzo is 23 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in Zimbabwe’s Buhera district where she operates a poultry project at her home. Ropafadzo raises broiler chickens to sell and provide food for her community. She is also volunteering as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she teaches students valuable life skills. 

Ropafadzo requested a loan, which she will use to buy more chicks to raise and sell. With her profits, she hopes to improve her family’s standard of living and help vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en: Maxim is 43 years old, married, and the father of three children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from his home in Fuzuli city. Now he lives in Bala Bahmanli village, of the Fuzuli region. Previously, Maxim took a loan from Komak for his driving business. But a year ago, he decided to start an animal-breeding business and bought a cow. Now, he wants to buy one more cow for development of this business.  Therefore he needs 700 AZN. For all help Maxim says great thanks to the Kiva organization and all lenders.

loans.use: to buy one more cow

loans.name: Dalila

texts.es:
Dalila es una joven emprendedora, con 23 años de edad, vive en el Departamento de San Martín junto a su abuelo y su sobrina.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, por eso desde hace más de 1 año se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de plátanos de diversas variedades y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, entusiasta y amable con sus clientes; con el dinero ganado cubre los gastos de su hogar porque su abuelito no puede trabajar.
Su mayor motivación es su familia, es por ello que lucha cada día por brindarles un futuro mejor.
Dalila está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que con el apoyo brindado ella podrá remodelar su vivienda así como las paredes y el techo para que su familia pueda sentirse más segura y tener mayor comodidad en su hogar, de esta manera estará mejorando su calidad de vida y podrá sentirse tranquila e ir a trabajar todos los días con el mismo entusiasmo que la caracteriza.
texts.en:
Dalila is a enterprising young woman who is 23 years old. She lives in the department of San Martín with her grandfather and her niece. She really wants to get ahead, which is she has worked buying and selling bananas of many different varieties for more than a year. Things are going well for her because she is very responsible, enthusiastic, and friendly with the clients. With the money that she earns, she covers costs in her home because her grandfather can no longer work. Her biggest motivation is her family, which is the reason that she fights every day to give them a better future.

Dalila is thankful to the Kiva loaners because with their support, she will be able to remodel her home, including the walls and roof, so that her family can feel safer and be more comfortable in their home. She is improving their quality of life this way, and she will feel more comfortable going to work every day with the same enthusiasm that characterizes her.

loans.use: to remodel the walls and roof of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale chicken.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 45 years old and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is married.

Estelita is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She fattens pigs. Estelita requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Estelita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. Estelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a married woman with eleven children, three of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Estelita is 55 years old.

Estelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Estelita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Estelita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 53 years old and married with six children.

Estrella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Estrella has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Estrella aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is an experienced agronomist from Tasik village of Syunik region. She lives with her husband. They have been engaged in agriculture for more than 21 years. They keep cows, calves and cultivate wheat and potatoes. With the help of her husband she sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of their income. 

Lida’s agricultural business currently needs some investments in order to continue developing in a sustainable way. A loan of USD 1500 will help her greatly, enabling her to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, and cover cultivation costs. As this is Lida’s first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Nina  and her husband rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will appreciate their support greatly.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds, fertilizer, and cover cultivation costs

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is an experienced agronomist from Hartashen village, of the Syunik region. She lives with her husband and two sons. 

It has been more than five years since Narine and her husband have been engaged in cattle breeding, in aviculture, and in breeding a livestock of sheep. With the help of her husband, Narine sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is a very important source of their income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Narine needs a loan of USD 3,000 to pay for two cows and barley, as a forage for the livestock.

She has already taken a loan from a local financial institution, but unfortunately she wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to hard work during recent times, Narine was able to run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that she will be able to cover the monthly payments. 

So, she has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. 

Narine and her family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to maintain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and barley, as a forage for the livestock.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
These members are part of a group called Christo Nti and are into clothes, slippers, vegetables and fish. They live in traditional families in Teshie, Accra, Ghana.

These members have joined the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities. 

Grace, a member of the group, sells fish and vegetables. In the photo, she is standing on the right. She plans to use her loan to buy fish and vegetables to sell to customers. She is expecting to make a good profit. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and to contribute to her large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy fish and vegetables to sell to customers

loans.name: Layali Al- Mater Group

texts.en:
This group is called Layali Al- Mater. It consists of four women members from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a group loan of YER 100,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Reem is the leader of the group. She is a 22-year-old, single woman, living with her family in a rented house in Sana'a. Reem is a very active and dynamic woman. She is a very talented and professional young woman. She works hard in order to improve the condition of her family. 

Recently, Reem became an employee as a nurse in the private sector, with a small salary. Her salary is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, she decided to work as a tailor. She has a good experience in this business. Unfortunately, she doesn't have the necessary materials in order to start this business. 

As a result, Reem is asking for a loan of YER 30,000 from AMB to purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials in order to sew the clothes of the people in her area.

Reem hopes to purchase a piece of land and to build her own house on that land.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and sewing materials in order to sew the clothes of the people in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more tie dye, lace and wax cotton for resale.

loans.name: Şadiye

texts.en:
Şadiye is married and has two children. She has been contributing to her family's income and country's economy. Şadiye first uses the products from her company, and if she is happy with it she becomes a member and then sells them to her neighbors. This way, both she and her friends grow via membership. With the help of the loan, she will increase her income percentage by buying bulk goods. Her biggest dream is to upgrade to a diamond membership, in order to provide a better education to her children.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff. 

Şadiye Hanım, evli ve iki çocuk annesi.  1 yıldır network sistemiyle aile ve ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor.  Şadiye hanım sattığı network sistemindeki ürünleri önce kendisi alıp kullanıyor bu ürünlerden memnun kalınca kendisi üye oluyor.  Böylece hem kendine ürün alıyor hem de çevresine satmaya başlıyor.  Çevresindeki insanları da üye yaparak büyümeye başlıyor.  Maya'dan aldığı kredi ile toptan mal alarak yüzdesini artırdı.  En büyük hayal, yaptığı network işinde elmas üyeliğe yükselmek ve çocuklarına daha iyi bir eğitim sağlamak.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Umid

texts.ru:
Умид молодой человек в возрасте 28 лет. Умид общительный, трудолюбивый и очень добросовестный.  Он женат, отец двоих детей. Жена Умида  Гулрухсор не где не работает, занимается воспитанием детей. Умид мастер своего дела. Никогда без работы не сидит, ведь он единственный добытчик в семье. Умид работает в железнодорожной базе, кроме этого по сезону  он еще  занимается обделочными ремонтами квартир.
 Умид не давно затеял ремонт, он решил обустроить свой дом более в современном виде и со всеми удобствами, чтобы в доме всегда  царил уют и теплота. Поэтому Умид собирается установить в доме теплые полы. Зимой он может сэкономить денег от покупки угля и дров. Но для осуществление планов  ему своих накопленных денег не хватает, поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой, в надежде получить деньги в кредит . Он планирует купить строительные материалы для установки теплых полов. 
Умид честный ответственный клиент. Всегда своевременно погашает свой долг. Умид хотел бы выразить свою благодарность МДО Арванд за своевременную помощь и конечно же за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Umid is a young man, age 28. He is sociable, hard-working, and very conscientious. He is married and has two children. His wife, Gulrukhsor, takes care of the children and does not have a job. Umid is a master of his trade and is always working because he provides the main income for his family. He works at the railway depot and also repairs apartments on a seasonal basis. 

Umid recently started repairing his home after deciding to modernize and install all the amenities to make it comfortable and warm. He is getting ready to install underfloor heating, which will allow him to save money on coal and wood in the winter. He does not have the money to carry out his plan and has therefore applied for a loan with MDO Arvand, hoping to receive credit. He plans to buy building materials to install underfloor heating.

Umid is an honest and responsible customer who always repays his debts on time. He would like to express gratitude for MDO Arvand's assistance and financial support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and install underfloor heating

loans.name: Müge

texts.en:
Müge opened a small shop, with her family's support. With her hard-working and driven nature, she both runs the shop and studies at university. Her shop contributes to both her family's income and the economy of the country. She uses her income to pay for her own and her siblings' school fees. She will use the loan from Maya to develop her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Ailesinin desteği ile küçük bir bayi açmış. Çalışkan ve hırslı bir yapıya sahip olan Müge Hanım hem bayisini işletiyor hem de üniversitede okuyor. İşlettiği bayi ile hem aile hem de ülke ekonomisine katkı sağlıyor. Kendisinin ve kardeşlerinin okul masraflarını karşılıyor. Mayadan aldığı kredi ile işini geliştirmek istiyor.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell at the shop

loans.name: Agron

texts.en: Agron is married and has two children. He works as a construction worker and has a lot of experience and customers in this area, but also wants to work with his wife in agriculture. At this time they have a cow that they use for their family’s consumption of dairy products, but they would like to start selling the milk and products for extra income. For this reason he is requesting a loan to purchase another cow. This loan will help them to have a better standard of living and higher income. He is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To  purchase another cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes in bulk for her inventory

loans.name: Leonah

texts.en:
Leonah is 22 years old and married. She lives in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. She sells clothing and shoes at the local flea market, a business she started in 2013. She also volunteers at her local school as a Learner Guide, teaching life skills and improving the well-being of students.

With a Kiva loan, Leonah will invest in increasing her stock of t-shirts, trousers for men, jeans for both sexes, women’s sandals and shoes. She also wants to hire some help to assist with her venture, and she hopes to build her own shop, some day. Leonah’s profits will allow her to assist needy children in her community and continue her education.

loans.use: To increase her clothing stock

loans.name: Ljiljana

texts.en:
Liljana is a married woman with two children, living in a minority community in Kosovo. The community that they live in is very poor and in bad condition. Many of the people there are unemployed and live in substandard housing. Liljana is fortunate to be working, together with her husband, for an electric company. She does administrative work. Also, she works on their land, growing potatoes, tomatoes, corn, and wheat. For many years they have had problems with their roof and have not managed to fix it yet.

Recently, Liljana heard about KosInvest for the first time. She has decided to request a loan, which she will use to repair the roof. This loan will help her to improve the living conditions of her family. She works hard to improve their living conditions and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To repair the roof of the house

loans.name: Winfilda

texts.en:
Winfilda is a 26-year-old, married mother of one. She lives with her husband and stepmother, in the Mwenezi District of Zimbabwe. Since 2013 Winfilda has been a hair dresser, providing beauty services out of her home. To give back to her community, Winfilda has been volunteering as a Learner Guide, teaching life skills to improve the well-being of local students.

With a Kiva loan, she will establish her own salon and purchase more hair extensions and treatments. Increasing her family’s income will improve their quality of life and enable her to better provide for her child.

loans.use: To establish her own hair salon and purchase hair treatments and supplies.

loans.name: Aby

texts.fr:
Aby est une dame âgée de 36 ans qui évolue dans le domaine du commerce. Elle tient un étalage devant chez elle. Elle a démarré avec un capital de 50 000F qui lui permirent d’acheter 5 kg de pâtes d’arachide huit bouteilles d’huiles et divers petits produits alimentaires. Elle a renouvelé l’expérience deux fois avant de venir à l’IMCEC pour pouvoir bénéficier d’un crédit de 100 000f pour augmenter la quantité de pates d’arachides et diversifier avec d’autres produits alimentaires qui, vendus, peuvent générer un bénéfice.
Aby est célibataire et son bénéfice lui permet de se prendre en charge et de participer aux charges de sa famille.
Elle aimerait si elle a une augmentation de capital, augmenter davantage la quantité des produits vendus et pourquoi ne pas ouvrir une cantine.
texts.en:
Aby is a 36-year-old woman who is developing [her business] in sales. She has a stall in front of her house. She started [her business] with 50,000 CFA francs in capital, which allowed her to purchase 5kg of groundnut paste, eight bottles of oils, and various small food products. She repeated this experience twice before joining UIMCEC in order to receive a loan of 100,000 CFA francs to increase the amount of groundnut paste [she could purchase] and diversify into other food products that, when sold, can turn a profit.

Aby is single and her profits allow her to take care of herself and to contribute to the family expenses. She would like it if she had an increase in capital, [to] further increase the number of products sold and [possibly] open a store in the market.

loans.use: To purchase groundnut paste and other various food products to sell.

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en:
Sevindj is a 43-year-old single woman living with her parents and brother. Her family members have been internally displaced persons (IDP) from Füzuli city for 20 years, and are now living in the village of Asagi Abdurrahmanli, which is located in the Füzuli region. 

Sevindj breeds cows, and her mother helps her in her business, selling their milk and milk products such as yogurt, cheese, etc. Sevindj now wants to buy more cows to expand her enterprise and is therefore requesting a loan of 2100 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). 

Thankful for Kiva's help, Sevindj wants to build a big stall for her cows and start a sheep-breeding business in the future. She also wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy more cows to expand her business

loans.name: Nelvie

texts.en:
Nelvie is married with one child. She is currently pregnant with her second child. 

She has been involved in farming and tilling their rice field since she married her husband eight years ago. From her farming activity, she is able to gain 10,000.00 monthly net profit.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of fertilizer, two bottles of pesticides, and a bottle of herbicides

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is married with two children. She's been into farming for eight years together with her husband. She's earning PHP 10,000 monthly net income from farming and other agriculture activities such as gardening, hog raising and duck raising. Recently, she applied a loan to pay for land preparation and to buy  fertilizer and pesticides. Marivic hopes to sustain her business.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and to buy  fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Todas las tardes se desprende un olor exquisito a carne asada, chancho con yuca, tajada con queso, entre otras delicias en la fritanga de María Esther. No hay vecino que se resista a comprar algo de la comida tradicional que esta mujer con esmero prepara. Tiene 25 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos. Inició su negocio hace un año y medio, contaba con un pequeño capital, al comienzo sólo vendía tacos y enchiladas, con el tiempo y con la ayuda de su familia ha ido creciendo y aumentado su producción.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos como carne, cerdo, plátanos, condimentos, bolsas, entre otros. María deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela mejorar e incrementar las ventas, al mismo tiempo variar. Su meta es tener un local propio, puesto que en el que comercializa es el de su madre, su plan es ubicarlo en un punto donde transiten más personas. Es una mujer soñadora y emprendedora, desea brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Every afternoon, the exquisite smell of carne asada (roasted beef), pork with yuca (cassava) and sliced plantains with cheese drifts from María Esther's grill, among other delights. None of her neighbors can resist buying some of the traditional food that this woman prepares with care. She is 25 years old, is married and has two children. She started her business a year and a half ago with a small amount of capital. In the beginning she only sold tacos and enchiladas. Over time and with the help of her family, her production has been growing and increasing.

She is asking for the loan to buy products like beef, pork, plantains, condiments and bags, among other items. María puts her trust in the financing, as she longs to improve and increase her sales while varying her offerings. Her goal is to have her own place, as the place where she sells belongs to her mother. Her plan is to move to a place where more people pass by. She is an entrepreneurial woman with big dreams, and she wants to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy products like beef, pork, plantains, condiments and bags, among other items otros.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 54 years old, married and has seven children, two of whom are in school. 

Cresencia is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Cresencia has been farming sugarcane for twenty-three years now, and she has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Cresencia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Cresencia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri runs a small stall which sells gas for stoves and mobile phone airtime credits. Tri lives in Jakarta, an urban area. Tri is single. 

Tri began working with Ruma one year ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. Before this loan, he was also receiving Kiva loans for the same purpose, but with smaller amount. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to be able to process more transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.use: to purchase a printer to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to the customers in the local markets.

loans.name: Antoni

texts.en:
Antoni runs a small stall where he sells snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Cilegon, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Antoni is single and living with five people in the family home. 

Antoni began working with Ruma for approximately more than one year ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Hysni

texts.en:
Hysni, age 37, is a married father of two children, ages 8 and 11 years old. He is employed as a guard, while his wife works in a market. In addition, they have a cow that they use for providing milk and dairy products, both for family use and to sell in the market for additional income. However, the money that they are generating with both jobs and their milk business, is barely enough to meet their daily needs.

Hysni has been very satisfied with his involvement and income in agriculture, and he wants to purchase another milk cow, to satisfy more customers' needs. This loan will help him to increase the income for his family, and he hopes to be able to continue expanding his farm in the future. He promises to pay on time and thanks all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase another milk cow

loans.name: Besim

texts.en:
The borrower, Besim, is 37 years old and a married father of two children. He lives together with his family, in the northern part of Kosovo. Besim is a businessman who sells fruits and vegetables in the market, at a higher rate than he purchases them at. As he is the main source of income, he also plants wheat and corn. He loves working in agriculture.

Now, for the first time, he is requesting a loan. He will use it to purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale, to sell for profit at the market. This loan will help him to increase his income and continue to work in this way. He is very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Blerta

texts.en: Blerta wants to thank all of the lenders for her previous loan, which helped her to renovate her house. Her husband is still performing for various events and celebrations, such as weddings, as the main source of income for their family. Blerta is asking for a second loan now, in order to finish her house and façade the inside. In this way, she will be able to continue to improve the standard of living for her family. She wants to thank the lenders for their continued support and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Ivana

texts.en: The borrower, Ivana, comes from a minority community. She is a mother of three children and is a very lovely woman. She loves her family greatly and tries to give her children everything that they want and is best for them. While her husband receives a pension, she is working as a nurse in order to be able to provide everything possible. Her income is limited, and she struggles to improve their living conditions as she wants. Specifically, her house is in need of some renovations, in order for her family to live in a comfortable environment. Ivana is asking for a loan, which she will use to renovate the house and create a better atmosphere for her children to learn and grow in. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support, and she promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To renovate the house

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a librarian. She's been working at the city library for many years. She's got an adult son who lives with her and helps Maria at home. She lost her husband a few years ago through a disease.

Maria is asking for a loan to fix the bathroom in her home. She wants to change the sewer system, put in a new washbasin and put new tiles on the floor and walls. The loan will help Maria to improve her and her son's living conditions.

loans.use: to fix her bathroom

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 32, resident of Cabrera, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Razel and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Marilyn operates the buy and sell business of her family. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, and then sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Marilyn dreams to have her own stall in the market and hopes to have their own house. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Emelio

texts.en:
Emelio is 63 years old and very responsible with his household obligations since he has always been known to provide the best for his family. He currently lives with his wife and children in Sibutad. He is a farmer who plants corn and beans.

Emelio wants to increase sales. Consequently, he has requested a loan that will enable him to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer, among other items, so that he can continue to put bread on the table in his home.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and fertilizer

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is 49 years old and married with eleven children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Bella has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Bella requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional unit of motorcycle for her business.

Bella  has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Bella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit of motorcycle for her business

loans.name: Mang's Group

texts.en:
Mang lives in a rural area of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. He is 25 years old and married with one child. He makes a living growing rice and raising four pigs. He earns about 16,000KHR per day. 

Mang is new to VisionFund for this cycle. He  leads his group in asking for a loan. As the leader, Mang will use his portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farm. 

He hopes to grow more crops and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for his farmland.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Driton

texts.en:
Driton is a musician who performs for weddings and other events and celebrations, especially during the summer season. He started as a relatively unknown performer and has since become quite famous and popular in his area, which allows him to earn more income than others. Unfortunately, this kind of business is primarily during the summer season, and the rest of the year is very slow and quiet. 

Driton has decided that after this upcoming summer busy season, he will work transporting goods and eventually people for a fee while he has no musical work. At this time, he is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary transportation vehicle so that he can continue to earn an income all year long. This way he will be able to provide better conditions for his family, as well as a better education for his five children. He wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a vehicle to start a transportation business

loans.name: Selvie

texts.en: Selvie is a 33-year-old woman who is married and lives with her husband in a small town in Kosovo. Currently, her husband is working as a salesman in the market, but the money that he earns is not enough for them to meet their needs and plan for their future, especially when they have children. Because of this reality, Selvie’s husband has decided to increase their income by starting a taxi business. They will need a loan in order to purchase a van to transport the customers and is requesting that lenders help her and her husband get started on this business. She is hoping that this loan will help her to make enough money to save for their future and is also hoping to be able to find her own work so that she can also contribute to the family budget. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a van to transport the customers

loans.name: Chorm's Group

texts.en:
Chorm, 54, lives with her husband and four children in a village of Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 23 years and they supplement family’s income by working for others for a fee. 
Chorm has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for four cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Nuhi

texts.en: Nuhi comes from the Ashki community and at 22 years old he is already the father of two children. In order to earn a living, he works as a free lancer in construction where he paints and builds different items based on the customer's needs and requests. He is very hardworking and does much to support his family. Currently, he is in need of a loan in order to purchase construction tools including a machine. This loan will help him to continue his business and he hopes in the near future to expand his business enough to hire an employee and to work on large projects. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support for his business.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools including a machine

loans.name: Zorica

texts.en: Zorica is 54 and a widowed mother of two living in a minority community. For more than six years now, she has been running her own market selling different beverages. She has a lot of customers and needs to be open from early in the morning until late at night in order to meet all of the needs of her customers. She is able to purchase the beverages cheap and sell them at a higher price in order to make a profit and support her family. Now, she is requesting a loan so that she can purchase other items and products so she can start selling more variety of items such as salt, sugar, chocolates and such. She is very satisfied with her business and hopes to continue in the future, as well as enjoy success with the business expanded into a larger store. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a greater variety of items for her store, such as salt, sugar, and chocolates

loans.name: Rushadije

texts.en: Rushadije comes from a Roma community in Kosovo. She lives with her husband and four children in a small village where they are involved in agricultural work in order to make a living. They plant different vegetables such as tomatoes and peppers that they sell in the market. Rushadije is requesting a loan so that she can purchase fertilizer and seeds for her land and to prepare for the upcoming farming season. This loan will help her and her family to have much more income and to provide for their needs. She hopes to continue to develop and grow her business so that she can achieve her goal of giving her children a better future. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Dragana

texts.en:
Dragana wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which she has used to purchase wood and coal to prepare for the winter. The loan was very beneficial to them and their winter was much warmer and had less utility costs, providing better living conditions. 

Now, for the second time, she is requesting a loan in order to repair her broken roof. She would like to borrow again through KosInvest because of the positive and successful experience she has had already. Although she is still searching for a job, her husband continues to work for the electrical company and they hope that they will not have any further needs for their house after this repair. She promises to pay the loan back on time and is very grateful to the lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To repair her broken roof

loans.name: Kushtrim

texts.en: Kushtrim is a 23-year-old single, hardworking man who is living with his entire family. He is the main source of income for his family and works as a waiter in a restaurant in order to earn a living. He loves his family very much and wants to be able to improve their living conditions as their home is very old and in dire need of renovations. In order for him to do this, he will need a loan to replace the doors and windows and do some other renovations. He promises to pay on time and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to replace the doors and windows and do other renovations

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla, a widow with one adult son, runs her own business selling underwear, socks and stockings at the central market. As the result of a previous Kiva loan, she increased her inventories and earned additional income. 

Alla is now requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase children's dresses, skirts, tights and underwear. Hardworking and patient, she wants to develop her business further since it is her only source of  income.

loans.use: to purchase children's dresses, skirts, tights and underwear

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.en:
Santa Clara La Laguna is a small community in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is known as “The land of baskets” because of the beautiful handwoven baskets that are locally made and then distributed throughout the country.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “El Paraiso” meaning “Paradise” is located here. The group is composed of eight hardworking women who feel that they have a paradise of opportunities because of the loans that they are able to access, kindly funded by Kiva investors. The ladies are involved in various businesses like vegetable sales, animal husbandry and agriculture.

Petronila, a 32-year-old mother of three children, is the Secretary of the Trust Bank. She has had six years of formal education and realizes how important it is that her children attend school. Petronila has been working hard in her animal husbandry business to meet the monthly expenses of her family. She has had a lot of experience in this area and in the past has raised chickens, cattle and horses. Now, she is seeking a new loan that she will use to purchase a calf to fatten up and sell for a good price.

The Microcredit Plus Program of Friendship Bridge combines small loans and non-formal participatory education. In each of the monthly meetings, a Loan Officer presents relevant and useful information on effective business practices including budgeting, accounting and customer service. Other subjects covered include women’s rights, children’s education, nutrition and health and self-esteem. Petronila finds this last topic to be really beneficial for her as she is transforming herself into a successful and empowered woman!

Kiva investors are greatly valued by Petronila and her fellow Trust Bank members.
