The ladies of “El Paraiso” extend their thanks to each one of you who believe in them and generously fund their loans. They face a brighter tomorrow, empowered by their loans and education, which are so transformative for themselves, their families and their community of Santa Clara La Laguna!

loans.use: to purchase a calf to fatten up and sell for a good price

loans.name: La Rosa De Guadalupe Group

texts.en:
Nahualá is one of the biggest towns in the Highlands of Guatemala located just off the Pan-American Highway. Nearly the entire population of the municipality is made up of ethnic K'iche' Maya who speak the K'iche' language. It is a poor community, marked by great poverty, including malnutrition. The simply constructed homes often suffer great damage during the rainy season and a few years ago, there was a catastrophic landslide in which twenty people lost their lives.

Seven courageous women who are hungry for a brighter future have joined together to form a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “La Rosa de Guadalupe” or “The Rose of Guadalupe”. These strong-willed ladies are committed to transforming their lives through hard work and education with the goal of empowering themselves and leaving poverty behind.

Cecilia is a 22-year-old member of the Trust Bank who is married with a son who is just a year old. She has a small farm where she grows broccoli, cauliflower and potatoes. She is requesting a loan which will not only allow her to buy seeds, fertilizer and supplies but also to offer short term employment to other people as she needs help with the seeding and harvesting of her crops. Cecelia wants to create enough income to support her family as well as to continue with her university studies. She has a vision of herself as an empowered and educated woman stepping into a brighter future.

The women of “La Rosa de Guadalupe” Trust Bank are most aware of the value of education, both for themselves and their children. Friendship Bridge believes that the combination of small loans and education, which the organization calls “Microcredit Plus”, is a real key for impoverished women to move ahead in their lives. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Loan Officer shares information with the ladies on topics like health, hygiene and nutrition, women’s rights and self-esteem as well as effective business practices including customer service, budgeting and accounting. Cecelia and her fellow Trust Bank members feel empowered and motivated and leave their meetings feeling very enthusiastic!

Speaking on behalf of the entire Trust Bank, Cecelia expresses gratitude to Kiva investors for believing in them and their ability to move ahead in their lives. Their dreams are slowly becoming true and for this, they are most grateful. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and supplies.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар является 38-летним фермером из города Турсунзаде. Она занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур на протяжении 10 лет. За счет продажи урожая она обеспечивает семью. У Дилбар двое детей, которых она воспитывает одна. Дилбар сеит на своей участке земли пшеницу и овощи. Сейчас ее посевы готовы к тому, чтобы их обработать. Дилбар просит кредит для купли минеральных удобрений. Она надеется получить хороший качественный урожай.
texts.en: Dilbar is a 38-year-old farmer from the city of Tursun-zoda. She has been involved in planting agricultural crops for 10 years. She supports her family with the proceeds from the harvest sale. Dilbar has two children, whom she is raising by herself. Dilbar plants wheat and vegetables on her land. Now the crop is ready to be treated. Dilbar is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers. She hopes to get a good, quality harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers to treat crops in order to get a good harvest

loans.name: Yarson Norberto

texts.es: Yarson tiene 35 años de edad y es un hombre muy trabajador, honesto y responsable, que siempre esta buscando la manera de poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo,  desde hace 10 años decidió en cultivar maíz y frijol  en la parcela que tiene en su casa, durante este tiempo ha tenido buenos resultados, los productos que cosecha los comercializa en los alrededores de la zona, tiene mucha clientela por la calidad y los buenos precios, Yarson esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, fertilizantes, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder tener la vida que siempre  ha deseado junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Yarson is 35 years old and is a hardworking, honest, and responsible man who is always looking for a way to give his family a better quality of life. He lives in his own house with his wife and child.

Ten years ago he decided to begin to grow corn and beans on the plot of land he has at his house. During that time he has had good results. He sells the products he harvests in the surrounding neighborhoods, and he has many customers thanks to the good quality and prices. 

Yarson is asking for a loan so he can buy necessary agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc. so he can improve the land shown in the photograph. This will help him have the kind of life he has always wished to have with his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angelica de 63 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su esposo, desde hace 20 años que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, es una mujer muy trabajadora  responsable con su hogar, siempre está  pendiente de que a su familia no le falte nada, con lo que realiza de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Angelica está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el muestra la fotografía.
texts.en:
Angelica, age 63, lives in his own house with her two daughters and her husband.  She has been growing corn and beans for 20 years.  

She is a very hard-working woman, and she is responsible with her household.  She always takes care of her family so that they do not need anything.  With what she gets from her sales, and with her husband’s help, they manage to cover some of the household expenses.

Angelica is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pest controls, etc.  She will also use the loan to improve the land where she plants, as seen in the photograph.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, and pest controls, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Mahvash

texts.ru: Махваш живет в сельской местности Таджикистана, в районе Вахш. Она честная верующая женщина в возрасте 40 лет. У нее двое сыновей и двое дочерей. Махваш и ее муж занимаются животноводством, как многие жители их селения. Они при дворе своего дома разводят и крупнорогатых и мелкорогатых скотин. Сейчас в их хозяйстве насчитывается одна корова и пара овец. Махваш занимается данной деятельностью вместе с мужем уже 8 лет. Они ценят свой семейный бизнес, ведь благодаря ему они обеспечивают семью. Для развития своего семейного бизнеса Махваш запрашивает кредит. Она планирует закупить нескольких скотин, чтобы увеличить их поголовье. Она надеется, что ей окажут поддержку.
texts.en: Mahvash lives in the countryside of Tajikistan, in the Vakhsh District. She is an honest and religious 40-year-old woman. She has two sons and two daughters. Mahvash and her husband practice livestock breeding like many other residents of their village. They raise cows, sheep and goats in the yard around their house. Now they have one cow and a pair of sheep on their farm. Mahvash has been practicing this business with her husband for the past 8 years. They value their family business, as they have been able to really provide for their family because of it. Mahvash is requesting a loan to develop her family business. She plans to buy several heads of cattle in order to increase the size of her herd. She hopes that you show her support.

loans.use: to buy several heads of cattle to develop her business.

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es: Ángela tiene 40 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos de 4 años y 16 años de edad. Ángela se gana la vida por medio de la venta de huevos lo cual le permite colaborar con la economía de su hogar y junto a su esposo buscan la forma de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Ángela desea construir una fosa séptica para el cual solo tiene el hoyo donde la hará. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para proceder a la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y grava.
texts.en:
Ángela is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their children who are 4 and 16 years old. Angela makes a living by selling eggs which allows her to contribute to the household finances. She and her husband are looking for a way to provide better living conditions for their family.

Ángela wants to build a septic tank, but as of now she only has the pit where it will be built. For this reason she is asking FUSAI for a loan so she can buy the necessary materials such as bricks, cement, sand, iron, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and gravel to build a septic tank.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 40 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Amy has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from a restaurant business and selling rice, charcoal, fermented duck eggs, and gasoline.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, eggs, chips, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Lucelyn

texts.en:
Lucelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lucelyn is 52 years old and all of her children are in school.

Lucelyn has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lucelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Lucelyn has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Lucelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Roselyn works hard to support her family.

She has a selling of dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Roselyn is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of dried fish to sell to customers.

Roselyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 47 years old and married with four children who are in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.

Elvira runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future Elvira would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Dadang

texts.en:
Dadang runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He has been running this stall for one year.  Dadang lives in South Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Dadang is married.

To increase the family's income, Dadang also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma nine months ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. 

Dadang is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Dadang is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer

loans.name: Jehona

texts.en: Jehona is a 29 year-old married mother with a 6-year-old daughter. For more than five years now, she has earned a living through her handicraft business. She is very talented and enjoys her work. She is fortunate to be able to work from her house while caring for her daughter. She plans and hopes to expand her business in the future. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase materials for her crafts to keep up with the customer demand and needs. She is very optimistic for her business’s future and the success she will have. She hopes to open a shop eventually. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her crafts

loans.name: Peace Group

texts.en: These members are part of the group called Peace and are into jeans, bags, cosmetics, and ready-made tops and skirts. They live in traditional families in Teshie-Accra, Ghana. These members have joined the micro-finance institution ID-Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities. Margaret, a member of the group, sells jeans, cosmetics, and bags. In the photo, she is standing from the right. She plans to use her loan to buy jeans, cosmetics, and bags to sell to customers. She is expecting to make good profit. Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and to contribute to her large family's daily expenses.

loans.use: To buy jeans, cosmetics, and bags to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hadije

texts.en:
Hedije is a very lovely woman who cares for her husband and four children very much. Like all people that are living in the Ashakli community, life is difficult and unemployment is very high, leading to poor living conditions and low standards of living.

At this time, Hedije is trying to help her husband to earn a living through his business of cutting wood to sell for heating. She helps by looking for new clients and staying at the market to sell some of the wood while he is transporting it.

In this way, they strive to provide better living conditions for their family and provide their children all of the food and necessities possible. In order to make this even easier and better, Hedije is requesting a loan to purchase a rimorkio (trailer) to transport the wood after collection and to the clients. She is very grateful for a chance to give her children a better future and thanks all of the lenders for their support

loans.use: to purchase a trailer to transport the wood after collection

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 53 years old, married and has one kid who is in school.

Estela is in an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Estela has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estela would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Faik

texts.en: Faik lives in a small village with his wife and three boys. Based on tradition, he is involved in agricultural business, specifically raising cows for the milk and milk products to use and sell in his neighborhood. His sons are grown and are all involved in construction and live together in the same house with him and his wife. At this time, Faik is requesting a loan in order to purchase another milk cow. He has a lot of customer demand and hopes to see more profit by adding another cow to meet the customer needs. This loan will help him to generate more income for his family and he hopes to use some of the money to help his sons get married and start their own families. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase another milk cow

loans.name: Alcita

texts.en:
Alcita is 56 years old and a widow with eight children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Alcita has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Milaim

texts.en:
Milaim is borrowing a loan through Kosinvest for the first time. He is married and a father of two children, living in a small town. He and his wife are both trying to work hard to ensure better living conditions for their children so his wife works as a hairdresser and he has own business as tinsmith, a trade that he has been involved in for more than 20 years now. 

Milaim’s business is growing and he needs a new machine for him to be able to complete orders in his business since his is now almost 20 years old. This loan will help him to be able to continue to work in his business and ensure that his work is high quality and gets done quickly. Having this opportunity will then allow for him to serve more customers and generate a higher income, providing better living conditions for his family. He is very grateful for the chance to improve his life and wants to thank all of the lenders. 

He promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To buy a new working machine

loans.name: Halit

texts.en:
Halit, 45, is the father of four children living in an Ashkali community in very poor conditions. Halit, together with his wife, earns a living by collecting plastic bags, iron and other materials that they then sell for a profit. They have been doing this for more than 15 years now but are in need of a loan to purchase a trailer in order to collect and transport all of the items to sell. This loan will help them to be able to be more effective and efficient in their collection and sales.

Halit hopes to have his own private business in the future and be able to save money for his family. He wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase a trailer in order to collect and transport all of the items to sell

loans.name: Valton

texts.en: Valton is single and lives only with his elderly mother in the southern part of Kosovo. His father has passed away and his brothers live abroad, so Valton is the main source of income and provides for his mother and cares for her. In order to earn a living he is working as a waiter in a restaurant. He loves his mother very much and wants to offer her an easy life. Since he had been raised without a father his mother had sacrificed and struggled a lot in order to give to her children everything possible. Now, Valton is trying to renovate the house and change the doors, windows, and toilet. This loan will help to improve the living conditions and give an easier life for his mother. He wants to thank all of the lenders and hopes in the near future to have a family of his own.

loans.use: To renovate the house and change the doors, windows, and toilet

loans.name: Selatin

texts.en:
Selatin is 26 and recently married; he lives with his entire family. He is the main source of income for his family. He works at a car wash with a low salary, but he continues to work very hard to improve the conditions for his family. 

At this time, he is in need of a loan in order to replace the doors of his house, making his home more secure and better insulated. This loan will help him to avoid having to borrow the money from someone that he knows, which he believes can lead to stress and tense relationships. 

His goal is to be able to have his own house and children. He is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to replace the doors of his house, making his home more secure and better insulated.

loans.name: Florence Bih

texts.en:
She is married and the mother of three children. They all live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in living, among which are inadequate finance to start up a business of her own and cater to her family needs, and the sickness and death of loved ones.

With this new loan requested she will expand her business by buying Egusi, fresh groundnuts, cocoa yams and calaba yams. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business location with her regular customers and because she has been doing it for a long period of time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling and the distance to buy from the market will be reduced.

Concerning the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children's school fees and save some to undertake bigger investments and also provide medication for her family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: to buy Egusi, fresh groundnuts, cocoa yams, cassava and calaba yams.

loans.name: Haggai

texts.en:
She is a widow and a mother of four children. They live in a three-bedroom house in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to start a business of her own and provide her family's needs, sickness and the death of loved ones, and worse of all, the fire that burnt her house to ashes.

With this new loan that she requested, she will expand her business by buying flour, sugar, and firewood for frying chips. She will also add firewood selling to her line of business. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business location for her regular customers and a secure environment for her fowl. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling, the waste from her fowl will be able to boast high yields, and the distance to and from the market will be reduced.

Concerning the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake bigger investments and provide medication for her family. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and  the training on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: To buy flour, oil, sugar, firewood, fowl and feed

loans.name: Norma Estanislada

texts.es:
Doña Norma es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado pequeño pero bien desarrollado en producción de lácteos y comercio ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua.
Doña Norma proviene de una familia muy humilde, campesina pero muy trabajadora que aprendió el amor al trabajo, ya que se dedicaban a la producción de granos y leche.
Desde hace años optó por vivir en el poblado del Sauce en la parte urbana con el fin de que sus hijos se prepararan y fueran a la escuela y con la ayuda de sus hijos mayores y el financiamiento de préstamos inició un pequeño negocio la venta de medicina natural, la cual le ha dado para vivir dignamente.
Se siente muy agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel porque gracias a los financiamientos que le ha otorgado ha mantenido surtido su negocio logrando así la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Actualmente está solicitando para la compra de pomadas, shampoo, ungüentos, vitaminas con el fin de abastecer de estos productos que son los que más demandan sus clientes.
Tiene la fe en Dios que su crédito sea aprobado para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Norma is from the El Sauce municipality.  She is from a small town, but it is well-developed in dairy production and commerce.  It is located in western Nicaragua.

Norma comes from a very humble family.  They are farmers, but very hard-workers who learned to love their work.  They devoted themselves to the production of grains and milk.

Years ago she chose to live in the urban part of the town of El Sauce.  She did this so that her children would be prepared and go to school.  With the help of her older children and the loans, she started a small business of selling natural medicine.  This has given her what she needs to lead a decent life.

She is grateful to Kiva and CEPRODEL because, thanks to the loans they have granted her, she has kept her business stocked.  This way she managed to satisfy her customers.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy ointments, shampoo, salves, and vitamins in order to stock up on these products, which her customers demand the most.

She has faith in God that her loan will be approved in order to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy ointments, shampoo, salves, and vitamins.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married and a mother of five children. They all live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, Northwest Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many problems in life, among which are sickness, loss of family members, and inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and cater for her family needs.

With this new loan she requested she will buy foodstuff like beans, corn, and yams for her foodstuff store, drinks for her bar, and firewood for her regular selling. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business location and regular customers and because she has been doing it for a long period of time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling and the distance to buy from the market will be reduced. 

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business to pay her children's school fees and save some in other to undertake bigger investments and also provide medication for her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: to buy foodstuff, drinks, and firewood.

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
She is divorced and the mother of six children. They all live in a three-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, which have been the sickness and death of loved ones and inadequate finance to start up a business of her own and cater to her family's needs,

With this new loan requested she will buy three piglets, ten bags of feed, seedlings and part of the money will be used to pay for the labour in the working, clearing, planting and weeding of the farm. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has being in the agricultural field for a long time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her moderate selling and the distance to buy food from the market will be reduced and her business will also provide food for the population.

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her farm, pay her children's school fees and save some in order to undertake a bigger investment, provide medication for her family and will also build her house. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed.

loans.use: to buy three piglets, ten bags of feed, seedlings and to pay for labour in working, clearing, planting and weeding the farm.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Мавжуде скоро исполнится 45 лет. Она из города Конибодом, живет там с дочерью. Муж и сын, к сожалению работают вдали от них, в другой стране. Дочь Мавжуды школьница. Однако после занятий она помогает матери в ее швейном деле. В течение 10 лет Мавжуда занимается шитьем курпа и курпача. Курпача - это узкое стеганое одеяло, которое стилается на землю и используется в быту у таджиков вместо кресел, а курпа - это широкое стеганое одеяло используется в зимнее время. Мавжуда любит проводить время за работой, ведь она продолжает ремесло своей матери. 
Мавжуда берет кредит для купли необходимых ей тканей, чтобы она могла продолжить деятельность. Она очень надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Mavjuda will turn 45 soon. She is from Konibodom and lives there with her daughter. Unfortunately her husband and son work far away in another country. Mavjuda's daughter is in school and helps her mother with her dressmaking business after classes. Mavjuda has been a seamstress for ten years and sews kurpa and kurpacha. A kurpacha is a thin, quilted blanket used everyday in Tajikistan in place of a chair, and a kurpa is a quilt used in the winter. Mavjuda enjoys working because she is continuing her mother's craft. She is taking out a loan to purchase the fabric that she needs to keep sewing. She hopes very much for support.

loans.use: to buy the fabric needed for sewing

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a widow and a mother of five children. They live in a three bedroom house in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to start up a business of her own, catering to her family's needs, sickness, and death of family members, especially that of her husband.

With this new loan requested she will buy ten piglets, fifty bags of feed, seedlings, and part of the money will be used in renting a plot of land to increase her farm land. In addition, a part of the loan will be used to pay for farming labor. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has a good business location and regular customers who buy from her farm, and because she has been doing agriculture for a long period of time. With this business activity, the community will benefit from her quality food and pigs. 

The profit made from this loan, will be used to expand her farm, pay her children's school fees,  reinvest in the business, provide medication for her family, and buy a plot of farmland. 

She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed

loans.use: to buy ten piglets, fifty bags of feed, seedlings, and rent a plot of farm land

loans.name: Ronofloma

texts.en:
Ronofloma is 39 years old, married, and comes from Sindangan. She runs a store that earns a meager income of Php 8,000 per month. The store has supported the needs of the family. 

Ronofloma signed up with the cooperative for the chance to access loans. Recently, she accessed the amount of Php 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and milk to sell. In the future, Ronofloma hopes to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soft drinks, sugar and milk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm nuts and firewood.

loans.name: Pablo Gamaliel

texts.es: Pablo tiene 22 años de edad y habita junto a su abuela, tía y un sobrino en casa familiar. Pablo trabaja como empacador en una empresa cercana a su localidad lo cual le permite colaborar con la economía de su hogar. Él se caracteriza por ser un joven muy dedicado y responsable. Pablo y sus familia dieron inicio a la construcción de su vivienda con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida la cual no han logrado terminar por falta de recursos económicos. Pablo solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar los materiales necesarios que le hacen falta como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro, cemento, etc.
texts.en:
Pablo is 22 years old and lives with his grandmother, aunt and a nephew in the family's home. Pablo works as a packer at a company near where he lives, and this allows him to contribute to the family's finances. He is a very dedicated and responsible young man.

Pablo and his family began construction on their house for the purpose of improving their living conditions, but they have not been able to finish it due to a lack of funds. Pablo is asking FUSAI for this loan so he can buy the materials he needs such as bricks, sand, iron, cement, etc.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, etc. so he can finish building the house.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 Tân Cầu 2+3 Xã Tân Khang Group

texts.en:
Thuận works in agriculture farming food. She is applying for a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. 

Thuận is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Thuận is the group leader of the Nhóm 14 Tân Cầu 2+3 Xã Tân Khang  solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

In 2011, Thuận joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thuận has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thuận has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thuận faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thuận hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
After working as an office manager for over 10 years, Sonya realized that there were no staffing agencies located in her area. She decided to fill this need by starting her own temp agency. 

“I enjoy helping others succeed, and wanted to offer my support to other businesses." 

Sonya has enjoyed helping her clients find the workers they need. However, she has had trouble finding capital to help get her business off the ground. With this loan, she will be able to invest in marketing her business and acquiring additional clients. 

Help Sonya grow her business and help others!

loans.use: To market her temp agency

loans.name: Librada

texts.en:
Librada is 63 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children now at their adult age.

Librada has been engaged in the hog-fattening business for 40 years already. She earns approximately PHP 2,500 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing three sacks of booster and grower feeds for her hog-fattening business. 

Librada has been a member of PMPC for almost nine years. In the future, she hopes to expand her hog-fattening business.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of booster and grower feeds

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is working in her own retail store to be able to forge ahead and provide a more financially secure life for her family. She needs to pay the school expenses of her children and also cover her household expenses. Her goal is to improve her store and to see her children successful. 

Salome is striving for a better life through her business while her husband does a service-based activity as a welder and earns better income, too.  Salome says that she is requesting this loan to purchase more ready to wear clothes and bags. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful to her in improving the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear clothes and bags

loans.name: Emmie

texts.en: Emmie is a microfinance member of PMPC. She sells fish and seafood at the market. She is a full fledged member and has reached her sixth year of membership with the cooperative. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase stock of fish and seafood to sell. She hopes to increase her income for the education of her children

loans.use: to purchase stock of fish and seafood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new inventory for her antique business

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en:
Lanh is a 52-year-old married woman. She has 3 children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns living working as a construction worker. Lanh has been running a business selling clothing for ten years. 

Lanh would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing to sell

loans.name: Xhejlane

texts.en:
Xhejane wants to thank all of the lenders for their support in giving her the loan she used to purchase material and tools for her handicraft business. She is very satisfied with the process of and the success from her previous loan. 

Now she is planning to raise cows. She already has a cow and needs to renovate her stable, for which she is requesting the loan. Once that is completed, she hopes to start selling milk and dairy products, multiplying her income and contributing to her financial stability. 

As she is a hardworking woman who loves her family, Xhejane is sure she will have success. She is very grateful for the support again and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to renovate her stable.

loans.name: Vanna Khem's Group

texts.en:
Vanna, 43, lives with her husband and two children in a rural village of the Dambae district in Cambodia. One of her two children is still in school. To feed the family, Vanna and her husband earn a living as farmers who have been growing cassava for 25 years, earning about 26,000KHR per day to spend on the family’s needs. To supplement the income, Vanna also sells grocery items. 

This is Vanna’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava. She hopes to make more income from her agribusiness.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cassava.

loans.name: Bohirbek

texts.ru:
Бохирбек жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина. Он женат, но детей не имеет. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. Сам Бохирбек живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Бохирбека также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей. 

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Бохирбек занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Бохирбек является представителем дехканского хозяйства.  От своего бизнеса животноводства он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Бохирбеку в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота. Сейчас Бохирбек на сегодня имеет несколько голов скота, и хочет ещё увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Бохирбек очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Bohirbek is a joyful and hardworking man. He is married, but does not have any children. He turned to Arvand for the first time when he realized that there was the opportunity to receive financial support. Bohirbek lives with his family in the countryside. He does not have a higher education, as he did not have the opportunity to study at university due to financial difficulties in his family. Bohirbek's wife also does not have an education. She is a homemaker who does the household chores and raises their children.

In order to have an income to live on, Bohirbek has his own business. He fattens up and sells cattle. Bohirbek also offers his services as a communal farmer. He receives a good income from his livestock raising business. His wife also helps Bohirbek with this business. She sells the milk that she receives from the cows. Currently Bohirbek has several heads of cattle and wants to increase the size of his herd to expand his business. This is why is requesting a loan from Arvand to buy cattle. Bohirbek really relies on a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Nyonko Do Group

texts.en:
Nyonko Do group is beginning their first loan with ID-Ghana, Kiva partner. It is made up of 4 members who have business in selling slippers, silver pots, kenkey, fish, maize, rice and beans. The loan that they are taking out will benefit each one of the merchants of the small businesses of the group.

Bridget tells us that she joined ID-Ghana barely six months ago. She currently has a business selling cassava, plantain, cocoyam and yam. She started this business five years ago. After some time, she decided to open her business independently with a small amount of capital. The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital. She will purchase cassava, plantain, cocoyam, and yam from the market, to sell to customers. This type of work allows her to generate the resources that she needs to support her family.   She is married and has five children, who are all of school going age.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that in addition to receiving the loan, she likes the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, plantain, cocoyam, and yam from the market to sell to customers

loans.name: Mom Roun's Group

texts.en:
Mom, aged 31, is a resident from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She deals with her financial burden for her family via cassava farming and her paid-working job. The business generates for her about KHR 34,000 per day.  

Mom is a first-time borrower with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva ‘s partner) and her joint borrower is also a first-time borrower. Mom is seeking KHR 1,600,000 whereas her co-borrower is applying for KHR 500,000. As a leader, Mom will spend her entire loan portion to buy potash for her cassava. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop yield.

loans.use: to buy potash for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet is 57 years old and a father of two children. They all live in a small village in the northern part of Kosovo. Ismet used to live in Germany, but is now back home in Kosovo, working in agriculture as a means to earn a living. He has land where he plants corn and wheat and also has two goats that he uses to provide milk and milk products for his family. 

Ismet is requesting a loan in order to purchase a greenhouse so that he can start to plant tomatoes and peppers to sell in the market. This will help him to add more to the family income and provide a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greenhouse so that he can start to plant tomatoes and peppers to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, embroidery machine, and table.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru: Эту жительницу района Вахш зовут Файзигул. Ей 44 года. В данный момент она не замужем. У Файзигул двое сыновей и двое дочерей, которых она воспитывает одна. Дети помогают ее бизнесу. Пять лет назад Файзигул своими силами открыла продуктовый магазин. Благодаря данному бизнесу она обеспечивает семью и другого источника дохода в их семье нет. Поэтому Файзигул заботится о том, чтобы ее магазин процветал. Сейчас она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить ассортимент продуктов в своем магазине для увеличения объема продаж. Этот кредит ей очень необходим.
texts.en: This resident of the Vakhsh District's name is Fayzigul. She is 44 years old. She is currently unmarried. Fayzigul has two sons and two daughters, who she is raising alone. Her children help her with her business. Five years ago, Fayzigul used all of her strength to open up a grocery store. Thanks to this business, she is able to provide for her family. There is no other source of income for their family. This is why Fayzigul is concerned with how to make her shop flourish. Now she is requesting a loan to increase the variety of groceries in her store so she can increase her sales volume. This loan is very necessary for her.

loans.use: to buy groceries to increase her sales.

loans.name: Elvis Reyes

texts.es: Elvis tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida, su madre y sus dos hijos de 18 años y 10 años de edad. Elvis se gana ala vida mediante la prestación de servicios de seguridad en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como mantiene la economía de su familia. Elvis solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda ya que por causa del tiempo y las lluvias se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: Elvis is 42 years old and lives in his own home with his wife, mother, and two children, who are 18 and 10 years old. Elvis makes a living by providing security services to a company near his home; this is how he supports his family. Elvis is requesting this loan through FUSAI because he wants to repair the roof of his house, as time and rainfall have caused it to deteriorate. With the requested funds, he would buy galvanized steel, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to buy galvanized steel, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Kady Jahoska

texts.es: Kadys es una persona trabajadora, se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa ademas le administra el Negocio al Marido ya que trabajan en conjunto, poseen un pequeño acopio de leche, donde el marido se encarga de  recolectar la leche para procesarla y comercializarla, esta actividad les ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia que esta compuesta de ellos dos y sus 3 hijos.  También han mejorado las condiciones de vida apoyándose de prestamos obtenidos los que han cancelado con responsabilidad.  Kadys desea este crédito para Comprar dos portones de Hierro y unas cuantas piedras canteras, Cemento y pagar mano de obra para la Instalación de los Portones que solo tiene puertas de madera y necesita seguridad en su Vivienda. Ella con orgullo expresa que ha sabido invertir sus créditos anteriores y espera ser Beneficiada nuevamente.  En un futuro piensa construir una habitación para sus hijos que a medida que crecen necesitan mayor privacidad.
texts.en:
Kady is a hard-working person. She makes a living buying and selling clothing as well as managing her husband's business. Now that they work together, they have a small stockpile of milk, where her husband is in charge of gathering the milk to process and sell it. This job has allowed them to take care of their family which is made up of themselves and their three children.

They have also improved their living conditions by supporting themselves by means of loans that were obtained, which they have paid off responsibly. 

Kady would like this loan to buy two iron gates and some quarry stones, cement and to pay for the labor costs of installing the gates, because she only has wooden doors and she needs a safer home. She is proud to say that she has learned to invest her previous loans and she hopes to receive this benefit once again. In the future, she plans to build a room for her children, because as they grow, they will need more privacy.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
Carlita is 59 years old and lives in Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children who are now adults. 
 
Carlita is engaged in operating a motorcycle for hire business with her husband as the one driving and maintaining the unit. The couple earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance. 

Carlita has been a member of PMPC for almost 11 years. In the future, Carlita hopes to acquire an additional motorcycle unit for hire.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for repairs and maintenance

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is 33 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their school age. 

Rio is engaged in a food processing business, particularly cooking banana cue (deep fried banana) and chicken barbecue respectively. Rio earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of business activity. Her husband is a chainsaw operator and coco lumber buyer. 

She has requested a loan to purchase more coconut trees to be processed into lumber to help her husband’s business. 

Rio has been a member of PMPC for almost ten years. In the future, Rio hopes to expand their coco lumber buying and selling business.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut trees to be processed into lumber.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 62 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult age.
 
Evelyn is engaged in operating a multi-cab for hire business with her husband as the one driving the said unit. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing multi-cab spare parts for maintenance. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, she hopes to purchase an additional multi-cab unit for hire.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing multi-cab spare parts

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a farmer from Sibutad. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to buy fertilizer and more seeds to plant. She has been in this business for five years now. 

Angelita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and more seeds to plant

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a 67-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, from Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, industriously caring for her vegetables activities. She is married and has three children. She personally takes charge of their business and their children work for them as support. The business is doing well. Perla has humbly taught her children the techniques of how to enjoy business and, at the same time, make earnings from it. The ups and downs of the business are nothing, but a normal situation for her. 

Now Perla sees a good opportunity to expand their business. She is requesting a PHP 5,000 loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for capital to buy an additional variety of vegetables to sell. Perla hopes to sustain her business and become a vegetable supplier in the local community.

loans.use: to buy an additional variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is working to be able to forge ahead and assist her husband to provide a more financially secure life for the family.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  She needs to pay for her debts and also cover her household expenses. Her goal is to improve her business and build a retail store of her own.

Analiza is striving to meet the day to day challenges, and she says that she is requesting this loan to buy more fruits and snacks to resell and achieve her goal. She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and snacks to resell

loans.name: Leanne Grace

texts.en:
Leanne Grace is 39 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children who are of school age.

Leanne Grace operates a “Piso-Net”, which is an internet business with a rate of 1 Peso per minute. Leanne Grace earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to buy an additional Piso-Net machine for her existing business.

Leanne Grace has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to expand her “Piso-Net” business to other nearby barangays in this municipality.

loans.use: to buy a Piso-Net machine for an internet business.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is very thankful for the loan assistance extended to her. She has used the loan to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children, and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

To help her grow profit from business, she is requesting another PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy additional supplies of raw materials. Her income from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Merlyn hopes to become successful in all that she is pursuing, especially in business and family. Every week, she goes to meetings with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fabric, needles, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia is 54 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. To earn a living, Constancia has a business selling a variety of vegetables. She earns about 8,000 each month doing this type of work. Constancia has requested a loan for additional capital.

Constancia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Constancia would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, an over sewing machine, an iron and fabric.

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business  that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy such as net purchase and repair boats.

She opened her business  a year ago with her own working capital of $600.  

Madalena is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy net purchase and to repair boats

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine and a sewing machine

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard to support her family. Thelma is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for 17 years now.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college tuition

loans.name: Naipha

texts.en:
Naipha works hard to support her family. Naipha is married, and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Naipha requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory of slippers, t-shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, etc., to sell.

Naipha has been in this business for 7 years now.

Naipha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of slippers, t-shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, etc., to sell

loans.name: Belen

texts.en: Belen is a woman who stands out for searching for any possible way to obtain a resource that will allow her to feed her family. Two years ago, she began making and preparing snacks for sale. She thanks God and her customers for this occupation, since the results of these sales have been very beneficial. Based on this success, Belen is asking for a loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale, which will allow her, by the grace of God, to continue to forge her dream of growing as an entrepreneur,  and to provide for the well being of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel is a student taking a computer technician course of study in Liloy. He has requested a Student Educational Assistance Loan to pay his school fees for this semester. 

Ronel is determined to finish his studies so that he can help his family. He wants to support his siblings in finishing their education.

loans.use: to pay his school fees

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is from the village of Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 19 years old and she has continued studying even though her family is in financial crisis. All of this has made Angelie double her efforts in pursuing her dreams. She helps her mother in their snack vending business and earns income to help her in her studies.

Angelie has taken a new loan to pay school tuition fees for the first semester. She is hopeful to finish her coursework and be able to work in any company in the future.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees for the first semester

loans.name: Blessy

texts.en:
Blessy has been saving money for many days to redeem her parents' rice fields but most of the savings have been spent on household expenses and additional capital for her business. Blessy now wants to buy more grocery goods and feeding supplies to sell.

Blessy has requested a loan from GDMPC microfinance with the contribution of her savings. She hopes that her full devotion to her business will yield a return of  sufficient income. Blessy is a 33-year-old woman, living with her child and spouse in the area of Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

loans.use: to redeem her parents' rice fields and to buy more grocery goods and feeding supplies to sell

loans.name: Sandrina

texts.en:
Sandrina is 38 years old, married, and the mother of nine children. With six children currently in school, Sandrina works very hard to provide for them.

Sandrina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, sanitary pads, toothpaste, detergent, soap, etc., to sell.  Sandrina has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Sandrina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send all her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, sanitary pads, toothpaste, detergent, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Emmalyn

texts.en:
Emmalyn is 36 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Emmalyn runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and chips.

Emmalyn has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Emmalyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs and chips.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her children's education.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 53 years old, married, and has six children.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Estrelita  has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. With your help, she can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 51 years old and married with four children; one child is in school. Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for 20 years. 

Bernadeth has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en: Celsa, 62 years old, is married and has four children. For the past 5 years, she has been raising pigs in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Celsa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Makhfirat

texts.ru: Махфират замужняя женщина в возрасте 31 года. Она живет в своем городе Турсунзаде с двумя детьми, а муж уехал на заработки в Россию. Махфират работает медсестрой в больнице. Параллельно с работой она еще и занимается шитьем. В выходные дни Махфират по заказу шьет таджикские женские платья. Она работает на двух работах, чтобы улучшить условия жизни. Махфират обратилась за кредитом, так как собирается приобрести новую швейную машинку. Она нужна ей для развития дела. Махфират надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Makhfirat is a married, 31-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Tursun-zoda with her two children, and her husband left to work in Russia. Makhfirat works as a nurse at a hospital. Parallel to this work, she is also involved in sewing. Makhfirat sews Tajik women's dresses to-order on the weekends. She works two jobs in order to improve her life conditions. Makhfirat requested this loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She needs it to develop her business. Makhfirat hopes for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania has been helping her husband working in their own farm for a living. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for farming. 

With her income, she was able to put up a food vending business. Recently, she took a new loan to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale. In the future, she wants to improve the general living of her family and wants to see her children's success.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare snacks for sale

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, vive en el Departamento de San Martin junto a sus padres.
Desde hace más de 1 años trabaja como vendedor en un grifo de la zona donde reside y con el dinero ganado apoya a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
Su mayor motivación son sus padres y por eso trabaja incansablemente para poder mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que quiere retribuir toda la ayuda que ellos le han brindado durante toda su etapa de crecimiento.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y más adelante estudiar una carrera profesional.
Juan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá remodelar su vivienda como mejoramiento del piso y las paredes, de esta manera sus padres sentirán mayor seguridad y comodidad y él seguirá esforzándose en el trabajo para seguir apoyando a sus padres
texts.en:
Juan is a 22-year-old enterprising young man. He lives in the department of San Martin together with his parents. For the past year he has worked pumping gas near where he lives, and he is able to help his parents with household expenses with the money he earns.

His parents are his biggest motivation and because of that he works tirelessly so he can improve their quality of life. He wants to repay them for all the help they gave him when he was growing up. He has a strong desire to get ahead and in the future he hopes to study for a professional career. 

Juan is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support he will be able to remodel his house by fixing up the floors and walls, allowing his parents to feel more secure and comfortable. He will continue with his efforts at work so he can continue helping out his parents.

loans.use: to renovate the floors and walls of his house.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda has been growing and harvesting bananas to sell in town and has been farming  for more than five years, and this is the primary source of income for the family. 

With her generated income, she was able to  successfully repay her previous loan, used for farming inputs. 

Esmeralda  took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides to improve the farm. She is planning to expand her farm, hoping it will flourish and enable her to improve her children's lives.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Loreli

texts.en:
Loreli previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Loreli is requesting a new loan for 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed in the store, the better. More items to sell will result in larger profits, profits that will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Loreli hopes to have another store, and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week. It is also where she can draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. These groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Loribeth

texts.en:
Loribeth is very thankful for the loan assistance extended to her as she was able to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big for her children’s education and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

To help her grow profit from the business, she is requesting another loan, this time PHP 42,000. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, and other products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her income from the business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Loribeth hopes to see the fruits of her labor as she wants her children to have a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell in her business.

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en: Dionesia, 32 years old, has five children, three of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Dionesia has operated a business buying and selling clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell. In the future, Dionesia would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing to sell

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe has been in this business for ten years now. 

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients for her food vending.  She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and other ingredients for her food vending

loans.name: Adotia

texts.en:
Adotia is 59 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Adotia  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Adotia is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to build a house and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Clara

texts.en: Clara, 46 years old, is married and has five children. With all the children in school, Clara works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Clara has run a direct sales business of personal collection products in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell. In the future, Clara would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 52 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. 

She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 7,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Juditha is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Abduqakhor

texts.ru: Абдукахор деятельный молодой человек в возрасте 30 лет. Он родом из района Вахш. Абдукахор женат и живет с женой, матерью, двумя братьями и сестрой. В 2011 году Абдукахор открыл маленькую столовую, где посетителям он предлагает турецкую шаурму, приготовленную им самим, а также мороженное. Он по натуре целеустремленный человек и теперь думает о расширении своего бизнеса. Для этой цели он запрашивает кредит в размере 1500 долларов США для купли большого аппарата по приготовлению шаурмы. Поскольку количество его клиентов увеличилось, он теперь хочет готовить больше шаурмы, чтобы каждый заказ предоставлять быстро. Таким образом данный кредит поможет его бизнесу стать еще успешнее.
texts.en: Abduqakhor is an active, 30-year-old young man. He is a native of the Vakhsh District. Abduqakhor is married and lives with his wife, his mother, his two brothers and his sister. In 2011, Abduqakhor opened a small cafeteria where he offers customers Turkish doner kebabs (which he makes himself) and ice cream. He is a goal-driven person by nature and now is thinking about expanding his business. He is requesting a loan for this purpose. He is requesting 1500 USD to buy a large piece of equipment for making doner kebabs. As his amount of customers has increased, he now wants to prepare more doner kebabs in order to fulfill every order quickly.  In that way, this loan will allow his business to become ever more successful.

loans.use: to buy equipment for making doner kebabs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Hakilimaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Hakilimaya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et un enfant. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de pelengana sud l’un des quartiers de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de poisson, de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam (la 1ere femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de poisson frais dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 kg de à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mariam  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women who make up the Hakilimaya group all live in traditional families.  On average, they are 28 years old and have one child each. They all live in "Pelengana Sud", a neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through neighborhood, family and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are involved in small retail and they sell fish, prepared food and condiments.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first cycle of solidarity loan.

Mariam (first from the right in the front row) is an important seller of fresh fish in and around the neighborhood. She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 kilos of fresh fish in Ségou.  She resells her merchandise for cash and also often on credit, from her home, at the market, and also as an itinerant seller.  She sells to both men and women. Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs which will be used to cover some of her children's daily needs and also to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.ru: Сурайё добропорядочная женщина в возрасте 54 лет. Она живет в столице, в городе Душанбе. Ее муж рабочий государственного учреждения. Сама Сурайё искусная швея, но она начала заниматься швейным бизнесом не так давно. Уже три года как она берет заказы на пошив женских платьев национального покроя. Дочь помогает в деятельности матери. Сурайё за счет кредита планирует расширить деятельность. Она собирается приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку, благодаря которой процесс ее работы улучшится и ее деятельность станет еще прибыльнее. Сурайё надеется на вашу поддержку. Она хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en: Suraiyo is decent, 54-year-old woman. She lives in the capital city of Dushanbe. Her husband is an employee of a government institution. Suraiyo is a talented seamstress, but started her sewing business not long ago. She has been accepting orders for sewing women's national dresses for three years. Her daughter helps her with the business. Suraiyo plans to use this loan to expand her business. She plans to purchase a modern sewing machine, thanks to which her work process would improve and business would become more profitable. Suraiyo hopes for your support. She wants to improve her family's financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine in order to develop her business

loans.name: Saidmoh

texts.ru:
Саидмох разведена и не ждет никакой поддержки от мужа. Она и ее дети сами зарабатывают на жизнь. Саидмох 45 лет, она мать троих детей. У нее двое дочерей в возрасте 23 и 15 лет, и сын в возрасте 11 лет. Она с детьми живет в горном районе Хуросон.  
В 2008 году Саидмох научилась у братьев животноводческому бизнесу и уже 6 лет занимается этим делом. Она разводит коров и телят мясной породы. Ее дети тоже зарабатывают на жизнь. Они занимаются продажей овощей и фруктов. Их семья очень трудолюбивая. Саидмох сейчас просит кредит для развития своего животноводческого хозяйства. Она собирается увеличить поголовье телят и надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Saidmoh is divorced and is not waiting for any kind of support from her ex-husband. She and her children earn a living on their own. Saidmoh is 45 years old and a mother of three children. She has two daughters, ages 23 and 15, and a son, who is 11 years old. Saidmoh and her children live in a mountainous city of Khuroson. Saidmoh learned the animal husbandry business from her brothers in 2008 and has been involved in this business for 6 years. She breeds cattle and beef breed calves. Her children also earn a living. They are involved in selling vegetables and fruits. Their family is very friendly. Saidmoh is now requesting a loan to develop her animal husbandry business. She plans to increase calves headcount and hopes for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy several calves in order to increase their headcount

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Мукаддас 47 лет. Она трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина из села района Носири Хусрав. Мукаддас 7 лет назад начала бизнес откорм-продажа скота. Она занимается выращиванием молодых бычков и телят. Мукаддасу в деятельности помогают дети, так как мужа нет рядом, он находится на заработках в России. 
Мукаддас в надежде обратилась за кредитом для купли нескольких телят и бычков, чтобы она могла продолжить свою деятельность. Она ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Mukaddas is 47 years old. She is a hardworking and conscientious woman from a village in the Nosiri Khusrav district. Mukaddas started her business of fattening up and selling livestock 7 years ago. She is involved in raising young bulls and calves. Her children help her with the business because her husband is not nearby - he works in Russia. Mukaddas, with hope, requested a loan to buy several calves and bulls in order to continue her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy several calves and bulls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Djekoulou Group

texts.fr:
