Les neuf  femmes du groupe Djekoulou vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de pelengana l’un des quartiers de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, restauration et de produits cosmétique. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Rokia  (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le quartier  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 pièces de pagne wax à Bamako et ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Rokia  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The nine women of the group called Djekoulou all live in traditional families. They have an average age of 29 and on average, two children. They all live in the neighborhood of Pelengana, a neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They met through bonds of neighborhood, kinship, marriage, and through their income-generating activities in their area. They do small-scale sales of clothing, sell cooked food, and cosmetic products. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan.

 Madame Rokia  (the second woman standing from right to left in the photo) is a well-known seller of wax-print cloth (African print cloth called 'pagne') in the neighborhood and its surroundings. She intends to use her loan to buy five lengths of 'pagne' in Bamako and Segou. Sales will be for cash and often for credit at her home, in the market, and on foot to a mixed clientele. 

 Madame Rokia  hopes to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 F CFA with this loan. Her profit will be used for small necessities for her children and equally to grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth (pagne)

loans.name: Ugil

texts.ru:
Угил местная жительница района Спитамен. 10 лет назад в возрасте 43 лет она начала бизнес откорм и продажа скота, который она продолжает по сей день. Одновременно Угил еще и занимается преподавательской деятельностью, она в течение 15 лет работает учительницей в местной школе. Угил отзывчивый справедливый человек. Она любит свою работу, свой бизнес и свою семью. 
Данный кредит Угил просит для развития своей животноводческой деятельности. Она на сумму кредита хочет купить овец и барашек, чтобы увеличить их поголовье. Она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Ugil is a resident of the Spitamen District. Ten years ago, at the age of 43, she started a business of fattening up and selling cattle. She has continued this business to this day. Simultaneously, Ugil works as a teacher. For the past 15 years, she has worked as a teacher at a local school. Ugil is a kind-hearted and fair person. She loves her job, her business and her family.

Ugil is requesting a loan to develop her livestock raising business. With the lent amount, she wants to buy sheep and lambs to increase the size of her herd. She relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy sheep and lambs.

loans.name: Gulpocho

texts.ru: Гулпочо приветливая и общительная молодая девушка в возрасте 24 лет. Она живет с матерью в городе Душанбе. Гулпочо занимается любимым делом шитьем на протяжении 5 лет. После окончания школы она училась у профессиональной швеи урокам кройки и шитья. Сейчас Гулпочо уже сама мастерица. Ее сшитые платья радуют ее клиенток и поэтому ее заказы увеличиваются. Однако та швейная машинка, на которой шьет Гулпочо не позволяет ей брать много заказов, так как она уже старая и причиняет ей много неудобств. Гулпочо решила взять кредит и купить новую швейную машинку. Этот кредит ей важен для развития дела.
texts.en: Gulpocho is a friendly and sociable young, 24-year-old woman. She lives with her mother in the city of Dushanbe. Gulpocho has been involved in her favorite business of sewing for 5 years. After finishing school, she learned cutting and sewing from a professional seamstress. Now, Gulpocho is a professional herself. The dresses that she sews make clients happy, and this is why her orders are growing. However, the sewing machine that Gulpocho uses does not allow her to take many orders because it is already old and causes a lot of discomfort. Gulpocho decided to obtain a loan and purchase a new sewing machine. This loan is important to the development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village konodimini de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de restauration et de condiment. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  6eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djaminatou (la 2eme femme assise de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de galette à sauce dans le village  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 sacs de riz à Konodimini. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djaminatou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle espère continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Danaya group all live in traditional families. On average, they are 44 years old and have five children each. They all live in Konodimini, a village in the Ségou region (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, family and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the village. They are involved in small retail and they sell prepared food and condiments. In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their sixth cycle of solidarity loan.

Djaminatou (second from the right in the photo) is an important seller of "galettes" (flat cakes) served with sauce, in and around the village.  She is planning to use her loan to buy two bags of rice in Konodimini.   She resells her galettes for cash and also often on credit, from her home and at the market.  She sells to both men and women. Thanks to this loan, she is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be used to cover some of her children's daily needs and also to boost her business.  She would also like to continue to work with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 28 años de edad es un apersona muy trabajadora, responsable y honesta siempre está buscando la manera de poder salir adelante, desde hace 11 años que se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en las diferentes agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, control de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejora el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is 28 years old and is a very hardworking, responsible, and honest man who is always looking for ways to get ahead. For 11 years he has been farming principally corn and sorghum. He sells his products to different companies that buy and sell bulk grains, and the proceeds allow him to pay for some household expenses.

He lives in his own home with his life partner and their children. The client is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, controlling pests, herbicides, etc. so he can improve the plot of land shown in the photograph and have a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pest control, herbicides, etc., and improve the plot of land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Добросовестная женщина 18 лет назад начала малый бизнес в Таджикистане. Ее зовут Сайёра. Сайёра начала бизнес купле продажей масло. Вначале ей было очень тяжело справляться с бизнесом. Она имела небольшого оборотного капитала и соответственно получала небольшой доход. Благодаря упорному труду она постепенно развевала свой бизнес. Сайёра данное время занимается купле продажей детской одежды. Она должна обновить товар на новый сезон, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки детской одежды. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: A conscientious woman started a small business in Tajikistan 18 years ago. Her name is Sayora. Sayora originally started a business of reselling butter. It was difficult for her to run the business at first. She had a small working capital and was, thus, earning a small income. Thanks to her hard work, she gradually developed her business. At the present time, Sayora is involved in reselling children's clothing. She has to update her merchandise for the new season, but does not have money. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni to purchase children's clothing. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy children's clothing for the new season

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es: Nelson tiene 37 años de edad y se dedica a la prestación de servicios de albañilería lo cual le permite ganarse el sustento diario y mantener la economía del hogar. Nelson solicita este crédito a FUSAI  dado que desea ampliar el área de cocina para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro. Confía que con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo logrará cancelar las cuotas mensuales que el crédito implica.
texts.en: Nelson is 37 years old and works as a mason, which allows him to earn his daily wages and support his household economy. Nelson is requesting this loan from FUSAI because he wants to expand his kitchen space, for which he needs materials like bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron. He is confident that he will be able to make his monthly loan repayments with the income from his job.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, gravel and iron to expand his kitchen space

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is from Misamis Occidental, 58 years old, married and has three children. She has been planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables to sell. She also raises pigs to sell and she earns additional income from it. Recently, Fe joined GDMPC and she gained access to financial services and it helped improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She borrowed a new loan to buy organic fertilizer. She wants to have a better living in the near future with her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Mercidita hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 54 years old and has seven children. She is married and has one child in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Sarah is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Sarah has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her rice farming.

With your help, Sarah can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
A $ 1000 is offered to Agripina to improve her business. She has a second-hand clothing business where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as shirts, shorts, long pants, long-sleeved and short-sleeved clothing.  She has been involved in business activities since 2011. She feels very comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Agripina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy shirts, shorts, long pants, long-sleeved and short-sleeved clothing

loans.name: Gladis Jacquelin

texts.es: Gladis tiene 34 años de edad y reside junto a su madre y su hijo de 16 años de edad. Gladis es una mujer trabajadora responsable y comprometida con su familia. Gladis desea construir un cuarto para cocina para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así lograr mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gladis is 34 years old. She lives with her mother and her 16-year-old son. Gladis is a hardworking and responsible woman who is committed to her family. 

Gladis wishes to build a room for the kitchen. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase the necessary materials like brick, cement, sand, and iron. She hopes to be able to count on these funds and that way manage to improve her housing conditions.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron to build a room for the kitchen.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Juan esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. para poder seguir con sus cultivos y asi darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan lives in his own home with his wife, and has been working in agriculture for many years. His primary crop is corn, and when his harvest is ready he stores it in the granaries shown in the photo. He then goes out to sell it in different markets near his home. He is able to cover some of his household expenses with these sales. Juan is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, insecticides, herbicides, etc., so that he can continue to cultivate and thus provide his family with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, compost, insecticides and herbicides

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto, 59, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Perlita, a housekeeper, and is a father to his children. By the grace of God, Alberto has managed to support his children's schooling. At this time, he is working hard to continually send his youngest child to school to finish his degree.

Alberto oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. They have a jeepney that has a capacity of 18 persons, for which he is paying boundary (daily quota) each day. 

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will use the loan to buy oil and new tires for the jeepney, and renew his registration.  

Alberto dreams that his business will continue to grow and hopes that his child will finish his education. He meets every week with his *co-fellowship members to share stories of his work and to find strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

note: Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy enough for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that make the Philippines truly Philippines.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost and other items in order to improve her land.

loans.name: Fredy Dagoberto

texts.es: Fredy de 41 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos; el se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene muchos años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal en una finca cerca de su casa, el comercia sus productos  en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, Fredy quiere invertir en insumos agrícolas pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, controles de plagas herramienta, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía,  Fredy tiene buenas referencias de pago y está seguro que podrá saldar su deuda a tiempo, y a la vez tiene la confianza que podrá darle a su familia la vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Fredy is 41 and lives with his wife and their four children. He is a farmer - specifically he grows corn and beans. He has many years of experience in this work, and from this he has learned valuable lessons, which have enabled him to obtain the best possible harvests.  He sells his produce in all of the neighboring areas and has built up a solid customer base.  These people always prefer his products due to their high quality and the affordable prices.  He also works as a laborer in a field near his house.

He wishes to invest in agricultural supplies, but for this he needs capital.  For this reason he is seeking a loan through INTEGRAL that will enable him to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, fungicides  and other items in order to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph.  He has good credit references, and he is certain that he will be able to repay his loan on time.  At the same time he is confident that he will be able to give his family the life that they deserve.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticides, fungicides  and other items in order to improve his land.

loans.name: Timoteo De Jesés

texts.es:
Timoteo de 35 años, estudio hasta sexto grado de educacion básica, esta acompañado su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticios, tienen un hijo que vive en casa y esta estudiando. 

Timoteo trabaja la agriucltura desde hace unos 10 años y lo aprendio de su padre, decidio trabajar la agricultura pensando siempre en el bienestar de la familia, tambien se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral y a cultivar hortalizas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semilla de maíz, abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Espera mejorar su condicion de vida, ya que tiene la oportunidad de tener granos basicos para su familia y por comprar los insumos agricolas de una sola vez los adquiere a bajo precio. Sus sueños son poder seguir trabajando de la mejor manera, para tener una buena producción y asi poder darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Timoteo is 35 years old and has a sixth grade education.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They have a son who lives at home and attends school.

Timoteo has been working in agriculture for ten years and he learned this from his parents.  He decided to work in agriculture, thinking about his family’s wellbeing.  He also raises corral birds and vegetables.

He is asking for this loan to buy corn seed, fertilizer, compost, herbicide, and pesticide.  He hopes to improve his quality of life, now that he has the chance to have some basic grains for his family and also to buy some farming supplies at once so he can get them for a lower price.  His dreams are to be able to continue working in a better way to have a good production and to provide his family with a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nelson Mauricio

texts.es:
Nelson de 36 años, estudio hasta segundo grado, esta acompañado, su pareja trabaja en los oficios domesticos, no tiene hijos y nadie mas vive con él, solamente sus señora.

Nelson trabaja la agricultura lo ha hecho por mas de doce años, lo aprendio de su padre y decidio trabajar la agricultura por motivación de su padre y hermanos mayores. Tambien se dedica a trabajar con ganado. La distancia esta como a dos kilometros y se va a pie.

El préstamo que esta soliictando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla de maíz, pago de mano de obra, pago de la preparación de la tierra, herbicidas y pesticidas. Desea que con el cultivo, poder obtener una buena producción para tener el alimento para su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson is 36 years old and has a second grade education.  He is married and his wife is a housewife.  They don’t have any children and no one else lives with them.

Nelson works in agriculture and has been doing this for 12 years.  He learned this from his father and decided to work in agriculture after being motivated to do so by his father and older brothers.  He also works with livestock.  He works two km away and travels there on foot.

He is asking for this loan through CREDICAMPO to buy corn seeds, herbicides, pesticides, and pay for labor to prepare the land.  He hopes to have a good harvest so he can feed his family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: José Raúl

texts.es:
José de 27 años, estudio hasta noveno grado, esta casado, su pareja trabaja en oficios domesticos, tienen un hijo que vive con él y aun no asiste a la escuela, su mamá vive con ellos pero no depende de él, solamente su esposa y su hijo.

José tiene negocio de ganado, y lo ha hecho por unos cinco años y lo aprendio de su padre y decidio trabajar con ganando para tener un patrimonio para su familia. Tambien se dedica a trabajar la agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar ganado de repasto. Sus sueños son poder trabajar mejor para darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia y por lo tanto asegurar un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Jose is 27 years old and has a ninth grade education.  His wife is a housewife and they have one son who lives with them but still does not attend school.  His mother lives with them but only his wife and son depend on him for support.

Jose has a livestock business and has been doing this for five years.  He learned from his father and decided to work with livestock to better support his family.  He also farms.

He is asking for this loan to buy livestock.  His dreams are to be able to work better to provide a better quality of life for his family and secure a better future.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is 50 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Airen's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Airen has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Airen has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Airen is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to protect, assist and secure her coffee harvest

loans.name: Kerin Rigoberto

texts.es:
Kerin de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a hacer los oficios del hogar,  también es la que se encarga el cuidado de los niños. Nadie de los hijos va a la escuela,  por no tener edad para asistir.

Él se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene más de 10 años de dedicarse a la actividad productiva, su padre por medio de las correcciones que le hacía fue como lo hizo que fuera una persona de bien para la sociedad, también trabaja como albañil en la zona y electricista, las mismas personas de la comunidad lo buscan que les trabaje, por el tipo de actividad de la zona es que se dedican solamente a la agricultura.

El trabajo lo tiene cerca de su casa, el recorrido lo hace a pie, nadie más se dedica a la actividad, y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a 10:00 am.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de insumos, como semilla de maíz, herbicidas, pesticidas, pago de personas que le ayuden a cultivar y para pagar el alguiler del terreno.

Desea poder tener primero lo más necesario para la familia, por lo que espera trabajar siempre mientras Dios le regale salud y vida.
texts.en:
Kerin, 27, studied up until the seventh grade. He is in a relationship. His partner is dedicated to the household duties, and she also takes care of the children. None of the children are old enough to go to school.

Kerin works in agriculture. He has been in this productive business for ten years. His father helped him to become a good person for society by correcting him. He also works as a construction worker and electrician. People in his community come to him to ask him to work for them. The other people in this community work solely in agriculture.

His work is located close to his house. He goes to work on foot. No one else works in the same activity. His work schedule runs from 6:00am to 10:00am.

He will invest this loan in purchase of supplies, such as corn seeds, herbicide, and pesticide, pay for the workers that help to cultivate the land, and to pay for the land rent. 

He hopes to be able to have everything his family needs, so he hopes to work as long as God gives him the gift of good health and life.

loans.use: to pay for maize seed, herbicides, pesticides, workers to help to cultivate the land, and the land rent

loans.name: Noel Hernesto

texts.es:
Noel Ernesto es un joven de 29 años, sauceño, padre de familia de un niño el cual está en edad escolar.
Desde hace más de cinco años se dedica a laborar como profesor de primaria en una comunidad del municipio de El Sauce, desde que conformó su familia optó por ejercer esta profesión como joven responsable para tratar de darle un hogar digno a su pequeño hijo.
Con el esfuerzo y sudor de su frente Noel ha logrado comprar una motocicleta la cual es su machete para su trabajo como generalmente se dice en Nicaragua.
Agradece el apoyo que le ha brindado KIva y Ceprodel porque a lo largo de tres años le han otorgado cuatro créditos que le han beneficiado para el desarrollo de su humilde familia, ya que ha mejorado las condiciones de su vivienda.
En este momento Noel tiene la necesidad de un financiamiento para la compra de repuestos para reparar su motocicleta, ya que la ha tenido en mal estado por lo que necesita el apoyo de estas personas para salir adelante con este inconveniente que le perjudica en su trabajo porque la comunidad donde imparte clases está alejada de la ciudad y la moto le agiliza el llegar temprano a su centro de trabajo.
Espera le sigan apoyando.
texts.en:
Noel Ernesto is a young 29-year-old man, and is the father of a child who is in primary school. For more than 5 years, he has been working as a primary school teacher in a community in the El Sauce municipality. When he started his family, being a responsible young man he decided to take on that job to try and provide his small child with a dignified home. 

With his effort and the sweat of his forehead, Noel was able to buy a motorcycle that is "the machete of his work", as they say in Nicaragua. He is thankful for the support of Kiva and CEPRODEL because over the course of three years they have given him four loans, which have supported the development of his humble family since he used them to improve his housing conditions.

At this time, Noel needs a loan to buy replacement parts for his motorcycle, since it has been in bad condition and he needs the support of other people to overcome this inconvenience which is hurting his work, since the community where he teaches is far from the city and the motorcycle helps him travel quickly to his work. He hopes to continue to receive support.

loans.use: to buy replacement motorcycle parts

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es: Verónica tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de un año, 8 años y 14 años  de edad. Verónica es una mujer con espíritu emprendedor  quien se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo desde hace dos años. Junto a su esposo mantienen la economía de su familia y tratan de dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones  ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea comprar una puerta para su vivienda y reparar el muro de retención para lo cual necesita materiales como: cemento, arena, ladrillo, grava y hierro. Espera poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en: Verónica is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their three children, who are 1, 8 and 14 years old. Verónica is a woman with an entrepreneurial spirit who has been selling beauty products via catalog for the past two years. She and her husband maintain their family's economy and try to provide better living conditions to their family. With the desire to improve her living conditions she has decided to request this loan from FUSAI to buy a door for her home and repair the retaining wall, for which she will need materials like cement, sand, bricks, gravel and iron. She hopes to be able to improve living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, gravel and iron to repair her house's retaining wall and buy a door for it

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouman vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 29 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le camp de garde de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le camp de garde de Ségou. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement et de restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mariam  (la 2eme femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax dans le camp de gare de Ségou  et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mariam  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Sabougnouman group all live in monogamous families. On average, they are 29 years old and have two children each. They all live at the Ségou military camp (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, family and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities within the camp.  They are involved in small retail and they sell clothes and prepared food.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first cycle of solidarity loan.

Mariam (second from the left in the photo) is an important seller of wax fabrics in and around the camp.  She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 pieces of wax fabrics in Ségou. She resells her merchandise for cash and also often on credit, from her home, at the market, and also as an itinerant seller. She sells to both men and women. Thanks to this loan, she is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs which will be used to cover some her family's expenses and also to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy wax fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizer, fungicide, empty bags and other items.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Ditsowo Group

texts.es: Seidy es una mujer con 34 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Actualmente es jefa de hogar debido a que se separó de su esposo. Vive sola con sus tres hijos, los cuales estudian uno en primaria y dos en la secundaria. Ella es un señora trabajadora, esforzada y su deseo es superarse y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. Se dedica a la actividad de criar cerdos para luego venderlos y piensa que le va muy bien, debido a que ha podido ir solventando las necesidades de su hogar, asi como el estudio de sus hijos, gracias a los ingresos generados por la venta de sus animales. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos para el cuido de los cerdos y en ocasiones de pollos. Su meta es crecer en su negocio, asi tener mejores condiciones de vida para ella y su familia. Junto con Seidy hay dos socias más solicitando financiamiento para reforzar sus actividades como la cria de animales y la agricultura y, crecer en las mismas.
texts.en:
Seidy is a 34-year-old woman who is married and the mother of three children. She is currently the head of household, since she and her husband are separated. She lives alone with her three children, one of whom is in primary school while the other two are in secondary school. She is a hard-working woman whose dream is to excel and get ahead in life along with her children. She raises pigs to later sell them, and thinks that her work is going very well, since income from animal sales allows her to pay her household expenses and her children's studies. Her children support her in caring for the pigs, and sometimes also chickens. Her goal is to expand her business and have better living conditions for herself and her family. 

Together with Seidy, two other group members are requesting loans to strengthen and grow their economic activities, such as agriculture and animal husbandry.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Elkin De Jesus

texts.es:
Elkin es un reconocido agricultor del sector pues desde muy pequeño comenzó con el proceso de agricultura, incluso como administrador. Sus conocimientos se los trasmitió su padre  el cual heredo las tierras donde actualmente trabaja y Elkin ha velado por que esta tradición familiar se mantenga. 
Sus tierras son las que le dan el capital para mantener su familia conformada por su esposa y un hijo de 10 años el cual desde muy joven le está trasmitiendo todos los conocimientos para que pueda hacerse cargo de sus tierras y aspira a que estudie para que transforme el negocio familiar en una fuerte empresa productora de café, su única aspiración es poder mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familiares y para ello solicita un crédito el cual  lo usara en la compra de abonos para sus tierras aspirando a una gran cosecha para este periodo que le genere buenos recursos para reinventar y potenciar sus cultivos y pueda ampliar sus tierras dejando un bueno legado a su futuro heredero
texts.en:
Elkin is a well-known farmer; he began working in agriculture when he was very young, even as an administrator. He gained knowledge of farming from his father, who inherited the land where he currently works. Elkin has kept up this family tradition. His land is what gives him the capital to maintain his family, consisting of his wife and a ten-year-old son. He has been passing on all of his knowledge to his son since his son was very young so that his son will be able to take charge of his lands. He hopes that his son will study to be able to transform the family business into a strong coffee-producing company.

His sole aspiration is to be able to improve his family's quality of life. He is therefore asking for a loan that he will use to buy fertilizers for his land, aspiring to a large crop for this period that will generate good resouces for him to reinvest and maximize his crops and to be able to expand his lands, leaving his future heir with a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to make his lands more fertile, aspiring to a large harvest that will generate good resources with which he will expand his lands

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fee at university

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Doña Luz Elena continua dedicándose a su actividad comercial que es la venta de Ropa y de vez en cuando ella vende cosas para el hogar como Cazuelas para cocina, Hoyas, Platos, ademas de la Ropa, este crédito lo esta solicita para la compra de Ropa y Accesorios para damas, ella se esfuerza mucho para poder obtener ingresos y seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Doña Luz Elena is still dedicated to clothing sales, and also sometimes sells household items like cooking pots and pans in addition to clothing. She is requesting this loan to buy clothing and accessories for women. She works very hard to earn income and continue improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Renato

texts.es: El señor Renato  tiene 40 años, tiene tres hijos de las edades de 3, 8 y 12 años,  él se dedica a la venta  de comida y almuerzo este negocio lo realiza junto a su esposa tiene su puesto de venta en la zona del Quinto Anillo de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución,  El señor Renato va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  El señor Renato necesita esto para brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes que en ocasiones comen parados, El señor Renato enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que  tiene que levantarse muy temprano cuando hace  frio para ayudar a su esposa preparar su comida,  que es propensa a agarrar reumatismo el cual es muy frecuente en personas con esa actividad,  va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar insumos y ofrecer a sus clientes un buen servicio su deseo  para su negocio es el de tener una pensión de comida variada más grande donde pueda vender más y mejor y poder superarse en la vida. En la foto el señor renato esta en compañia de su esposa.
texts.en: Renato is 40 years old. He has three children who are 3, 8 and 12 years old. He works selling food and lunch. This business he does with his wife with whom he has a food stall in the area of Quinto Anillo of the city of Santa Cruz. This is his second loan with the institution. Renato is going to use this loan to buy tables and chairs for his business. His reason to request this loan is that Renato needs to offer his customers more comfort since sometimes they eat standing. Renato faces challenges in his business as having to get up very early when it is cold to help his wife prepare food. She tends to catch rheumatism which is common among people who work in this business. He is going to use the benefits to buy inputs and offer his customers good service. His wish for his business is to have a bigger eatery of varied food where he can sell more and better, and move forward in life. On the photo Renato is shown with his wife.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for more crablets, prawns, milk fish and lobsters for her fish pond.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is 54 years old and she is happily married to Nestor. God has blessed them with two loving children, who are both still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their children well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Edna owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other things. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passerby and the people in the community. She earns PHP 300 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of PHP 49,0000. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Edna hopes that her business will continue to prosper and dreams of having another business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma previously obtained a 20,000 PHP loan, which she used to buy fish, pork, chicken, and vegetables, needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 15,000 PHP. She will use this loan to buy fish, pork, chicken and vegetables, needed in her business. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Alma dreams of having other sources of income and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the group and the Word of God that she studies.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy fish, pork, chicken and vegetables, needed in her business.

loans.name: 06 Y Bích Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hương has a production facilities to make salt. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools to make the salt to sell.

Hương is 36 years old and she is married with three children.

She is the leader of a four-member group, the 06 Y Bích Hải Lộc Group solidarity group.

In 2012, Hương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hương has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Hương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

The main hardships that Hương faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

In the future, Hương hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more tools to make the salt to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine

loans.name: Benilda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Desde niña, Bemilda  tuvo una fuerte atracción hacia las joyas y bisuterías.  Siempre le gustaba adornar sus dedos con vistosos anillos y sus manos con brazaletes  de distintos materiales.  Nunca imagino que su inmensa fascinación  por estos artículos sería una importante herramienta de trabajo hoy en día.  Ella se dedica a comercializar, en su hogar, pulseras, cadenas, aretes de oro y plata, asimismo, ropa, cremas corporales y lociones. 
Con este pequeño negocio ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante, porque las ganancias adquiridas, hasta la fecha de hoy, son fabulosas.  Cada vez son más los clientes que la visitan, ya ofrece una gran variedad de joyas y ropa. Por supuesto, Bemilda desea continuar ampliando la gama de accesorios y prendas para el público. Por lo que solicitó otro préstamo en KIVA MiCrédito para comprar: pulseras, cadenas, aretes de oro y plata, con el fin de no  sufrir escasez ante las demandas que se presenten.
texts.en:
Since she was a girl, Bemilda has had a strong attraction to jewels and costume jewelry. She always liked to decorate her fingers with bright and colorful rings and her hands with bracelets made of different materials. She never imagined that her great fascination with these products would be an important working tool today.

She makes a living in her home selling gold and silver bracelets, chains, and earrings, as well as clothing, body creams, and lotions. With this small business, she has managed to give her family a good start because the earnings obtained, so far, are fabulous. More and more clients visit her, because she offers a large variety of jewels and clothing.

Of course, Bemilda wants to continue to broaden the range of accessories and garments for the public, which is why she requested another loan through KIVA MiCredito in order to buy: gold and silver bracelets, chains, and earrings, in an effort to not suffer a shortage in the face of the demands that arise.

loans.use: to buy gold and silver bracelets, chains, and earrings.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling mud crabs and from a general store. Delia is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing nets for her fishing business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Nacer Ulises

texts.es: El señor Nacer, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, quienes están pequeños, el labora para una empresa de transporte como conductor y ella en una empresa privada, los dos sean dedicado a construir su casa para poder tener un lugar digno para criar a sus hijos, el solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales como. cemento, arena, puertas, cerámica, pintura para terminar un anexo que tiene detenido desde hace un mes por falta de materiales. Agradece el apoyo que esta recibiendo de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Nacer lives in the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife and small children. He works as a driver for a transportation company, and she works for a private business. The two of them are working on building a house so that they can have a dignified space in which to raise their children. He is requesting this loan to buy construction materials like cement, sand, doors, ceramic tiles, and paint so that he can finish a home addition that has been stalled for the last month due to lack of materials. He is grateful for the support he receives from Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina, a mother of three children, helps her husband operate their own farm to make a living. For five years, the couple has earned well to provide for the family. She had planned to improve their farm in order to send her children to school.

Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to purchase fertilizer to have higher returns. In the future she wants to provide a good education to her children and improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medicine and complete medical exams.

loans.name: Nat

texts.en:
Nat, 46, is a married woman who lives and operates a farming business in Prasat Bakong District, Siem Reap Province. She has been in this business for more than ten years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. She has five children, one of whom is already married. Farming is the main job that she operates to support her family.

Nat said that she is grateful to Kiva and the cooperative partners because through them, she was able to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan to build a hygienic latrine. This loan will improve her general living conditions, promote health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. 

Nat is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than the usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is 40 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in school.

She and her family survived Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ederlina is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Ederlina has been an NWTF borrower since 2013.

With your help, Ederlina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of Super Typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is 42 years old and has three children. Evangelina is married and her three children are in school.

Evangelina is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Evangelina has been in pig fattening for 5 years now and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evangelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gloria is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

Gloria has been in pig fattening for seven years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed, vaccines and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es: Con el ánimo de tener su negocio fuera de su hogar el señor Juan David llega solicitando un crédito con la ilusión de posicionar más su empresa, de agilizar su producción de ir en busca de más clientes que lo conozcan que miren su trabajo y se enamoren de un servicio y calidad a un precio justo, llega a solicitar un crédito para la compra de una maquina triple transporte la cual es muy usada en las tapicerías. La inclusión de esta máquina en la empresa de Juan será de gran ayuda puesto que minimizara los tiempo de producción lo que los clientes verán con muy buenos ojos ya que sus productos estarán más rápido que es la finalidad de esta máquina, Juan espera que mejorando su servicio le pueda generar más clientes que le permitan generar buen capital para trasladar su negocio de su hogar a un local más amplio y grande en un sector más comercial convirtiéndose esto en su mayor sueño y ambición, solo espera que las cosas le salgan como las piensa y que con la ayuda de dios pueda seguir adelante con su empresa.
texts.en:
With the aim of having his business outside his home, Juan David is requesting a loan with the hope of positioning his business better, streamlining production, and searching for more customers who know him, look at his work, and fall in love with his service and quality at a reasonable price.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a triple transport sewing machine, which is widely used in upholstery. The incorporation of this machine into Juan's business will greatly help him, for it will minimize production time. His customers will look upon this favorably, since products will be ready faster, which is the purpose of this machine.

Juan hopes that by improving his service he will have more customers, which will allow him to generate good capital in order to move his business from his home to a larger and more spacious location in a more commercial sector. Turning this into his greatest dream and ambition, he only hopes that things will turn out how he has planned and that with the help of God he will move forward with his business.

loans.use: to buy a triple transport sewing machine, which is widely used in upholstery and with which he will improve the efficiency of production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to help with her coffee crop again.

loans.name: Sheryl

texts.en:
Sheryl is 33 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

Sheryl and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Sheryl has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Sheryl can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Geraldine requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Geraldine has been in this business for 6 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Geraldine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María es una joven ecuatoriana de 20 años de edad, es soltera vive en casa de familiares, gracias al esfuerzo de los padres pudo terminar solamente la primaria, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo que trabajar para ayudar en los gastos de la familia, ella es muy emprendedora y trabajadora, ha sabido ganarse el cariño y el aprecio de quienes la conocen.
Sus padres son separados pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para que Rosa pueda salir adelante y ser una apoyo moral y económico para su madre, Rosa se dedica a la venta de morochos y empanadas que ella mismo hace vende en forma ambulante trabaja medio tiempo y el otro medio tiempo trabaja en un restaurante como ayudante. Hoy  solicita un crédito para remodelar un pequeño local para que pueda expender su producto, fue recomendada por un familiar, el mismo que es cliente de Fundacion Alternativa.
Su mayor sueño es terminar de estudiar y que su negocio siga creciendo cada día mas.
Maria agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
María is a 20-year-old Ecuadorian young woman. She is single and lives in a house with her family. Thanks to her parents' efforts she was able to finish primary school, but she had to work from the time she was very young to be able to help with her family's expenses. She is very entrepreneurial and hardworking, and has known how to earn the affection and the appreciation of those who know her. Her parents are separated but this has not been an obstacle to Rosa's ability to get ahead or to providing moral and financial support to her mother. 

Rosa makes a living from selling morochos (Ecuadorian sweet corn drinks) and empanadas; she sells in an itinerant manner part time. The other half of the time, she works in a restaurant as a helper. She is currently asking for a loan to remodel a small place to sell her product, which was recommended by a family member who is also a client of Fundacion Alternativa.

Her greatest dream is to finish her studies and that her business keep growing more and more each day. Maria is grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making her personal and professional growth possible.

loans.use: to remodel a small place so she can sell her product.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana de 21 años de edad, es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora, actualmente vive sola con su abuelo quien se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos. Ana le ayuda a realizar los oficios del hogar, ademas le lleva la comida hasta el lugar donde trabaja su abuelo. 


Ana se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, ademas le ayuda a su abuelo cuando hace el proceso para hacer atado de dulce, debido a que él siembra caña y es Ana la que se encarga de envolver los atados de dulce, para luego ser comercializados.


Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando, para que pueda pagar los insumos que utilizara su abuelo en la siembra de maíz, frijol, maicillo y caña de azúcar, como lo es la semilla, pesticidas, herbicidas, fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra.

El sueño de  Ana es forma una  bonita familia en un futuro.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old. She is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial young woman. She currently lives alone with her grandfather, who makes a living planting basic grains. Ana helps her grandfather with household chores and, in addition, takes his food to the place where he works. 

Ana performs house work. She also helps her grandfather when he goes through the process of preparing sugarcane honey, since he grows sugarcane. Ana is responsible for wrapping the sugarcane honey, which they later sell.

This loan will help her to be able to pay for the supplies that her grandfather will use in the planting of corn, beans, sorghum, and sugarcane, such as seeds, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizer, and manual labor.

Ana's dream is to have a beautiful family in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, pesticides, herbicides, fertilizer, and manual labor for the planting of corn, beans, sorghum, and sugarcane.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 50 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Vilma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Vilma has taken a 4,000 PHP housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vilma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Alianca

texts.en:
Alianca is 35 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,500.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has five children and she opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100.00.  She earns a good income from her business.
 She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store such as Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, bread, water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, and milk curdle. She is a very hard-working woman and doing business has become her regular activity for the past 14 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, bread, water, noodles, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, salt, milk curdle

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl, age 29, is happy tending her little store. She is married with one kid. The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Cheryl keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Cheryl believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.

Cheryl has reached her 10 months being a member to Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for  sari-sari store items like canned goods, noodles and sugar. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there a good education she could afford for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for sari-sari store items like canned goods, noodles, and sugar

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is 43 years old and lives in Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 school-age children. Arlyn is engaged in agricultural activities, particularly coconut and fruit production, vegetable gardening, and also in charcoal buy and sell business. The couple earns approximately PHP30,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing commercial fertilizers for her fruit production and vegetable gardening activities. Part of the proceeds will be used as additional capital for her charcoal buy and sell business. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. In the future, Arlyn hopes to expand her charcoal buy and sell business.

loans.use: to purchase commercial fertilizers for her fruit production and vegetable gardening

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna's previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy additional stocks of clothing needed in her buy and sell business. Aside from this, she was also able to add other business and send her children to school.

At present, she manages a small variety store and also trades perfume as her additional product in her buy and sell business. Together with her husband, she works hard to provide for their family's everyday needs. She would like to apply for another loan, this time 10,000 PHP. She will use the new loan to buy additional supplies of products needed in her businesses. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and provide for her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Edna hopes expanding her business and dreams to have a happy and fruitful life by the grace of God. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of clothing, perfume and groceries for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the needed feeds for her poultry. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from business is assisting their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan for her to buy feeds for her poultry and ducks. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family's daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Theresa hopes that her business will last longer and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feeds for her poultry and ducks.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Grace has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 53 years old and married with five children, one child in school. Luzviminda  works very hard to provide for them.

Luzviminda's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Luzviminda  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Luzviminda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Luzviminda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen is single and has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

Airen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of ready to wear like blouses, t-shirts, shorts, etc. to sell.

Airen has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Airen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 33 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Irene is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Irene has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Roselia De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Roselia tiene 25 años de edad y habita junto a su compañero de vida, su hermano y sus dos hijos de 5 años y 3 años de edad. Roselia posee una tienda y una tortillería desde hace 3 años. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien desea dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Con el fin de dar a su familia mejores condiciones de desarrollo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así hacer la instalación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Roselia is 25 years old and lives together with her life partner, her brother, and her two children who are 5 and 3 years old.  Roselia has owned a store and made tortillas for three years.  She is a hardworking woman who wants to give her family the best living conditions.  

In order to give her family a better environment, she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of electricity in her home.  She hopes to count on this loan and do the installation as soon as possible.

loans.use: to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca. She is 43 years old and a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Joel, a fisherman, and Rebecca is a mother to her six children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Since the place is in a rich agricultural region, she also includes root crops, veggies and fruits in her inventories to increase her daily profit. Her store is located adjacent to her house, and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Rebecca is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rebecca hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to have her own grocery store. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it's a time when she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
This is Rhea. She is a 38-year-old resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, she was able to raise her child well.

Rhea owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. Rhea gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby and the people in the community. She earns 300 PHP a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, Rhea is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store. Rhea also owns a restaurant and boarding house.

Rhea hopes to expand her businesses and see her profit increasing. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, house hold and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 42,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rowena still hopes continuous success both in business and life. She also dreams expansion of her business. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
This is Edna, 52, and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Arthur, a carpenter, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Edna operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Edna hopes for her business to continue to flourish. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 28 years old and married with one child in school; Analyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries.

Analyn has been in this business for 5 years. 

In the future, Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy general store items to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 43-year-old married woman with seven children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing materials like fishing net and rope for her business.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net and rope for her business

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es:
Rosa de 30 años de edad, es una señora de oficios domésticos muy dedicada a su familia, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida quien trabaja en la agricultura sembrando granos básicos y trabajando de jornalero cuando lo buscan en labores agrícolas ajenos.  Rosa por ser de familia de escasos recursos económicos, no pudo estudiar solo logra escribir sus nombres y apellidos, ya que le enseñaron sus hijos para que pudiera firmar.


Rosa hace los oficios del hogar como: lavar, barrer y cocinar. Cuando su compañero de vida se encuentra en las labores agrícolas ella prepara los sagrados alimentos para llevarlos hasta el lugar de trabajo.
