Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando, para que pueda pagar los insumos que utilizara su compañero de vida en la siembra de maíz como: 2 sacos de triple 15, 2 sacos de sulfato de amonio y 5 litro de herbicidas.

Rosa quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida de su hogar, para que en un futuro sus hijos puedan tener mejores condiciones de vida. Ademas, seguir produciendo granos básicos para la alimentación de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 30 years old and is a housewife who is very dedicated to her family. She currently lives with her life partner, who works in agriculture planting basic grains and works as a day laborer when he is sought for remote agricultural work. Because Rosa was from a family with scarce resources, she wasn't able to study. She is only able write her first and last names; her children taught her so she'd be able to sign her name. Rosa does domestic work like washing, sweeping and cooking. When her life partner is doing agricultural work, she prepares food to bring to his place of work.

With the loan, she will be helping to pay for the supplies that her life partner will use to plant corn, such as two sacks of Triple 15 fertilizer, two sacks of ammonium sulfate and five liters of herbicides. Rosa wants to improve the living conditions of her home so that her children can have better living conditions in the future. She also wants to keep producing basic grains to feed her entire family.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of Triple 15 fertilizer, two sacks of ammonium sulfate and five liters of herbicide to plant corn

loans.name: Nhóm 04 Thôn Tân Thịnh Xã Tân Khang Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lụa works in agriculture farming poultry . She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Lụa has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Lụa faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Lụa is 48 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 04 Thôn Tân Thịnh Xã Tân Khang Group solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2013, Lụa joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lụa has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  With her business profit, Lụa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Levi

texts.en:
Levi is married with four children. She is 32 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

She has her pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan to purchase feeds and additional piglet.

Levi has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to have more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase an additional piglet and feed

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en:
Eugenia has helped her husband, working on their own farm, to make a living for more than six years by growing and selling bananas. She earns well from this and she has been able to support her children's education. Her previous loan, which was used for this farm, was repaid successfully. 

Recently,  she took  a new  loan from to buy organic fertilizer for farm fertilization. 

She wants to improve the farm to ensure a better source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.en:
Eliodora is 63 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, she has a business selling a variety of dried fish. She earns about 10,000 each month doing this type of business. 

Eliodora requested a loan for additional capital to purchase more kilos of dried  fish to sell/retail.

Eliodora has been a member of PMPC for four years.

 In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of dried  fish to sell/retail

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Esmeraldo

texts.en:
Esmeraldo is married with one child. Esmeraldo is 39 years old, and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Esmeraldo has some pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for seven years. 

He has requested a loan for additional working capital to purchase more piglets and feed.

Esmeraldo is a new member of PMPC. 

In the future, he hopes to have a big profit in order to continue having some pigs and for well living.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a resident of Palawan, Philippines. She is 48 years old and she is happily married to Ruben. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, they were able to raise their child well and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Marilyn owns a variety store. This is a small store that can be owned by anyone in the community and the store is just connected to or just inside their houses. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg and other items. She gets her product from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she will sell it per piece for a higher price to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passers-by and the people in the community. She earns PHP 500 a day.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a PHP 27,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Marilyn desires that her business will continue to grow and she is hoping to have more customers. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Lowanie

texts.en:
Lowanie is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is 38 years old, and she is happily married to Ronnie. God has blessed them with three loving children, and all of them are still studying. Life indeed is hard. But by the grace of God, she and her husband have been able to raise their children well, and they are helping each other in working for their family.

Lowanie owns a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store may be owned by anyone in the community, and the store is typically connected to, or just inside, their house. This is where you can buy a sachet of shampoo or conditioner, a bar of soap, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg, for example. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, and then she will sell them by the piece for a higher price, to have profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, passersby, and the people in the community. In this way, she earns PHP 500 a day. Lowanie and her family also raise and sell hogs.

To be able to expand her inventory, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. She will use the loan to expand her product inventory, by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages. This loan will be a great help for her to add more products to her store.

Lowanie hopes that her variety store and her piggery business will continue to grow. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.


All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to expand her product inventory, by buying groceries, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
This is Paz, a resident of Palawan, Philippines, and a mother to her children. Her husband is Veneroso, an electrician. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard, to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Paz operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages, piecemeal, to the neighborhood. It is the place to go, to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices, and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales, every day.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products, to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business.

Paz hopes to increase her profit while expanding her business. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and other products, to add to her inventory

loans.name: Jerlie

texts.en:
Jerlie is married with three children; she operates a retail store to make a living.  In five years in running the business, she earns well to support the needs of her children and was able to sustain the business.  

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase more goods to sell. 

She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Cherry Mae has been in this business for two years now.

She requested an 11,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

In the future, Cherry Mae would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma  works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 8,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Vilma will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

She would like to save enough to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, noodles, candies, beers, etc. 

Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 36 years old and married with three children.  With two children in school, Edelyn works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell dried coconut meat in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Edelyn has been in this business for eight years.

In the future Edelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Julieta has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a general store.

Julieta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like fish, meat, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is 59 years old and married with one child, She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.  Leonor has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Leonor would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom, age 32, is living in a rural village in the Phnom Proek district with her two children. She and her husband have been farming rice and growing cassava. Sometimes she works for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 14 years. 

Sreymom is a first cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Sreymom wants to use her loan portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cultivated land. She hopes to grow her cassava and rice in a timely manner in order to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad de la zona norte de Nicaragua, junto a su esposa y sus cuatros hijos. Se dedica a la producción de este rubro desde hace más de 20 años.

La finca de este productor es manejada bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo, CA.F.E. Practices y UTZ. En los últimos tres años la producción de su café ha incrementado en un 20 por ciento, dado el buen manejo que este productor implementa en su finca.

Para continuar creciendo, ahora se ha propuesto la renovación de 2.1 hectáreas de café, a fin de continuar incrementando su producción a través de áreas y rendimiento, y con ello mejorar los ingresos para darle a su esposa y sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Orlando is a small coffee producer who lives with his wife and their four children in a community in the northern region of Nicaragua. He has worked in the production of coffee for the last 20 years.

The crops of this producer are managed under the criteria of the certification of Comercio Justo, CA.F.E. Practices y UTZ. In the last three years, the production of coffee has increased by 20% due to the producer’s good management of his crops. To continue to grow, now Orlando has proposed the renovation of 2.1 hectares in order to continue increasing his production through more planting areas and performance, which would increase his income that would be used to give his wife and children a better future.

loans.use: to renovate 2.1 hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farming supplies to care for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Santos Nelson

texts.es:
Santos tiene 44 años y vive con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Toda su vida ha estado relacionado con la actividad de café, y desde hace más de 15 años se dedica a este rubro como principal actividad económica, el cual maneja bajo los criterios de certificación de Comercio Justo.

El sueño de Santos es darle a sus hijos mejores oportunidades para su crecimiento, por eso cada día se esfuerza y les enseña el valor de trabajo para seguir adelante. Su meta es incrementar la productividad de su finca, para ello está solicitando un crédito que le permita renovar 1.4 hectáreas de café e incrementar los ingresos para darle un mejor futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 44, lives with his wife and five children in a community in the north of Nicaragua. His whole life he has had a relationship with the production of coffee and for more than 15 years he has worked in this industry as his main economic activity. He produces coffee under the criteria of the Fair Trade certification.
The dream of Santos is to give his children better opportunities for their growth, due to this every day he works hard and teaches his children the value of work in order to get ahead. His goal is to increase the productivity of his crops, which is why he is his requesting a loan that will allow him to renovate 1.4 hectares of coffee and increase his income to give a better future to his family.

loans.use: to renovate 1.4 hectares of coffee.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 63 years old and lives in Poblacion, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with five children.

She has built a boarding house to have additional income. She has requested a loan for additional working capital. She wants to purchase building materials for boarding house construction. 

Victoria has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to develope well her boarding house.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for boarding house construction

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion,Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with four children.

To earn a living, Victoria owns and operates a small carenderia. She earns about 4,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. Victoria has requested a loan for additional capital to purchase raw pork, chicken, and spices for her carenderia.

Victoria is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she  would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw pork, chicken, and other foods for her carenderia

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan  has been providing manicure and pedicure services for more than five years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to support her family. 

Having three children requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for their education. The couple had to work hard with determination to have a better income to provide their children a better education than they have. 

To improve the services,  she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional nail polish, a nipper, and other materials needed for the services. In the future, Joan hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional nail polish, a nipper ,and other materials needed for the services

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with eight children. She is 32 years old and has seven children who are currently in school.

She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilou requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Marilou has been in this business for five years. In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dennys Fabricio

texts.es:
Dennys es un joven ecuatoriano  de 21 años de edad, es soltero vive en casa de su abuela junto con su madre y hermano su padre los abandonó desde hace mucho tiempo, por  referencia de un familiar  y cliente de Fundacion Alternativa solicitó un crédito, el mismo que lo utilizó para invertir en mas producto ya que las ventas aumentaron y tiene pedidos pendientes por entregar. Hoy está en su segundo crédito el que será utilizado en la compra de mas productos.
Es soltero actualmente está estudiando en la ESPE  Latacunga se encuentra cursando el segundo semestre de Ingeniería Petroquímica, es muy buen estudiante y muy emprendedor con su trabajo ayuda a su madre en los gastos de la familia. Su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo cada vez más, se dedica a la venta de productos naturales,  A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, Dennys es muy responsable en sus estudios y colaborador en su hogar.
La zona donde vive es muy comercial y es una zona urbana está ubicada en pleno centro de la ciudad.
Quiere agradecer a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Dennys is a young 21 year old Ecuadorian.  He is single and lives in his grandmother's house together with his mother and brother.  His father abandoned them a long time ago.  A relative referred him to Fundacion Alternativa to request a loan.  He used the loan to invest in more products since his sales increased and he has pending sales to fill.  Now he is requesting a second loan to purchase more products.  

He is single and currently studying at ESPE Latacunga.  He is in his second semester of Petrochemical Engineering.  He is a very good student and very enterprising since he helps his mother with the family expenses.  His small business has been growing.  He works selling natural products.  In spite of having work that demands a lot of time and effort, Dennys is very responsible with his studies and helping at home.

The area where he lives is very commercial and it is an urban area located in the center of the city.  He wants to thank Fundacion Alternativa in Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth in his business and personal life possible.

loans.use: to purchase more products and primary materials.

loans.name: José Aristides

texts.es: José tiene 26 años de edad y  trabaja en construcción desde hace tres años. De esta forma se gana la vida y mantienen la economía del hogar . Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea introducir el servicio de energía eléctrica en su vivienda. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y así mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales lo antes posible.
texts.en: José is 26 years old and has worked in construction for three years. This is how makes a living and supports his household. With the goal of improving his living conditions, he has made the decision to request this loan from Kiva partner FUSAI, given that he would like to bring electricity into his home. He hopes to get the financing and improve his housing condition as soon as possible.

loans.use: to bring electricity to his home.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is married with three children and operates a general store to make a living. Aside from this, she also vends barbecue to earn extra income. 

After five years running the business, she earns well to support the needs of her children and has been able to sustain it.  She took a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
This is Anita, 63, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Anita operates a vegetable-growing farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits in their farm located in Cavite. It is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to markets and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP1,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. 

Anita hopes that her business will continue and be established. She dreams that her family is always in good condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, seeds, and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel is married with three children. She is 31 years old and lives in Paglaum  Dumalinao Zamboanga Del Sur.

She is a farmer and grows rice fields to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers.

Ritchel has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to buy her own rice mill.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is single and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She  requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 40 years old and has four children. She is widowed and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marylou has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 65 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Lolita has borrowed and paid 32 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from  farming rice.

Lolita aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like caned goods, eggs, soft drinks, noodles, etc

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional frozen foods, chicken, beef, etc., to sell.

She has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Lory would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional frozen foods, chicken, beef, etc., to sell

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Leonor tiene 67 años de edad, está casada y es madre de 5 hijos. Vive en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua donde existen condiciones climáticas favorables para la producción de café, rubro al que junto a su familia se dedica desde hace 27 años.

La producción de café de esta emprendedora ha venido mejorando en los últimos tres años, y para mantener este incremento ella está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que necesita su cafetal, para tener una buena producción en este ciclo y con ellos garantizar los ingresos para su familia, la cual es la prioridad para esta emprendedora que día a día se esfuerza para darle un mejor futuro a sus hijos, de los cuales tres aún son adolescentes.
texts.en:
Leonor is 67 years old. She is married and the mother of five children. She lives in a community in the northern part of Nicaragua where there are favorable climate conditions for growing coffee, a trade that Leonor, along with her family, has worked in for 27 years.

This businesswoman's coffee-growing has been getting better in the last three years, and to maintain this growth, she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase the supplies and fertilizers that her coffee crops need in order to yield a good harvest in this growing cycle. The crops will guarantee income for her family, which is a priority for this entrepreneur. Day after day, she works to give her children, three of whom are teenagers, a better future.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and fertilizers that her coffee plantation needs.

loans.name: Donald De Jesus

texts.es:
Donald es un joven de 28 años que vive al norte de Nicaragua junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 5 meses. El logró estudiar hasta cuarto año de secundaria, pero luego tuvo que dedicarse al trabajo completamente, para apoyar a su familia.

Siempre ha estado relacionado con la actividad del café y desde hace 10 años se dedica a este rubro como principal actividad económica. La finca de este joven emprendedor está bajo la certificación de Comercio Justo, lo cual disminuye el riesgo del precio al comercializar su producción.

Para este ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar abonos que requiere su cafetal, y con ello garantizar buenos rendimientos para esta cosecha, y por tanto mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Donald is a young man of 28 years who lives in the northern part of Nicaragua with his wife and baby son, who is five months old. He went to school through the fourth year of secondary school, but after that, he had to completely dedicate himself to working so that he could support his family.

He has always been involved with coffee-growing, and 10 years ago, he made this trade his main occupation. This young entrepreneur's plantation is certified by the Comercio Justo, which lowers the price risk of selling his product.

For this loan cycle, he is requesting a loan that will allow him to purchase compost that his plantation needs. This will guarantee good output for the harvest, and, therefore, better income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase the compost he needs for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Layli

texts.ru: Лайли добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее муж таксист. Лайли и ее муж всегда стараются обеспечить детей хорошей условием проживания. Лайли более 19 лет занимается купле продажей ткани. Она покупает оптом ткани и реализует в розницу на местном рынке, где она имеет торговую точку. Лайли каждый сезон обновляет товар и таким образом привлекает покупателей, так как конкуренция большая на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 12000 сомони для покупки разнообразных тканей для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Layli is a conscientious woman. She is married and has four dependent children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Layli and her husband always try to provide a good quality of life to their children. For over 19 years, Layli has been buying and reselling fabrics. She buys fabrics wholesale and sells them retail at the local market, where she has a sales stand. Every season Layli updates her selection of wares and thus attracts more customers  as there is a lot of competition at the local market. She is applying for a loan in the amount of 120,000 TJS to buy a variety of fabrics for the new season. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fabrics for the new season.

loans.name: Las Ponchitas Group

texts.es: Manuela tiene 28 años de edad, (es la que aparece en medio, de güipil color café), vive en el municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, tiene dos hijos; el primero de 9 años de edad estudia tercer grado primaria y el segundo tiene 8 años de edad estudia primer grado primaria, se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de ropa típica, la venta lo hace en la comunidad donde vive y en la comunidades cercanas, el oficio de tejer se lo enseño su mamá desde pequeña, Manuela necesita un crédito para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de ropa típica, la meta de ella es establecer un loca y expandir su mercado de venta.
texts.en: Manuela is 28 years old. In the photo, she is the one in the middle in the brown blouse. She lives in the town of Nahualá, department of Sololá. She has two children: the older is 9 years old and is in the third grade, and the younger is 8 years old and in the first grade. Her primary work is making and selling typical clothing. She does her sales in the community where she lives and in nearby communities. Sewing is work that she learned from her mother when she was young. Manuela needs a loan to buy the raw materials she needs to make her typical clothing. Her goal is to establish a location for her shop and expand her line of merchandise for sale.

loans.use: buy the raw materials to make typical clothing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es un pequeño productor de café que vive en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. En los últimos 3 años su producción de café ha pasado de 100 a 150 quintales de café.

Para este ciclo su meta es continuar incrementando su producción y por tanto los ingresos para su familia. Para ello, está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar los insumos y fertilizantes que requiere su cafetal para un adecuado mantenimiento.

En el futuro este pequeño productor se ve produciendo, como mínimo 500 quintales de café de buena calidad. Para ello, uno de sus principales desafíos es aumentar el área de café y darle un buen manejo.
texts.en:
Carlos is a small coffee producer who lives in a rural community in northern Nicaragua. In the last three years, he has seen his coffee production increase from 100 quintals (a quintal is approximately 100kg) to 150 quintals of coffee. This loan term, his goal is to continue to expand his production, and thus his income for his family. To do this, he is requesting a loan which he will use to buy the supplies and fertilizer that his coffee crop requires for adequate maintenance.

In the future, this small producer sees himself producing 500 quintals of good quality coffee at a minimum.  To do that, one of his chief challenges is to expand the area available for coffee and be able to manage it well.

loans.use: get the fertilizer his coffee crop needs

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Para describir a Miriam es necesario usar dos palabras; luchadora y emprendedora y es que es una mujer que a sus 40 años de edad es soltera y solo se preocupa por trabajar y brindarle una excelente vida a su hija de 16 años, trabaja como comercializadora de gelatinas las cuales labora y tiene dos vendedores que se encargan de su distribución y le dan un porcentaje de las ventas, más de 17 años dan fe de sus excelentes productos, sus precios y el sabor de las gelatinas su gran aval es ser una persona muy conocida en el sector convirtiéndose estos en los principales compradores, con vísperas al futuro y pensando en su hogar se ha trazado la meta de lograr organizar su hogar adecuándolo como ella lo soñó, solicita un crédito para la compra de unas ollas industriales y un fogón de gas con los que minimizara los tiempos de producen de las gelatinas pensando en realizar mayor cantidad para tener otro vendedor generando mayor capital para aumentar su calidad de vida y asegurarle una educación universitaria a su hija
texts.en: To describe Miriam, you need two words: fighter, and enterprising. She is a 40-year-old single woman, and she is only worried about working and providing an excellent life for her 16-year-old daughter. She sells jellies that she makes, and she has two salespeople who are in charge of her distribution. She gives them a percentage of the sales (commission). For more than 17 years, the salespeople have testified to her excellent products, her prices, and the flavor of the jellies. Her biggest asset is being well-known in the area, which has translated into loyal customers. With thoughts of the future and her home, she has set a goal of equipping her home the way she dreamed. She is requesting a loan to purchase an industrial pot and a gas stove, which will reduce cooking time for the jellies. She is thinking that she will have a larger quantity of jelly and can have another salesperson. This will generate more income to improve her quality of life and ensure her daughter a university education.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial pot and gas stove to minimize cooking time, increasing production so she can hire a salesperson.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El joven Ronald tiene 27 años,  soltero estudia la carrera  de técnico superior en electrónica en un instituto muy reconocido de la ciudad de El Alto  trabaja para pagar sus estudios como vendedor de variedad de productos de manera ambulante, es este es su primer crédito con la institución y  el joven Ronald va a usar este préstamo para  el pago de su mensualidad y compra de libros,   Ronald enfrenta retos en sus estudios ya que el trabajar y estudiar es muy sacrificado para el, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante hasta culminar sus estudios ya después buscar trabajo en su área de estudio y de esta manera poder recibir más ingresos y después poder hacer una licenciatura en su área que este es su deseo.
texts.en: Ronald, age 27, is a young single man who is attending a technical college to earn a degree in electronics from a well recognized institute in the city of El Alto. He works to pay for his studies as a traveling salesperson of a variety of products. This is his first loan with the institution, and he plans to use it to pay his monthly tuition and buy books. Ronald faces challenges in his studies since working and going to school requires great sacrifice for him. However, this young man wants to keep going, finish his studies, and find a job in his field. In this way he hopes to earn a better salary, and later to get a license in his area of study.

loans.use: pay his tuition and buy books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy the supplies she needs for the new season of coffee plantation

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el municipio de San Pablo Jocopilas, departamento de Suchitepéquez, tiene 3 hijos; uno ya es mayor de edad ya trabaja, y los otros dos son estudiantes, ella obtiene sus ingresos por cosecha de café y por alquiler de casas, Candida Rosa necesita un crédito por un monto de Q.6,000.00 para comprar insumos (fertilizantes, abono orgánico entre otros) para el mantenimiento de café,  en el futuro Candida Rosa piensa comprar más terrenos y sembrar más plantaciones de café
texts.en: Candida Rosa is 46 years old. She lives in the municipality of San Pablo Jocopilas, in the department of Suchitepequez. She has three children. One is already grown and working. The other two are in school. Candida Rosa makes money by farming coffee and by renting houses. She needs a loan in the amount of Q.6,000.00 to purchase supplies (fertilizers, organic compost, etc.) for growing coffee. For the future, Candida Rosa is thinking of buying more land and planting more coffee crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing coffee.

loans.name: Maria Bernardina

texts.es: Solo una verdadera luchadora se repone de un fuerte golpe  y es que para contar la historia de María es necesario decir que fue una persona víctima del desplazamiento forzado obligada a abandonar sus tierras, pero ella no se rindió no se conformó solo con estar sentada a la acera de una calle pidiendo una moneda para subsistir, busco alternativas para generar recursos y gracias a los microcréditos logro montar una pequeña tienda en la cual distribuye productos de la canasta familiar, una tienda humilde que puede carecer de muchas cosas pero lo que si tiene es una vendedora soñadora y luchadora de la vida la cual solicita un crédito para realizar una ampliación al local y llenarlo de más surtido pues actualmente vende gaseosas, legumbres, abarrotes y granos pero quiere expandir su variedad con un único sueño continuar con el negocio volverlo más rentable y dejar a un lado lo que vivido en un pasado
texts.en: Only a true fighter recovers from a strong blow. To tell María's story, you have to know that she was a victim of forced relocation, obliged to leave her land. But she was never defeated; she never contented herself with just sitting on a street begging for subsistence handouts.  Rather, she sought alternative ways to earn money, and thanks to microloans, she was able to open a small store where she sells everyday goods. It's a humble store, and while it lacks for many things, what it does have is a salesperson who is both a dreamer and a fighter. She is asking for this loan so that she can both expand her location and fill it with more of the stock that she currently sells, such as sodas, produce, groceries and grains. She wants to expand her variety, working towards her goal of continuing to make her business more profitable, leaving behind a life from the past.

loans.use: expand her store and strengthen her sales in produce and sodas

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de e vida y sus dos hijos de 12 años y 13 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. María se gana la vida por medio de la venta de tamales desde hace 2 años y es así como junto a compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea terminar un cuarto al cual le hace falta puertas y ventanas y la introducción de la energía eléctrica. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así finalizar el cuarto lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 45 years old and lives in her own home with her longtime partner and their two children, who are 12 and 13 years old and are both enrolled in school. For the past two years, María has made a living selling tamales with her partner and this is how they manage their living expenses. With the hope of improving her family's living conditions, María is requesting this loan from Apoyo Integral because she wants to finish the construction of one of the rooms in her home, which still needs doors and windows. Additionally, María will install electricity in her home. She hopes that she will receive this loan and be able to finish her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy a door and a window and to install electricity in her home

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Maxima hopes that her business will grow bigger until it becomes a grocery store. She dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 25-years-old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marivic has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers for her vegetable vending business.

Merlinda has been in this business for 26 years. Merlinda earns more income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria's previous loan was a big help in her business as she was able to buy additional varieties of snacks and biscuits needed in her business. She was also able to sustain their everyday needs and other expenses.

For five years, she has also operated a RTW business wherein she sells different types of clothing in retail or wholesale. She would like to apply for another PHP 25,000 loan which she will utilize to buy additional supplies of products needed in her businesses. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her daily needs and provide for a business education. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Candelaria hopes for good health and a long life for her family. She also dreams to grow and expand her business. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different snacks and biscuits needed in her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32-years-old and married with four children, who are all in school. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, snack foods, sardines and other groceries. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plated jewelry like earrings, bracelets, rings, and chains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help her coffee crops.

loans.name: Lidia Maribel

texts.es: Lidia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su esposo quien trabaja como albañil, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que tiene y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Lidia está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería como: sopas, granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes, y poder tener mejores ingresos para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Lidia is 39 years old and lives in a house that she owns. She lives with her daughter. and her husband who works as a builder. Lidia has a small shop in her home. She has many customers because of the variety of products that she offers, and the good prices. With help from her husband, Lidia uses profits to cover household costs. Lidia is applying for this loan in order to buy more merchandise such as soups, basic grains, sugar, sweets, soft drinks and more. With this loan Lidia can offer her customers better service and can earn a higher income in order to enjoy a higher quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, sugar, sweets, soft drinks and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanised laminate sheeting, wood and nails, in order to build a roof on her home.

loans.name: Salde

texts.en: Salde earns a living through her fishing activities. She is 34 years old, married from Danao, Plaridel. Salde earns well doing this type of work. She sells the catch of her husband in the neighborhood. Recently, Salde has asked for a loan to purchase additional fishing net. By adding another fishing net, she would help them increase their catch. Salde is thankful that she is a member of PMPC as her financing partner.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.
